27.Fode Drame: And relate that which has been revealed unto you from the book of your Lord. There is no one to change His words and you will never find any refuge besides Him.

28.Fode Drame: And keep yourself patient along with those who call their Lord in the morning and in the evening and they seek His face and do not let your eyes look past them that you seek the adornment of the life of this world and do not obey one whose heart We have caused to be oblivious about Our remembrance and he follows his vain desires and his affair has gone beyond redemption.

29.Fode Drame: And say, “The truth is from your Lord so whoever pleases, let him believe and whoever pleases, let him disbelieve. We certainly have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire and its walls will encompass them. When they will seek water, they will be given a water which is like molten brass it scales the faces. What a woeful drink and what an evil resting place”

30.Fode Drame: Truly those who believe and do righteous deeds, We will certainly do not suffer the reward of one who acts in excellence, to go in vain.

31.Fode Drame: It is they for whom will be gardens of everlasting felicity, beneath them the rivers flow and they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and they will wear green garments of fine silk and of brocade, reclining therein on couches. How goodly is the reward and how excellent is the resting place.

32.Fode Drame: And set forth for them a parable of two men. For one of them We made two gardens of grapes and We surrounded both of them with date trees and between the two We made a field of crops.

33.Fode Drame: Each of the gardens brought forth its produce and did not hold back anything from it and We caused a river to gush forth through both of them.

34.Fode Drame: And he had fruits [of different kinds]. So he said to his companion while he conversed with him, “I am more than you in wealth and I am mightier than you in entourage.”

35.Fode Drame: And he entered his garden while he was wrongful to his own soul. He said, “I do not think that this is going to perish ever

36.Fode Drame: Nor do I think that the hour is going to come and if ever I am brought back to my Lord, I will most certainly find a better place of return than it.

37.Fode Drame: And his companion said to him as he conversed with him, “Do you disbelieve in the One who created you from dust and then from liquid and then formed you into a complete man.

38.Fode Drame: Nay! As for me He is Allah my Lord and I do not ascribe to my Lord any else as a partner

39.Fode Drame: If only when you entered your garden you had said, ’let it be as Allah pleases. There is no power except through Allah’. If you do see that I am less than you in wealth and in children

40.Fode Drame: Thus it may well be that perhaps my Lord will give me something better than your garden and may send against it fire-bolts from the heaven and thus it turns into a slippery tract of sand

41.Fode Drame: Or that its water may become sunken into the earth and you will never be able to retrieve it again.”

42.Fode Drame: And his fruit was encompassed with destruction therefore he began to turn his hands upside and down [in remorse] over that which he had spent in it as it lay thrown head down and he says, “Woe unto me! [I wish] I had never ascribed any else as a partner with my Lord.”

43.Fode Drame: And there was no group of people to help him besides Allah nor was he able to help himself.

44.Fode Drame: Thereupon [he realized] that the commandment belongs to Allah the Truth. He is the best as a reward and best as a place of ending.

45.Fode Drame: And set forth for them the parable of the life of this world which is like a water that We send down from the heaven and then the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and then it turns dry and the winds scatter it. Truly Allah is the One who has enforcing power over everything.

46.Fode Drame: The wealth and the children are adornment of the life of this world. But the things that are righteous and sustaining are better in reward in the sight of your Lord and are better in hope.

47.Fode Drame: On the day when We will cause the mountains to move away and then you will see the earth level and We will gather them and We will not leave a single one of them.

48.Fode Drame: And they will be presented to your Lord in ranks [and it will be said to them] “Truly you have come to Us in the manner in which We created you the first time. Nay! You had claimed that We will never appoint for you a time and place of meeting with Us”.

49.Fode Drame: And the book will be set forth and then you will see the evildoers apprehensive of that which is in it and they will say, “Woe unto us! What is the matter with this book it leaves nothing small or big but makes a full record of it.” And they will find what they had done all brought forth and your Lord does not wrong a single one of them.

50.Fode Drame: And when We said to the angels, “Bow down for Adam” forthright they all bowed down except Iblis who was from the Jinn folk so He renegaded against the commandment of his Lord. Will you then take him and his progeny as allies instead of Me even though they are your enemy? What a woeful substitute for the wrongdoers.

51.Fode Drame: I did not make them witness the creation of the heavens and of the earth nor the creation of their own souls and I am not going to take those that misguide others as helpers.

52.Fode Drame: On the day when He would say, “Call My partners which you have claimed, then they call them but they will not respond to them and We placed between them an abyss of destruction.”

53.Fode Drame: And the evildoers will see the fire and will think that they are going to fall in it and they will find no place of escape from it.

54.Fode Drame: And We have presented in this Quran of every kind of similitude in various ways for the mankind but yet the human being of all things is the most contentious.

55.Fode Drame: What else prevents human beings from believing after the guidance has come to them and from seeking the forgiveness of their Lord except that may come to them the fate of the past nations or that the punishment may come to them face to face.

56.Fode Drame: And We do not send the messengers except as bringers of glad tidings and as warners but those who disbelieve argue with the falsehood with a view of refuting the truth by it and they take My signs [of glad tidings] and that of which they are warned as a matter of jest.

57.Fode Drame: And who does a greater wrong than one who has been reminded about the signs of his Lord but he turns away from them and forgets all that both his hands have sent forth. Truly We have placed a covering on their hearts so they will not discern it and in their ears a heavy weight. And if you call them to the guidance, even then they will never find guidance ever.

58.Fode Drame: And your Lord is The Oft-Forgiving , The Possessor of mercy. Were He to call them to account for all that which they have perpetrated, He most certainly will hasten the punishment for them. Nay for them there is an appointed time and place from which they will never find an escape.

59.Fode Drame: And those cities We destroyed them when they wronged their own souls and We appointed a place and a time for their destruction.

60.Fode Drame: And when Moses said to his attendant, “I will not desist until I reach the meeting place of the two seas or I will spend ages in my quest.”

61.Fode Drame: But when they two reached the meeting place of the two, they forgot their fish, so he took his way into the sea stealthily.

62.Fode Drame: After they two had passed [the meeting place of the two seas] he said to his servant, “Bring our lunch to us. We have indeed suffered lot of fatigue from this journey of ours.”

63.Fode Drame: He said, “See you that when we retired ourselves to the rock, I did forget about the fish and nothing made me forget to remember it except Satan and it took its way into the ocean miraculously.”

64.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “That was what we were seeking after. So they turned back following their own traces.”

65.Fode Drame: They two found a servant from Our servants unto whom We had granted mercy from Our presence and We had taught him knowledge from Our presence.

66.Fode Drame: Moses said to him, “May I follow you so that you may teach me from that which you have been taught from guidance [to the right way]?”

67.Fode Drame: He said, “Truly you will never be able to have patience with me

68.Fode Drame: And how can you have patience about something you have no original acquaintance with.”

69.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “You will find me patient if Allah pleases and I will not disobey any of your commandment.”

70.Fode Drame: He said, “Then if you do follow me, do not ask me about anything until I bring you a new remembrance from it.”

71.Fode Drame: So they both continued their travel until they came onboard the ship then he cracked it. He [Moses] said, “Have you cracked it so that you may drown its people? You have indeed committed something dreadful.

72.Fode Drame: He said, “Did I not say that you will never be able to have patience with me?”

73.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “Do not hold against me for that which I forgot and do not raise difficulty for me out of my affair.”

74.Fode Drame: Then they both continued their journey until they met a boy and he killed him. He [Moses] said, “Have you killed an innocent life for no other life? You have indeed committed something abominable.”

75.Fode Drame: He said, “Did I not tell you that you will never be able to have patience with me?”

76.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “If I ask you about anything after this then do not keep me in your company. You have indeed exhausted all excuses from me.”

77.Fode Drame: Then they both continued their journey until they came to a townspeople and they sought food from the people thereof but they refused to give them any hospitality, then they found therein a wall which was about to fall and he raised it up. He [Moses] said, “If you so willed you could indeed take a fee for it.”

78.Fode Drame: He said, “This is the parting between me and you but I will inform you with regards to the ultimate interpretation of that about which you were unable to have patience.

79.Fode Drame: As for the ship, it belonged to some poor men who work in the sea so I wanted to flaw it because beyond them there was a king who confiscates every ship by force.

80.Fode Drame: And as for the boy, his parents were believers so we feared that he will compel them towards transgression and disbelief.

81.Fode Drame: So we wanted that their Lord will give them a replacement [with a child] better than him in purity and closer in mercy.”

82.Fode Drame: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphaned boys in the city and there was a treasure beneath it for both of them and their father was a righteous man and your Lord wanted that they reach their age of maturity and they will bring out their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. And I did not do it from my own accord. That is the ultimate interpretation about which you could not have patience.”

83.Fode Drame: And they ask you regarding Zul-Qarnain. Say, “I will relate unto you a remembrance of him.”

84.Fode Drame: We had indeed established him in the earth and We had granted him a way to everything.

85.Fode Drame: So he followed a way

86.Fode Drame: until he reached the setting place of the sun and he found it setting in a murky expanse and he found besides it a people. We said, “O Zul-Qarnain, you may either punish or you may choose to deal with them in a kindly manner.”

87.Fode Drame: He said, “Whosoever does wrong to his own soul [by ascribing partners to Allah], him we shall punish [in this life] and then he will be brought back to his Lord and He will punish him [in the hereafter] with an untold punishment.”

88.Fode Drame: And as for the one who believes and acts with righteous deeds, for him there is the excellence as a reward and We shall impart to him from our commandment a word of ease.

89.Fode Drame: Then he followed a way

90.Fode Drame: until he reached the rising place of the sun and he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no covering other than it [sun].

91.Fode Drame: Thus it was and We had already encompassed any news about him from the beginning.

92.Fode Drame: Then he followed a way

93.Fode Drame: until he reached between the two mountain barriers and he found between them a people who scarcely discerned any speech.

94.Fode Drame: They said, “O Zul-Qarnain, truly Gog and Magog are spreaders of corruption in the earth. Should we pay a tribute to you so that you can place between us and them a barrier?”

95.Fode Drame: He said, “That in which my Lord has established me is better [than your tribute] so therefore give me help with your manpower so that I can place between you and them a strong barrier.

96.Fode Drame: Bring me bars of iron.” Until when he placed it levelled between the two mountains he said, “Blow on it” until when he turned it into a fire, he said, “Bring me molten brass so that I can pour on it.”

97.Fode Drame: Thus they were neither able to surmount it nor were they able to dig through it from beneath.

98.Fode Drame: He said, “This is a mercy from my Lord but when the promise of my Lord comes to term, He will make it [the barrier] levelled with the earth and truly the promise of my Lord is true.”

99.Fode Drame: And We left some of them on that day to mingle with others and when the trumpet is blown then We collect them altogether.

100.Fode Drame: And We will present hell on that day to the disbelievers with a full presentation.

101.Fode Drame: They [the disbelievers] whose eyes were in a covering from My remembrance and they were not able to hear.

102.Fode Drame: Do those who disbelieve think that they could take My slaves as allies besides Me. Truly We have readied hell as a welcoming home for the disbelievers.

103.Fode Drame: Say, “Shall we inform you with regards to those who are most in loss in what they do?

104.Fode Drame: They whose efforts have gone in vain in the life of this world while they think that they are performing an excellent work.”

105.Fode Drame: They are the ones who disbelieve in the signs of their Lord and in the meeting with Him, so their deeds were brought to naught so We will establish no weight for them on the day of resurrection.

106.Fode Drame: That is hell, their reward, for that they disbelieved and that they took My signs and My messengers as a matter of jest.

107.Fode Drame: Indeed as for those who believe and did righteous deeds truly the gardens of Firdaus will be their welcoming home.

108.Fode Drame: To abide therein forever and they will seek no alternative place of dwelling besides it.

109.Fode Drame: Say, “If the sea was but an ink for the words of my Lord, the sea most certainly will exhaust before that the words of my Lord exhaust even if We bring another sea to reinforce it.”

110.Fode Drame: Say, “I am but a human the best model for you and I am divinely inspired. Truly your deity is only one deity and whoever looks forward to meeting his Lord, let him therefore do righteous deed and ascribe none as partner in the worship of his Lord.”

1.Fode Drame: Kaaf. Ha. Ya. 'Ain. Sad.

2.Fode Drame: Mercy of your Lord remembering His slave Zachariah.

3.Fode Drame: When he called His Lord with a calling which was hidden.

4.Fode Drame: He said, “O My Lord, my bone has become feeble and my head is all ablaze with grey but never was I unfortunate in calling you O my Lord.

5.Fode Drame: And I indeed am concerned about my kinsfolk after me and my wife indeed is barren, therefore gift me from your presence a successor

6.Fode Drame: who will inherit me [in knowledge and prophethood] and inherit from the family of Jacob and make him O My Lord one that You are well pleased with.

7.Fode Drame: O Zachariah! We give you glad tidings of a boy his name is Yahaya. Never did We appoint any namesake for him before”

8.Fode Drame: He said, “O My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife has indeed been barren and I have indeed reached a decrepit old age?”

9.Fode Drame: He said, “Even so as Your Lord said that is easy for me. I indeed created you before when you were nothing.”

10.Fode Drame: He said, “O My Lord appoint for me a sign.” He said, “Your sign will be that you will not speak with men for three complete nights.”

11.Fode Drame: So he came out to his people from the sanctuary and signified to them that glorify [your Lord] in the morning and in the evening.

12.Fode Drame: “O Yahaya! Hold the book with all your strength and We had given him the wisdom while still a child.

13.Fode Drame: And [was granted] tenderness from Our presence and purity and he was reverent to Allah.

14.Fode Drame: And kind to his parents and never was he overbearing, disobedient.

15.Fode Drame: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he will be raised alive.

16.Fode Drame: And mention in the book Mary when she withdrew herself from her family to a place in the east.

17.Fode Drame: So she secluded herself from them and then We sent Our spirit to her and he presented himself to her in the form of a complete human.

18.Fode Drame: She said, “I truly seek refuge in The All-merciful from you even though you be Allah revering.”

19.Fode Drame: He said, “I am but a messenger of Your Lord [He sent me] so that I may give to you a son most pure.”

20.Fode Drame: She said, “How can I have a son when no human has ever touched me and I have never been unchaste.”

21.Fode Drame: He said, “Even so has Your Lord said that is easy for Me and that We may appoint him as a sign for the humankind and a mercy from Us. This was a matter already decreed.”

22.Fode Drame: Thereupon she conceived him and then she withdrew herself with him to an exalted place.

23.Fode Drame: Then the throes of childbirth brought her to the trunk of the date tree. She said, “Woe me! Would that I had died before this and I were a thing completely forgotten.”

24.Fode Drame: Thereupon he [the angel] called her from beneath her that, “Grieve not for indeed Your Lord has caused a rivulet to run beneath you.

25.Fode Drame: And shake the trunk of the date tree towards you and it will drop for you fresh ripe dates.

26.Fode Drame: So eat and drink and let your eye be pleased. If you ever see anyone of the humans then say, “I have vowed to fast for The All-merciful and I shall never speak today to any human being.”

27.Fode Drame: Then she brought him to her people carrying him. They said, “O Mary! You have indeed done something very daring.

28.Fode Drame: O sister of Aaron! Your father was not an evil man nor was your mother an unchaste woman.”

29.Fode Drame: Thereupon she pointed to him. They said, “How can we speak to one who is as yet a baby in the cradle?”

30.Fode Drame: He said, “I am a slave of Allah and He has given me the book and He has made me a prophet”

31.Fode Drame: ”and He has made me blessed wheresoever I may be and He has admonished me to prayer and to self-purification as long as I am alive”

32.Fode Drame: ”and He has made me kind to my mother and has not made me overbearing, miserable”

33.Fode Drame: ”and [the greeting of] the peace was on me the day I was born and the day that I die and the day that I will be raised a living.”

34.Fode Drame: That was Jesus son of Mary the word of the truth about which they continue to be in confusion.

35.Fode Drame: It is not befitting for Allah to take a son for Himself. Glory be to Him. Whenever He decrees an affair, He but says to it, “Be” and it is.

36.Fode Drame: And truly [Jesus says] “Allah is My Lord and Your Lord therefore worship Him. This is the most upright way”.

37.Fode Drame: But the sects disagreed among themselves and woe unto those who disbelieve from the encountering of an awful day.

38.Fode Drame: How well they hear and how well they see on the day they will come to Us but the wrongdoers today [in this worldly life] are in manifest error [for they cannot hear nor see].

39.Fode Drame: And warn them of the day of remorsefulness when the matter will be decreed while they are [now] in forgetfulness and nor do they believe.

40.Fode Drame: Truly it is Us who will inherit the earth and all who are on it and to Us they will be returned.

41.Fode Drame: And mention in the book Abraham. He indeed was a sincere believer, a prophet.

42.Fode Drame: When he said to his father, “O my father, why do you worship that which hears not and sees not nor can it avail you in aught?

43.Fode Drame: O my father, something from the knowledge has indeed come to me that has not come to you therefore follow me and I will guide you to a way which is midmost.

44.Fode Drame: O my father, do not serve Satan. Truly Satan was rebellious against Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful].

45.Fode Drame: O my father! I fear that a punishment from Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] touches you and then you become an ally for Satan.”

46.Fode Drame: He said, “Do you dislike my gods, O Abraham! If you do not desist I will most certainly stone you to death so leave me for a long while.”

47.Fode Drame: He said, “Peace be on you. I shall ask My Lord forgiveness for you for He has always been welcoming to me”

48.Fode Drame: ”and I will part from you and from all that you invoke besides Allah and I will invoke My Lord perhaps I shall not be unfortunate in calling on My Lord.”

49.Fode Drame: So when he parted from them and from all that they worshipped besides Allah, We granted unto him Isaac and Jacob and each of them We made a prophet.

50.Fode Drame: And We granted unto them something from Our mercy and We appointed for them a sincere exalted tongue.

51.Fode Drame: And mention in the book Moses. He indeed was a chosen one and he was a messenger and a prophet.

52.Fode Drame: And We called on him from right side of [the mountain of] Toor and We drew him near for a secret communion.

53.Fode Drame: And out of Our mercy We granted him his brother Aaron as a prophet.

54.Fode Drame: And mention in the book Ishmael. He indeed was sincere in his promise and he was a messenger and a prophet.

55.Fode Drame: And he used to command his family to the prayer and to the self-purification and he was one well pleased with in the eyes of His Lord.

56.Fode Drame: And mention in the book Idris. He indeed was a sincere believer and a prophet.

57.Fode Drame: And We raised him to an exalted station.

58.Fode Drame: Those are the ones Allah bestowed His blessing on them from among the prophets from the descendants of Adam and from those We carried [in the ark] with Noah and from the descents of Abraham and of Israel and from those We guided and We chose. Whenever the signs of Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] are related unto them they fall prostrate and weeping.

59.Fode Drame: So after them came the evil successors who neglected the prayer and they pursued their vain desires. They in turn will meet the pit of Ghayyi.

60.Fode Drame: Except one who repents and believes and act righteous deeds. Truly they will enter the garden and they will not be cheated a thing.

61.Fode Drame: The gardens of everlasting felicity which Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] has promised to His servants from the unseen. So truly His promise is going to be fulfilled.

62.Fode Drame: They will hear no foul talk therein except the word of peace and their provision is given to them therein morning and evening.

63.Fode Drame: That is the garden which We give as inheritance to one who guards his own soul from among Our slaves.

64.Fode Drame: And we do not descend except by the command of Your Lord and for Him is all that is in front of us and all that is behind us and all that is between those two and Your Lord is never susceptible to forgetting.

65.Fode Drame: Lord of the heavens and of the earth and what is between the two therefore worship Him and be patient in worshipping Him. Do you know of any namesake for Him?

66.Fode Drame: And the human being says, “When I am dead, will I in time be brought back alive?”

67.Fode Drame: But does not the human being remember that We created him before when he was nothing.

68.Fode Drame: So by Your Lord, We shall most certainly gather them and the devils and then We will most certainly bring them kneeling around the hellfire.

69.Fode Drame: Then We will most certainly pull out from every sect those ones who were the most obstinate in [their] transgression against Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful].

70.Fode Drame: Then certainly We know best those who are most deserving to be burnt therein.

71.Fode Drame: And there is not one among you but that he must come upon it. That was a decree most binding on Your Lord.

72.Fode Drame: Then We will save all those who guarded their own souls against wrong doings and We will leave the wrongdoers therein kneeling.

73.Fode Drame: And whenever Our signs are related unto them clearly, those who disbelieve will say to those who believe, “Which of the two parties is better in station and more excellent in entourage?”

74.Fode Drame: And how many a generation before them have We destroyed who were better furnished and better looking.

75.Fode Drame: Say, “Whoever continues to be in the misguidance, Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] will relent towards him with utmost relenting” until when they see that which they were promised either the punishment or the hour. They will then know who is worse in station and weaker in soldiery.”

76.Fode Drame: And Allah will increase those who have attained to guidance in guidance. And the good deeds that remain are better in the sight of Your Lord as a reward and better as a place of return.

77.Fode Drame: Have you ever seen the one who disbelieved in Our signs and said, “Most certainly I will be given wealth and children.”

78.Fode Drame: Has he espied the unseen or has he taken a covenant with Ar-Rahman (The All-merciful)?

79.Fode Drame: Nay! We shall record all that he says and We shall lengthen for him the punishment a complete lengthening.

80.Fode Drame: And We will make him inherit all that he says and he will come to Us all alone.

81.Fode Drame: They have taken deities besides Allah so that they may be a might for them.

82.Fode Drame: Nay! They shall deny their worship for them and they will turn against them.

83.Fode Drame: Have you not seen that We have let loose the devils against the disbelievers and spur them continuously.

84.Fode Drame: So do not be in haste over them. We have only counted for them a little number [of days].

85.Fode Drame: The day We shall gather those who guard themselves unto Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] as honored guests.

86.Fode Drame: And we shall drive the evildoers unto hell weary and worn out.

87.Fode Drame: They will have no power of intercession except one who has secured unto himself a solemn covenant with Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful]

88.Fode Drame: And they say, “Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] has taken unto Himself a son”

89.Fode Drame: You have indeed come along with a matter most objectionable.

90.Fode Drame: The heavens well-nigh rend into pieces because of it and the earth parts [into two] and the mountains come down crashing

91.Fode Drame: that they claim a son for Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful].

92.Fode Drame: And it is not befitting for Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] to take unto Himself a son.

93.Fode Drame: There is no one among all those in the heavens and in the earth but must come to Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] as a slave.

94.Fode Drame: He has indeed encompassed them and has numbered them exactly.

95.Fode Drame: And each one of them is going to come to Him on the day of resurrection all alone.

96.Fode Drame: Indeed those who believed and did righteous deeds, Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] will make an affection for them.

97.Fode Drame: We have made it [ the Quran] easy through your tongue [O Muhammad] only so that you may bring glad tidings by it to those who revere Allah and only so that you may warn by it a people who are waywardly contentious.

98.Fode Drame: And how many a generation before them have We destroyed! Do you perceive anyone from among them or do you hear any whisper from them?

1.Fode Drame: Ta-Ha

2.Fode Drame: We have not revealed this Quran unto you to cause you misery.

3.Fode Drame: But as a reminder for anyone who has deference [of His Lord].

4.Fode Drame: A revelation from Him who created the earth and the high heavens.

5.Fode Drame: Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] who has spread out His presence on the throne.

6.Fode Drame: Unto Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth and all that is between them and all that is under the ether.

7.Fode Drame: Whether you make aloud your speech [is all the same] for He indeed knows what is secret and what is hidden.

8.Fode Drame: Allah! There is no deity save Him. To Him belong all the excellent names.

9.Fode Drame: Has the story of Moses come to you?

10.Fode Drame: When he saw a fire he said to his family, “Tarry here. I have indeed perceived a fire maybe I can bring you from it a brand or I can find guidance at the fire.

11.Fode Drame: But when he came to it [the fire] he was called upon, “O Moses!

12.Fode Drame: Truly I am your Lord therefore take off your shoes for indeed you are in the sanctimonious valley of Tuwa.

13.Fode Drame: And I have chosen you so listen then to what is being inspired [to you]

14.Fode Drame: Truly, I am Allah. There is no deity except I. Therefore serve Me and establish the prayer for My remembrance.

15.Fode Drame: Truly the hour is coming. I well-nigh hide it so that every soul is rewarded for that which it has endeavored

16.Fode Drame: So do not let one who does not believe in it [the hour] and who has followed his desire hinder you from [remembering] it lest you perish.

17.Fode Drame: And what is that in your right hand O Moses?”

18.Fode Drame: He said, “It is my staff. I lean on it and I beat down leaves with it for my cattle and there are many other uses in it for me.”

19.Fode Drame: He said, “Throw it O Moses!”

20.Fode Drame: So he threw it and behold! it is a snake in real motion.

21.Fode Drame: He said, “Seize it and fear not. We shall bring it back to its former state”

22.Fode Drame: And stick your hand to your side it will come forth white without any blemish, as another sign.

23.Fode Drame: So that We may show you from Our signs the most great.

24.Fode Drame: Go to Pharaoh for he has indeed transgressed.

25.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “O My Lord! Expand my bosom for me.

26.Fode Drame: And ease my affair for me.

27.Fode Drame: And untie a knot from my tongue.

28.Fode Drame: That they may discern my speech.

29.Fode Drame: And appoint for me a helper from my family;

30.Fode Drame: Aaron. My brother.

31.Fode Drame: Buttress my strength through him.

32.Fode Drame: And give him a share in my affair.

33.Fode Drame: So that we may glorify You abundantly.

34.Fode Drame: And remember You abundantly.

35.Fode Drame: For You truly are All-seeing about us”

36.Fode Drame: He said, “Indeed you are granted your request O Moses!”

37.Fode Drame: And indeed once again We have conferred Our favor upon you.

38.Fode Drame: And remember when We inspired to your mother what is inspired.

39.Fode Drame: Saying that, “Cast him [Moses] in the chest and then cast it [the chest] in the sea and let the sea cast him on the bank and an enemy of mine and an enemy of his will take it and I have put over you love from Me so that you are reared under My eyes.

40.Fode Drame: And [remember] when your sister went out and she said [to pharaoh and his people] “Can I show you someone who can nurture him [for you]?” so We returned you back to your mother so that her eye may find coolness and that she grieve not. And [when] you killed a soul, We saved you from distress and We tried you through many trials then you remained among the folk of Madian many years and then you came back as ordained O Moses.”

41.Fode Drame: And I have groomed you for My own self.

42.Fode Drame: Go forth you and your brother with My signs and do not tire both of you in remembering Me.

43.Fode Drame: Go forth both of you to Pharaoh for he indeed has transgressed [against His Lord].

44.Fode Drame: And so both of you speak unto him a gentle word perhaps he may remember or defer to [His Lord].

45.Fode Drame: They both said, “O our Lord, we do fear lest he hastily dispatch us or that he transgresses.”

46.Fode Drame: He said, “Do not fear both of you for truly I am with both of you and I hear and I see.”

47.Fode Drame: Go hence both of you to him and say both of you, “We are messengers of your Lord therefore send with us the children of Israel and do not afflict them with any more punishment. Truly we have come to you with a sign from Your Lord and the peace is on him who follows the guidance.

48.Fode Drame: For we truly have been inspired that the punishment is on him who belies [Allah’s signs] and turns away from it [in arrogance].

49.Fode Drame: He [Pharaoh] said, “who then is the Lord of you two, O Moses?”

50.Fode Drame: He said, “Our Lord is one who gave everything its complete form and then guided it.”

51.Fode Drame: He said, “What then is the case of the former generations?”

52.Fode Drame: He said, “The knowledge of them is with My Lord in a book. My Lord does not err nor does He forget.”

53.Fode Drame: It is He who has made the earth for you like a well laid bed and has traced out for you therein thoroughfares and has sent down from the heaven rain water and with it We brought forth pairs of diverse vegetation.

54.Fode Drame: Eat thereof and graze your cattle. Truly in that indeed are signs for people of understanding.

55.Fode Drame: From it We created you and in it We will return you and from it We will bring you forth once again.

56.Fode Drame: And truly We showed him all of Our signs but he belied them and refused [to submit].

57.Fode Drame: He said, “Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic O Moses?”

58.Fode Drame: We will therefore surely bring unto you a magic like unto it therefore appoint a tryst between us and you which we shall not fail neither us nor you in a place well suitable to all.

59.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “Your tryst shall be the day of the feasting and let the people be gathered at the times of the early hours of the day.”

60.Fode Drame: Thereupon Pharaoh went away and he put together all his plans and then he came.

61.Fode Drame: Moses said to them, “Woe unto you. Do not contrive a lie against Allah lest He eradicate you with a punishment and truly whosoever contrives a lie [against Allah] will be met with frustration.”

62.Fode Drame: So they disputed among them about their affair and they kept their counsel secret.

63.Fode Drame: They said, “These two are surely sorcerers. They intend to drive you out from your land with their magic and [they intend] to do away with your way, the most exemplary.”

64.Fode Drame: Therefore put together your plans and then come forward in a row and whosoever gets the upper hand today surely will prosper.

65.Fode Drame: They said, “O Moses, either you throw or we be the ones who are the first to throw.”

66.Fode Drame: He said, “Nay, you throw” and behold their ropes and their sticks due to their magic was made to appear to him to be in real motion.

67.Fode Drame: So Moses sensed a fear within himself.

68.Fode Drame: We said, “Do not fear truly you are the one who will have the upper hand.

69.Fode Drame: And throw that which is in your right hand it will swallow up all that they have fabricated” and they have fabricated nothing except the tricks of a magician but the magician will not prosper no matter from which way he comes.

70.Fode Drame: The magicians thereupon fell down prostrate and said, “We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses”

71.Fode Drame: He [Pharaoh] said, “Believe you in him before I had given you permission? He certainly is your superior who has taught you the magic. Thus I will most certainly cut your hands and your legs from opposite sides and I will most certainly crucify you on the trunks of palm trees and you will most certainly come to know which of us is capable of inflicting the most severe punishment. [And which of us] will outlast [the other].”

72.Fode Drame: They said, “We shall never prefer you above all that has come to us from the clear signs and above the one who has originated our creation. Therefore decree that which you are going to decree. You can only decree in regards to the life of this world.

73.Fode Drame: We truly believe in our Lord [hoping] that He will forgive us our faults and all that magic that you have compelled us to and Allah is Best and is Most Lasting.”

74.Fode Drame: Truly whoever comes to His Lord as an evildoer, for him indeed is the hell wherein he will not die nor will he live.

75.Fode Drame: But whosoever comes to Him as a believer and has done the righteous deeds indeed for them would be the ranks most high.

76.Fode Drame: Gardens of eternal felicity under which the rivers flow to abide therein forever and that is the reward of the one who sanctifies his soul.

77.Fode Drame: And truly We inspired Moses [saying] that, “Journey forth with My slaves at night and strike for them a dry path through the sea and you will not fear being overtaken and nor will you fear being overwhelmed [with water].”

78.Fode Drame: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his army but they were covered from the sea with that what overwhelmed them.

79.Fode Drame: And Pharaoh led his people astray and he did not guide them.

80.Fode Drame: “O children of Israel! We did save you from your enemy and We have made a tryst with you on the right hand side of the mount of Toor and We sent down manna and salva on you.

81.Fode Drame: Eat from the good things which We have provided you and do not abuse it lest My anger falls upon you and whosoever My anger falls upon, he indeed has fallen down.

82.Fode Drame: And I am truly Most Forgiving to anyone who repents and believes and does a righteous deed and then keeps on the right guidance.

83.Fode Drame: And what caused you to leave your people in haste O Moses?”

84.Fode Drame: He said, “Here they are coming in my footsteps and I hastened to You My Lord so that You may be pleased.”

85.Fode Drame: He [Allah] said, “We indeed have put a test on your people after you and Samiri has led them astray.”

86.Fode Drame: So Moses returned to his people angry and sad. He said, “O my people, has Your Lord not promised to you a goodly promise? Did then the covenant seem far away to you or did you look forward that a punishment descend on you from Your Lord so you broke my appointment?”

87.Fode Drame: They said, “We have not broken your appointment through our own volition but we were burdened with loads of ornaments of the people [Egyptians] so we casted them this is how Samiri casted [in the fire]”

88.Fode Drame: So he brought forth for them a calf with a body and it has a bellowing sound so they said, “This is your god and the god of Moses” but he [Samiri] forgot.

89.Fode Drame: Do they not see that it does not speak back to them a word and does not have control over any harm or any benefit for them?

90.Fode Drame: And Aaron did tell it to them before [the coming of Moses], “O my people, you are only being tested by this and truly Your Lord is Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] therefore follow me and obey my commandment.”

91.Fode Drame: They said, “We will never cease to devoutly worship it [the calf] until Moses comes back to us.”

92.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “O Aaron! What prevented you [from stopping them] when you saw them going astray?

93.Fode Drame: Do you not follow me? Have you disobeyed my commandment?”

94.Fode Drame: He said, “O son of my mother! Do not seize me by my beard nor by my hair. I truly feared lest you say that you have caused a split among the children of Israel and you did not regard my word.”

95.Fode Drame: He said, “What then is your case O Samiri?”

96.Fode Drame: He said, “I saw that which they did not see so I took a handful of the footsteps of the messenger then I cast it [into the calf] and thus has my soul made it seemly for me.”

97.Fode Drame: He said, “Therefore be gone! Then certainly your fate in life is to say, ‘Do not touch [me]’ and truly there is an appointed tryst for you in which you shall never be failed and look at this deity of yours to which you have so devoutly dedicated yourself. We shall most certainly burn it and then scatter [its ashes] in the sea a complete scattering.”

98.Fode Drame: Your only deity is Allah whom there is no deity besides Him. He encompasses everything in [His] knowledge.

99.Fode Drame: Thus We relate unto you some of the news of things that had gone before and We have indeed given unto you a remembrance from Our own presence.

100.Fode Drame: Whosoever turns away from it, he will be the very one who will carry a heavy burden on the day of resurrection.

101.Fode Drame: to abide therein [in that state] forever and how woeful a burden on them on the day of resurrection;

102.Fode Drame: The day when the trumpet will be blown and We will gather [all] the evildoers on that day pale in the eyes.

103.Fode Drame: Whispering among themselves [some say], “You have not tarried in the world but ten days.”

104.Fode Drame: It is We who know well about what they say when the one among them who is best in position says, “You have tarried [in the world] but a day.”

105.Fode Drame: And they ask you concerning the mountains say, “My Lord will reduce them to dust and scatter them.”

106.Fode Drame: And He will leave it [the earth] like a plain all level.

107.Fode Drame: You will see no curve in it nor a bump.

108.Fode Drame: That day they will follow the caller in whom there is no crookedness and all the voices are hushed for Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] and you will hear nothing but whispers.

109.Fode Drame: On that day the intercession will avail none except one for whom Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] will have granted permission [to intercede] and He is pleased for him to speak.

110.Fode Drame: He knows what is before them and what is behind them but they do not encompass Him in knowledge.

111.Fode Drame: And humbled will be the faces for The Ever-living, The Upholder of Everything and whosoever bears an offence, he indeed will meet with frustration.

112.Fode Drame: And whosoever does any work from the righteous deeds while he is a believer, he will not have any fear of any offence [against him] nor any cheating.

113.Fode Drame: And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic Quran and We have given in it many facets from the warning so that perhaps they will revere Allah or perhaps it will occasion for them a renewed remembrance.

114.Fode Drame: Far exalted is Allah, The King, The Truth and do not be in haste with the Quran before its revelation to you is consummated and say, “O My Lord, increase me in knowledge.”

115.Fode Drame: And indeed We gave Our assignment to Adam beforetime but he forgot and We did not find in him a firm resolution.

116.Fode Drame: And when We said to the angels, “Prostrate yourselves for Adam” so they did prostrate themselves except Iblis he refused [out of arrogance].

117.Fode Drame: So We said, “O Adam, this [Iblis] is an enemy for you and for your spouse so beware lest he drives the two of you out of the garden and then you will be in misery.”

118.Fode Drame: It is given that in this [garden] you will not go hungry nor naked

119.Fode Drame: and nor will you go thirsty therein nor suffer from the sunlight.

120.Fode Drame: So Satan whispered to him he said, “O Adam, may I show you the tree of eternal life and a kingdom that will never decay.”

121.Fode Drame: So they both ate from it and immediately their stark nakedness became apparent to them and they began to sew around themselves [the covering] from the leaves of the garden and Adam disobeyed His Lord so he became constricted.

122.Fode Drame: Thereafter his Lord selected him and accepted his repentance and guided [him].

123.Fode Drame: He said, “Both of you go down from here [the garden] altogether and be [henceforth] enemy unto one another but if ever a guidance comes to you from Me, whosoever follows My guidance, he will not go astray nor will he fall in misery.

124.Fode Drame: But whoever turns away from My remembrance truly for him shall be a constricted livelihood and We will gather him [unto Us] a blind on the day of resurrection.”

125.Fode Drame: He will say [on the day of resurrection], “O My Lord, why have you raised me a blind while I was seeing [in the past life]?”

126.Fode Drame: He will say, “Similarly had Our signs come to you [in the life before] but you forgot them and likewise this day you will be forgotten.”

127.Fode Drame: And thus do We requite one who has transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord and truly the punishment of the hereafter is more severe and more lasting.

128.Fode Drame: Have they not found how many generations before them We destroyed and in whose homes they are walking about now. Truly in that indeed are signs for people of understanding.

129.Fode Drame: Had it not been for a sentence and a fixed term already passed by Your Lord, a binding punishment [would certainly have befallen them in this life].

130.Fode Drame: So bear patience over that which they say and glorify the praise of your Lord before the sunrise and before its setting and in hours of the night praise [Him] and as well as in parts of the day perhaps you will be pleased.

131.Fode Drame: And do not stretch your gaze unto that which We have provided to some kinds of them as a temporary enjoyment as a flowering of the life of this world so that We may try them thereby and provision of Your Lord is better and more lasting.

132.Fode Drame: And command your family to the prayer and be steadfast on it. We do not charge you with providing [for yourself and for them]. We provide for you and the good ending is for those who revere Allah.

133.Fode Drame: And they say, “Why does he not bring us a sign from His Lord?” Has not a clarification of all that is in the former books come to them?

134.Fode Drame: And had We destroyed them through a punishment before it [Quran] they would have said, “O Our Lord, if only You had sent unto us a messenger, we would have followed Your signs before we are humiliated and disgraced.”

135.Fode Drame: Say, “Each one [of us] is waiting so wait you [for the final judgment] and you shall soon come to know who is on the path which is even and who is well guided.”

1.Fode Drame: For mankind their reckoning has drawn near but yet they are in obliviousness [about it] while they turn away from it out of disregard.

2.Fode Drame: Nothing comes to them of renewed remembrance from their Lord but that they listen to it while they are sporting.

3.Fode Drame: Their hearts are idle and those who have wronged their own souls hold a secret counsel among themselves saying, “Is this anything but a mortal human like you? Will you then yield to the magic while you see plainly?”

4.Fode Drame: He said, “My Lord knows the speech in the heaven and in the earth and He is The All-hearing, The All-knowing.”

5.Fode Drame: Nay they said, “It is but jumbled up dreams. Nay he contrived it. Nay he is a poet. Let him then bring a sign unto us in the like manner that the messengers of the former times were sent [with signs]”

6.Fode Drame: None of the townships that We had destroyed before them believed. Are they going to believe?

7.Fode Drame: We never sent before you except men whom We inspired. Therefore ask the people of remembrance if you do not know.

8.Fode Drame: And We did not make them physical beings that do not eat food nor were they to abide forever [in this world].

9.Fode Drame: Then We fulfilled the promise to them so We saved them and whom We pleased and We destroyed the ones who wasted their own souls.

10.Fode Drame: Indeed We have revealed unto you a book wherein is your remembrance. Will you then not understand?

11.Fode Drame: And how many a township that was bent on wrongdoing have We crushed and We raised after them other people.

12.Fode Drame: When they felt Our fury close to them, behold here they are, running away from it (the township).

13.Fode Drame: Do not run away but return to all that in which you revelled [before] and to your dwellings so that you might be called to account.

14.Fode Drame: They said, “Woe unto us. We indeed were wrongdoers.”

15.Fode Drame: And that never ceased to be their cry until We made them like a harvested field, utterly lifeless.

16.Fode Drame: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and what is between them in playful sport.

17.Fode Drame: If it had been Our design to take unto Ourselves an idle leisure, We certainly would have taken it from Our presence if We were going to do so.

18.Fode Drame: Nay We cast with the truth against the falsehood and it [the truth] knocks it out completely and behold it [the falsehood] is dismantled and the woe unto you for all that you attribute [to Allah].

19.Fode Drame: And to Him belongs whosoever is in the heavens and in the earth and those who are in His presence do not feel arrogant to serve Him and nor do they get weary [of serving Him].

20.Fode Drame: They glorify across the day and across the night, they do not slack

21.Fode Drame: Or have they taken gods from the earth who raise the dead?

22.Fode Drame: If there were in them other deities besides Allah then both of them would have fallen into corruption. Therefore glorified be Allah, Lord of the throne from all that they attribute [to Him].

23.Fode Drame: He is not questioned for whatever He does but they will be questioned.

24.Fode Drame: Or have they taken besides Him other gods? Say, “Bring along your clear proof. This is remembrance of those with me and remembrance of those from before me. Nay! Most of them do not know the truth but yet they turn away in arrogance.”

25.Fode Drame: And We did not send a messenger before you but We inspired him [to know] that there is no other deity except I, therefore worship Me [alone].

26.Fode Drame: And they say, “Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] has taken unto Himself a son.” Glorified be He [from what they attribute to Him] Nay! [the angels] are but servants honored with grace.

27.Fode Drame: They do not go ahead of Him in speech and they work according to His command.

28.Fode Drame: He knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them and they do not intercede except for one He is pleased [to intercede] while they out of deference for Him are concerned for themselves.

29.Fode Drame: And whosoever among them says, “I am a deity besides Him” that very one shall We reward with hellfire. Thus do We reward those who wrong their own souls.

30.Fode Drame: Do those who disbelieve not perceive that the heavens and the earth both used to be locked together then We unlocked both of them and from the water We made every living thing. Will they not then believe?

31.Fode Drame: And We placed in the earth mountains lest it oscillates with them and in it We made there broad spaces as ways so that they may find guidance [in their journey].

32.Fode Drame: And We have raised up the firmament as a roof well-guarded, yet they turn away from its [firmament’s] signs [in arrogance].

33.Fode Drame: It is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon, each coursing in an orbit.

34.Fode Drame: And We did not grant unto any human before you eternal life [of this world] so then if you die, are they going to live forever?

35.Fode Drame: Every soul is going to taste the death and We try you through evil and through good as a test and unto Us shall you be returned.

36.Fode Drame: And when those who disbelieve see you, they but take you as a thing of jest [and they say], “Is this the one who makes mention of your deities?” While they disbelieve about the mention of Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful].

37.Fode Drame: Human being was created out of haste. I shall in time show you My signs therefore do not ask Me to hasten them.

38.Fode Drame: And they say, “When will this promise be fulfilled if you are indeed sincere?”

39.Fode Drame: If only those who disbelieved knew that a time will come when they will not be able to ward off the fire from their faces nor from their backs and they will not be helped.

40.Fode Drame: Nay it will come to them suddenly and will confound them and then they will not be able to push it back nor will they be looked at.

41.Fode Drame: Messengers before you were indeed derided but those who mocked at them were overtaken by that with which they used to deride.

42.Fode Drame: Say, “Who could protect you by the night and by the day from Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful]?” Nay but they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.

43.Fode Drame: Or do they have deities who can defend them from Us? They [the deities] cannot help themselves nor will they be protected from Us.

44.Fode Drame: Nay We have caused these and their fathers to enjoy until the lifespan felt too long for them. Do they not see that We come at the earth and We reduce it from its sides? Will they then be the victors [against Us]?

45.Fode Drame: Say, “I only warn you by what is inspired” but the deaf will not hear the call even when they are being warned.

46.Fode Drame: But if a breath from the punishment of your Lord was to touch them, they would most certainly say, “Woe unto us we indeed were those who used to wrong their own souls.”

47.Fode Drame: And We will set up the scales which are just on the day of resurrection so that no soul is cheated of anything and even if it were but the weight of a single seed of mustard [as a good or bad deed] We will certainly bring it forth and We suffice as reckoners.

48.Fode Drame: And indeed We granted unto Moses and Aaron the criterion and a brilliant light and a remembrance for those who revere Allah.

49.Fode Drame: Those who defer to their Lord from the unseen and who are concerned about the hour.

50.Fode Drame: And this is a most blessed remembrance which We have revealed. Are you then going to deny it?

51.Fode Drame: And We had indeed given unto Abraham his criterion before and We encompass him in Our knowledge.

52.Fode Drame: When he said to his father and to his people, “What are these images to which you are so avowedly devoted?”

53.Fode Drame: They said, “We found our fathers worshipping them.”

54.Fode Drame: He said, “Then you and your fathers were indeed in a manifest error.”

55.Fode Drame: They said, “Have you come to us with the truth or are you one of those who sport?”

56.Fode Drame: He said, “Nay your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth who originated their creation and I am among the witnesses to that

57.Fode Drame: and by Allah I will most certainly discomfit your idols with my scheme after you turn your backs away.”

58.Fode Drame: So he broke them into pieces except the biggest of them so that they might return to it.

59.Fode Drame: They said, “Who has done this to our gods? He indeed is of those who are wrongful.”

60.Fode Drame: They said, “We heard a young man called Abraham speak [ill] of them.”

61.Fode Drame: They said, “Then bring him under the eyes of the people perhaps they will witness.”

62.Fode Drame: They said, “Is it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?”

63.Fode Drame: He said, “Nay it was done by this the biggest one among them then ask them if they can speak.”

64.Fode Drame: So they returned back to their own souls therefore they said, “Truly you yourself are doing wrong to your own souls.”

65.Fode Drame: Then they reverted back to their former position [and said], “You know indeed that these cannot speak.”

66.Fode Drame: He said, “Do you then worship besides Allah something that can neither benefit you in aught nor can it harm you?

67.Fode Drame: Fie on you and on those that you worship besides Allah. Will you not then understand?”

68.Fode Drame: They said, “Burn him and give victory to your gods if you are going to do something.”

69.Fode Drame: We said, “O fire! Be cool and peace upon Abraham.”

70.Fode Drame: And they attempted to discomfit him through their scheme but We caused them to be the biggest losers.

71.Fode Drame: And We saved him and Lot to the land in which We have made blessings for the peoples.

72.Fode Drame: And We gifted unto him Isaac and also Jacob as an additional gift and all of them We made them righteous.

73.Fode Drame: And We made them leaders who find guidance through Our command and We inspired them to do the deeds of grace and to establish the prayer and to give out the sanctifying dues and they used to serve Us devotedly.

74.Fode Drame: And unto Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge and We saved him from the town which used to practice the abominations. Truly they were people who were evil and who trespassed against Our commandment.

75.Fode Drame: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Truly he was of the righteous.

76.Fode Drame: And Noah too when he called out aforetime and We responded to him and We saved him and his family from the great strain.

77.Fode Drame: And We made him victorious over the people who belied Our signs. Truly they were an evil people so We drowned them altogether.

78.Fode Drame: And David and Solomon when they both gave judgment about the field into which the cattle of the people grazed in over the night and We were witnesses to their judgment.

79.Fode Drame: And We gave insight in the case to Solomon and to both of them We had given wisdom and knowledge. And through our command We caused the mountains and the birds to celebrate the glories of Allah with David and it is Us truly who were the doers.

80.Fode Drame: And We taught him the making of armored dresses for you to protect you from your fury. Are you then going to be thankful?

81.Fode Drame: And for Solomon [We caused] the wind to blow running by his commandment to the land in which We have placed our blessings and We indeed were All-knowing about everything.

82.Fode Drame: And from the rebellious Jinns were those who dived for him and they used to do deeds other than that and it was Us who kept the guard over them.

83.Fode Drame: And Job when he called out to his Lord [saying that], “Truly the adversity has touched me and You are The Most Merciful of those who are merciful.”

84.Fode Drame: And We responded to him and We removed whatever adversity that was on him and We gave unto him his family and the like of them with them, a mercy from Our presence and a reminder for the true servants.

85.Fode Drame: And Ishmael and Idris and zul-kifl; all among steadfastly patient.

86.Fode Drame: And We admitted them into Our mercy for they truly were of the righteous.

87.Fode Drame: And zun-noon (the man of the whale) when he went in anger he thought that We will never constrict him so he called from the darknesses saying that, “There is no deity except You. Glory be unto You. Truly I was of those who have done wrong to their own soul.”

88.Fode Drame: So We responded to him and We saved him from the grievous distress and thus do We save the believers.

89.Fode Drame: And Zachariyah when he called unto his Lord, “O my Lord, do not leave me a single and you are the best of the inheritors.”

90.Fode Drame: And We responded to him and granted unto him Yahaya and We made good his wife for him. Truly they used to race with one another in the deeds of grace and they used to call on Us out of hope and fear and they were truly humble for Us.

91.Fode Drame: And the lady who guarded her chastity so We breathed into her from Our spirit and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

92.Fode Drame: Truly this is your nation which is one nation and I am your Lord so serve Me alone.

93.Fode Drame: But they tore their matter into pieces among them. All of them are going to return to Us.

94.Fode Drame: Whoever does anything from the righteous deeds while he is a believer, truly his hard work will not be denied and We are going to write it for him.

95.Fode Drame: So it is ordained that there will not be a single town that We have destroyed that it will not return back to us.

96.Fode Drame: Until when Gog and Magog will be let loose and they will be sweeping down from every direction.

97.Fode Drame: And the true promise has now drawn near thereupon the gaze of those who disbelieved is fixed in a stare and they say, “Woe unto us we indeed were oblivious about this. Nay we were of those who used to wrong their own souls.”

98.Fode Drame: You indeed and that what you worship besides Allah are but the fuel of hellfire and you are going to be flocked unto it.

99.Fode Drame: If these were deities they would not have flocked therein and all of them are going to abide therein forever.

100.Fode Drame: They make lamentations therein but since they are in it, they do not hear [anything].

101.Fode Drame: Truly as for those for whom Our words of good promise had gone forth they are going to be removed far from it.

102.Fode Drame: They will not hear its hissings while they abide forever in that which their souls desire.

103.Fode Drame: The greatest terror will not cause them grief and the angels will meet them with welcomes [saying]. “This is your day which you were promised.”

104.Fode Drame: The day We will roll up the heaven like the way a scroll is rolled over the books. As We started its creation the first time, We will repeat it [a second time] that is a promise on Us and We surely are going to put it into effect.

105.Fode Drame: And We indeed wrote in the psalms after the remembrance that the earth, it will be inherited by My righteous servants.

106.Fode Drame: Truly in this there is a clear message for a people who are true servants.

107.Fode Drame: And We have not sent you except as a mercy for the worlds.

108.Fode Drame: Say, “All that I am inspired [to know] is that your God is only one God. Are you then going to submit?”

109.Fode Drame: And if they turn away then say, “I inform you all the same. However I do not know whether it is near or far that which you are promised.”

110.Fode Drame: He truly knows what is made open from the speech and knows what you conceal.

111.Fode Drame: And I do not know either whether it might be a trial for you and an enjoyment for a little while.

112.Fode Drame: He said, “O my Lord! Judge with the truth” and our Lord Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] is the one whose help is to be sought against all that you attribute falsely [to him].”

1.Fode Drame: O humankind! Revere your Lord. Truly the convulsions of the hour is a tremendous thing.

2.Fode Drame: The day you will see it [you will see that] every nursing [mother] will forget about that which it is nursing and everyone who is carrying a load will lay down her load and you will see the human beings inebriant but they are not inebriant but it is Allah’s punishment which is formidable.

3.Fode Drame: And from mankind are those who argue about Allah without knowledge and follow every wayward Satan.

4.Fode Drame: Upon him [Satan] it is written that whosoever takes him as an ally, he indeed is going to misguide him and will guide him to the punishment of the blazing fire.

5.Fode Drame: O humankind! If you are in doubt concerning the resurrection Lo! We have created you from dust, then from liquid, then from a clot of blood, then from a piece of flesh fully formed and not fully formed so that We may show you and then We cause to stay in the wombs that which We please to an appointed term. Then We bring you forth as babes so that you may attain the full strength of your growth. And among you are those whose souls are taken [in infancy] but also among you are those who are brought back to the most abject of the age so that after knowing he comes to know nothing. And you see the earth lifeless but when We send down the water on it Lo! It begins to shake and swell and bring forth a beautiful pair from every kind of plant

6.Fode Drame: That is so because Allah is the truth and that He is the one who gives life to the dead and that He it is who has power over everything.

7.Fode Drame: And that the hour is coming there is no doubt in it and that Allah will raise those who are in the graves.

8.Fode Drame: And among humankind are those who argue about Allah without any knowledge and without any guidance and without an enlightening book.

9.Fode Drame: Turning his neck in arrogance so that he misguide from the path of Allah. For him there will be humiliation in the life of this world and on the day of resurrection We will make him taste the punishment of the burning fire.

10.Fode Drame: This is because of that which your two hands have sent forth and truly Allah is not a doer of wrong to the slaves.

11.Fode Drame: Among men there are such who worship Allah on one side. If good happens to him, his heart is at rest thereby but if trial befalls him, he falls back on his face thus he loses the life of this world and the hereafter. That is the most obvious loss.

12.Fode Drame: He calls besides Allah that which does not harm him neither does it benefit him. That is the misguidance far astray.

13.Fode Drame: He calls on such whose harm is closer than his benefit. Truly woeful is the master and truly woeful is the folk.

14.Fode Drame: Truly Allah will make enter those who believe and did righteous deeds to gardens under which the rivers flow. Truly Allah does that which He wills.

15.Fode Drame: Whoever thinks that Allah will never help him in this life and in the hereafter, let him then extend any other rope to the heaven and then let him cut himself loose and let him see whether his plan will do away with that which is outraging him.

16.Fode Drame: And thus We have sent it down as clear signs and truly Allah guides whom He wills.

17.Fode Drame: Truly those who believe [in the entire book] and those who take guidance from the Torah and the Sabians and the Christians and the Magians and those who ascribe partners to Allah, truly Allah will judge between them on the day of resurrection. Truly Allah is a witness over all things.

18.Fode Drame: Do you not see that it is Allah for whom prostrate whoever is in the heavens and whoever is in the earth and the sun and the moon and the stars and the mountains and the tree and the animals and many from the humankind? But many are those on whom the sentence of punishment has been passed and whoever Allah humiliates, there is no one to honour him. Truly Allah does what He pleases.

19.Fode Drame: These are two contender [groups] contending about their Lord. As for those who disbelieve, for them is cut a garment out of fire and upon their heads will be poured scalding water.

20.Fode Drame: With it melts all that is in their body and all their skins.

21.Fode Drame: And for them there will be rods of iron.

22.Fode Drame: And every time they wish to get out from it out of their agony, they will be turned back in it [and it will be said to them], “Taste you the punishment of burning fire.”

23.Fode Drame: Truly Allah will cause to enter those who believed and did righteous deeds into gardens under which the rivers flow, they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and with pearl and their garment therein will be of silk.

24.Fode Drame: They were guided to the good one from the speech and they were guided to the path of the All-praiseworthy.

25.Fode Drame: Truly those who disbelieve and hinder people from the way of Allah and from the sacred mosque which We have made open to all men, the one who dwells therein, as well as the one from abroad. But whosoever intends to commit an act of perversion therein by ascribing partners to Allah, We will make him taste from a painful punishment.

26.Fode Drame: And when We designated for Abraham the place for the house [and We said to him], “Do not ascribe anything as a partner to Me and cleanse My house for those who circumambulate and for those who stand steadfast in prayer and for those who are bowing, prostrating

27.Fode Drame: and announce the pilgrimage unto the mankind they will come to you on foot and on every courser they will come out of every deep narrow path.”

28.Fode Drame: So that they may witness benefits for them and proclaim the names of Allah through days well-appointed over the heads of cattle which He has provided them so eat from it and feed the miserable poor.

29.Fode Drame: Then let them complete their rituals and let them fulfill their vows and let them circumambulate around the ancient house.

30.Fode Drame: And it is so that whoever shows reverence for things consecrated by Allah that indeed is best for him in the eyes of his Lord. And the cattle have been made lawful to you except that which is related to you [as unlawful in the book]. Therefore keep away from the loathsome impurities of the idols and keep away from the word of false witnessing.

31.Fode Drame: Devoted to the worship of Allah and not ascribing partners to Him. But whoever ascribes partners to Allah, it is as though he has fallen down from the heaven and the birds snatch him or the wind carry him to a far distant place.

32.Fode Drame: So it is that whoever reveres the insignia of Allah, that truly comes from the reverence of Allah that is in the hearts.

33.Fode Drame: In them are benefits for you till an appointed term and their final station is at the ancient house.

34.Fode Drame: Unto every nation We have assigned the rituals of sacrifice so that they may proclaim the names of Allah over that which He has provided them from the heads of cattle. Therefore your God is one deity so surrender your total being only for Him and give glad tidings to those who are most humble.

35.Fode Drame: Those whose hearts overawe when Allah is mentioned and who bear with patience that which afflicts them and who establish the prayer while they spend from that which We have provided for them.

36.Fode Drame: And the camel We have appointed it for you as part of insignia of Allah in them there is good for you. Therefore proclaim the name of Allah when they line up for sacrifice. And then when their sides fall down on the ground then eat from them and feed the [poor] ones who are content and the one who are hard pressed by adversity. Thus We have made them subservient to you so that you may offer gratitude [to Allah].

37.Fode Drame: Their flesh never reaches Allah nor their bloods but the God reverence from you reaches up to Him. Thus He has made them subservient to you so that you may extol the grandeur of Allah for the reason that He has guided you and give glad tidings to the ones who act in excellence.

38.Fode Drame: Truly Allah defends those who believe. Truly Allah loves not anyone who is treacherous, ungrateful.

39.Fode Drame: Permission [to fight] is given to those who are fought against because they are wronged and truly Allah is able to give them victory.

40.Fode Drame: It is they who are driven out of their homes with no right just because they say, “Our Lord is Allah.” Had it not been that Allah do push back one set of men by another, truly temples and churches and synagogues and mosques would have been pulled down wherein Allah’s name is mentioned in abundance. Truly Allah will help those who help Him and Truly Allah is All-strong, All-mighty.

41.Fode Drame: It is those who when We establish them in the earth, they establish the prayer and they give out the sanctifying dues and they enjoin [others] to do righteous things and forbid [them] from doing wicked things and for Allah is the ending of all the matters.

42.Fode Drame: And if they belie you, truly before them belied the people of Noah and ‘Ad and Samood

43.Fode Drame: and the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

44.Fode Drame: and the inhabitants of Madian and Moses was belied and I gave respite to the disbelievers and then I seized them. How then was my disguised plan?

45.Fode Drame: How many a townships have We destroyed while they were wronging their own souls and here it is lying thrown on their heads down and [how many] abandoned wells and how many a towering palaces

46.Fode Drame: Have they not peregrinated in the land so that they may come to acquire hearts by which to understand or ears by which to hear? Lo! It is not the eyes in the head that go blind rather what goes blind are the hearts that are in the bosoms.

47.Fode Drame: And they ask you to bring the punishment in haste but Allah will never fail His promise. For a day with your Lord is like a thousand years from that which you count.

48.Fode Drame: And how many townships I gave them respite while they were wronging their own souls then I seized them and to Me is the place of final ending.

49.Fode Drame: Say, “O mankind, I am but a manifest warner for you.”

50.Fode Drame: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds for them is forgiveness and a most gracious provision.

51.Fode Drame: And those who endeavor to defy Our signs, they are companions of the hellfire.

52.Fode Drame: And We never sent before you a messenger or a prophet except that when he formulates a good wish, Satan will throw [doubt] in his wish but Allah abrogates that [doubt] which Satan casts and then Allah confirms His signs and Allah is All-knowing, All-wise

53.Fode Drame: so that He may make that [doubt] which Satan casts a tribulation for those in whose hearts is a disease and for those whose hearts are hardened and truly those who wrong their own souls are in a dissension gone far astray

54.Fode Drame: and so that those who are given the knowledge may know [witness] that it is the truth from your Lord and they may thereby attain to belief and their hearts may submit humbly for it and truly Allah surely is a guide of those who believe, to a path most upright.

55.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieve will not cease to be in confusion about it until the hour comes upon them suddenly or comes upon them the punishment of a barren day.

56.Fode Drame: The dominion on that day is for Allah and He will judge between them with wisdom. As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, they will be in gardens of the bliss.

57.Fode Drame: As for those who disbelieved and belied Our signs, it is those for whom there will be a debasing punishment.

58.Fode Drame: And as for those who migrated in the way of Allah and then they were killed or died, truly Allah will surely provide them with a most excellent provision and truly Allah, He indeed is the best of those who give provisions.

59.Fode Drame: Truly He will make them enter through a place of entry with which they shall be well pleased and truly Allah is surely All-knowing, All-Magnanimous.

60.Fode Drame: This is so and whoever meets out wrong with the like of that with which he was wronged and thereafter he is trespassed against, truly Allah will surely help him. Truly Allah surely is Oft-pardoning, Oft-Forgiving.

61.Fode Drame: That is so because Allah is the one who causes the night to be covered by the day and causes the day to be covered by the night and truly Allah is All-hearing, All-seeing.

62.Fode Drame: That is so because Allah, He is the truth and that all else that they invoke besides Him, that is the falsehood. And truly Allah is The All-high, The All-great.

63.Fode Drame: Have you not seen that Allah sends water from the sky so the earth becomes green? Truly Allah is All-subtle, All-acquainted.

64.Fode Drame: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth and truly Allah is certainly The All-self-sufficient, The All-praiseworthy.

65.Fode Drame: Have you not seen that Allah has made subservient for you all that is in the earth and the vessel that runs in the ocean by His command and He holds the firmament lest it falls on the earth except by His permission. Truly Allah is surely All-tender, Most merciful for the mankind.

66.Fode Drame: And it is He who caused you to live and then will cause you to die and then will cause you to come back to life. Truly the human being is surely most ungrateful.

67.Fode Drame: Unto every nation, We have assigned rituals which they are supposed to observe. Therefore they should not dispute with you concerning the commandment. Call unto your Lord. Truly you are on a guidance which is most upright.

68.Fode Drame: And if they argue with you say, “Allah knows best about that which you do.”

69.Fode Drame: Allah will judge between you with wisdom on the day of resurrection about the things in which you used to differ.

70.Fode Drame: And do you not know [witness] that Allah knows all that is in the heaven and in the earth? Truly all of that is in a book. Truly that for Allah is easy.

71.Fode Drame: And they worship besides Allah that by which He has sent down no authority and that about which they have no knowledge and as for those who wrong their own souls, there is no helper.

72.Fode Drame: And whenever Our signs are related unto them clearly, you recognize the denial in the faces of those who disbelieve. They nearly attack those who relate Our signs unto them. Say, “Should I inform you of something worse than this? The fire that Allah has promised to those who disbelieve and what a woeful place of final coming.”

73.Fode Drame: O you the mankind! An example is set forth so listen to it. Truly those whom you invoke besides Allah can never create a fly even if they were to work in concert to that end and if the fly were to rob them of something, they cannot recover it from it. Weak is the one seeking and weak is the one sought after.

74.Fode Drame: They have not appreciated Allah to His true grandeur. Truly Allah is surely All-strong, All-mighty.

75.Fode Drame: Allah selects messengers from among the angels and from among the human beings. Truly Allah is All-hearing, All-seeing.

76.Fode Drame: He knows what is before them and what is behind them and all affairs are returned back to Allah.

77.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Bow down and prostrate and supplicate your Lord and do the good so that you may attain prosperity.

78.Fode Drame: And struggle towards Allah with true struggling for Him. It is He who has chosen you and has made no burden on you in the religion. The way of your father Abraham. It was He who named you ‘the submitters’ before and in this [now] so that the messenger becomes a witness over you and that you become witnesses over other human beings. So establish the prayer and give the sanctifying dues and fortify yourselves by Allah. He is your master and how blessed the master and how blessed the helper.

1.Fode Drame: The believers have truly prospered.

2.Fode Drame: Those are humbled in their prayers.

3.Fode Drame: And those who turn away from idle talk.

4.Fode Drame: And those who practice the paying of sanctifying dues.

5.Fode Drame: And those who guard their chastities

6.Fode Drame: except with their marital conjoints or with that their right hands possess, for they truly are not susceptible to blame.

7.Fode Drame: But those who seek what is beyond that [out of lust], they truly are the transgressors.

8.Fode Drame: And those who watch closely over their trusts and their covenants.

9.Fode Drame: And those who keep their prayers.

10.Fode Drame: These are those who will be the inheritors.

11.Fode Drame: Those who will inherit the garden of Firdaus to abide therein forever.

12.Fode Drame: And indeed We created the human being out of a substance from clay.

13.Fode Drame: Then We caused him to be a drop of liquid in a resting place firmly secured.
