14.Fode Drame: Then We created the drop of liquid into a clot of blood, then We created the clot of blood into a piece of flesh, then We created the piece of flesh into bones, then We covered the bones with skin, then We raised him up into a different creature. So blessed is Allah the best of the creators

15.Fode Drame: Then after that you certainly are going to die.

16.Fode Drame: Then on the day of resurrection, you will be resurrected.

17.Fode Drame: And indeed We have created above you seven causeways and We are never oblivious about the creation.

18.Fode Drame: And We sent down water from the heaven in due measure and then We gave it a tranquil place to stay in the earth and We are surely able to make it disappear.

19.Fode Drame: And with it We raised for you gardens of date trees and of grapes wherein for you are lots of fruits and from which you eat.

20.Fode Drame: And a tree that grows forth from the Mount Sinai, it produces the oil and a condiment for the eaters.

21.Fode Drame: And truly in the cattle there is for you a lucid lesson. We make you drink from what comes from their bellies and in them for you are numerous benefits and from them you eat.

22.Fode Drame: And on them and on the vessels you are carried.

23.Fode Drame: And indeed We sent Noah to his people and he said, “O my people! Serve Allah. There is no deity for you other than He. Will you not then guard your own souls?”

24.Fode Drame: So the chieftains who disbelieved from his people said, “This is no other than a human like you. He intends to place himself above you. Had Allah willed, He would have sent down angels. We never heard about this in our forefathers.”

25.Fode Drame: He is not but a man who is possessed [by daemon] so bear with him for a little while.

26.Fode Drame: He said, “O my Lord! Grant me victory for that they belied me.”

27.Fode Drame: So We inspired him saying, “Build an ark under Our eyes and under Our divine instruction and when Our commandment comes and the spring of water gushes forth, make enter therein from every kind two pairs and all are going to perish except the ones among them on whom Our word of sentence [to survive] has been passed and do not address Me on behalf of those who have wronged their own souls. They certainly are going to drown.”

28.Fode Drame: Once you and those with you settle in the ark then say, “The praise is for Allah the one who saved us from the people who wrong their own souls.”

29.Fode Drame: And say, “O my Lord! Let me land at a blessed place of landing and you are the best of those who give a place of landing.”

30.Fode Drame: Truly in this surely are the signs and We were only trying them.

31.Fode Drame: Then after them We raised another generation.

32.Fode Drame: And We sent among them a messenger from them [and he said] that, “Worship Allah, you have no other deity beside Him. Will you then not revere [Him]?”

33.Fode Drame: And the chieftains from his people who disbelieved and belied the meeting of the hereafter and whom We had made affluent in the life of this world said, “He is no more than a human like you. He eats of that which you eat and he drinks of that which you drink.

34.Fode Drame: And if you obey a human like yourselves, truly then you are ones who are going to be in loss.

35.Fode Drame: Does he promise you that when you had died and you became dust and bones, you indeed are going to be brought forth?

36.Fode Drame: Far and far is that what you are promised.

37.Fode Drame: It is but our life of this world. We die and we live and we are not going to be resurrected.

38.Fode Drame: He is but a man who has contrived a lie against Allah and we are not going to believe him.”

39.Fode Drame: He said, “O my Lord! Help me because they belied me.”

40.Fode Drame: He said, “In a little while, they will certainly become those who are stricken with regret.”

41.Fode Drame: So the awful shriek seized them by the truth and We reduced them into a stubble. Far away [from Allah’s mercy] are the people who wrong their own souls.

42.Fode Drame: Then after them We raised other generations.

43.Fode Drame: No nation can advance their appointed term nor can they be late for it.

44.Fode Drame: Then We sent down messengers one after another. Every time came to a nation their messenger, they belied him. So We made them follow one another and We made them into news [for others]. Far removed [from Allah’s mercy] are people who do not believe.

45.Fode Drame: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and with a manifest authority

46.Fode Drame: unto Pharaoh and his chieftains but they held themselves as great ones and they were a people who held themselves high [in the earth]

47.Fode Drame: and they said, “Should we believe in two humans like us when their people are but slaves for us.”

48.Fode Drame: And they belied the two of them so they became of those who were caused to perish.

49.Fode Drame: And We indeed gave the book to Moses so that they may find guidance.

50.Fode Drame: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and We brought the two of them for shelter to an elevated land which is a good resting place and is furnished with springs of water.

51.Fode Drame: “O you the messengers! Eat from the things that are clean and work righteous deeds. Truly I am All-knowing about all that you do.”

52.Fode Drame: And truly this is your nation, one nation and I am your Lord so revere Me.

53.Fode Drame: But they tore their affair among them into pieces. Each party happy with the piece that they have.

54.Fode Drame: So abandon them in their deep darkness for a while.

55.Fode Drame: Do they think then that We bestow upon them from wealth and children is only because

56.Fode Drame: We are eager to serve them with all kinds of good things? Nay! They are not aware [of Our true intention].

57.Fode Drame: Truly those who are concerned for themselves due to the deference of their Lord.

58.Fode Drame: And those who believe through the signs of their Lord.

59.Fode Drame: And those who do not ascribe partners to their Lord.

60.Fode Drame: And those who give what they give while their hearts are in tremor [knowing] that they are going to return to their Lord.

61.Fode Drame: These are those who race with one another in good things and it is they who will take the lead in attaining that.

62.Fode Drame: And We do not charge a soul with more than its capacity and with Us is a book that speaks in the truth and they will not be wronged [in the least].

63.Fode Drame: Nay their hearts are in deep darkness about this [the book] and besides this they have other practices which they continue to practice.

64.Fode Drame: Until when We seized those who were affluent among them with the punishment, Lo! They are imploring.

65.Fode Drame: [It will be said to them], “Do not implore today. Truly you will not be given a help against Us.”

66.Fode Drame: Indeed My signs used to be related to you but you used to turn back on your heels.

67.Fode Drame: Holding yourself arrogant against it [the book] you continue to spend your nights in idle talk thereby abandoning [the book].

68.Fode Drame: Do they not truly appreciate the word or is it that something has come to them that never came to their forefathers?

69.Fode Drame: Or is it that they have not recognized their messenger so they are in denial of him?

70.Fode Drame: Or do they say that he is possessed? Nay he has come to them with the truth but most of them are averse to the truth.

71.Fode Drame: Had the truth followed their vain desires, most certainly the heavens and the earth and whosoever is in them would have fallen in disorder. Nay We have brought unto them their remembrance but they have turned away [with arrogance] from their remembrance.

72.Fode Drame: Or do you ask them for any remuneration? Surely the remuneration of your Lord is best and He is the best of those who give sustenance.

73.Fode Drame: And Lo! You surely are calling them to a most upright way.

74.Fode Drame: And truly those who do not believe in the hereafter are going to depart from the way.

75.Fode Drame: Even if We had mercy on them and We had removed from them that which afflicted them, they would still have obstinately persisted in their transgression wandering about blindly.

76.Fode Drame: And We did indeed seize them with the punishment but they did not humble themselves for their Lord nor did they plead with Him.

77.Fode Drame: Until when We open upon them a door of a mighty punishment, behold! They are therein in absolute despair.

78.Fode Drame: He it is who has raised for you the hearing, the sight and the perception of the heart. How little is the gratitude that you offer.

79.Fode Drame: And it is He who has caused you to proliferate in the earth and it is He unto Whom you shall be gathered.

80.Fode Drame: And it is He who gives life and causes death and for Him is the alternation of the night and of the day. Will you not then understand?

81.Fode Drame: Rather they said the like of that which was said by people before them.

82.Fode Drame: They said, “What! If we died and we were dust and bones, are we truly going to be raised?

83.Fode Drame: Indeed we were promised this and so were our fathers aforetime but this is nothing but the tales of the people of the past.”

84.Fode Drame: Say, “For whom is the earth and whosoever is in it if you do know?”

85.Fode Drame: They will say, “For Allah.” Say, “Will you then not remember?”

86.Fode Drame: Say, “Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the magnificent throne?”

87.Fode Drame: They will say, “For Allah.” Say, “Will you not then revere [Him]?”

88.Fode Drame: Say, “Who is it in whose hand rests the inner dominion of everything and who can give refuge [against anyone else] but none can give refuge [to anyone else] against Him if you do know?”

89.Fode Drame: They will say, “For Allah.” Say, “How then could you be spellbound?”

90.Fode Drame: Nay! We have brought unto them the truth but truly they are indeed liars.

91.Fode Drame: Allah has not taken any son [for Himself] nor is there any deity with Him for surely then each deity would appropriate unto himself that which he had created and some of them certainly will over power others. Glorified be Allah from all that they attribute to Him.

92.Fode Drame: Knower of that which is hidden and of that which is witnessed. Far exalted is He above all that they ascribe as partners to Him.

93.Fode Drame: Say, “O my Lord, if you do show me that which they are promised [in my life in this world]

94.Fode Drame: Then my Lord, do not put me with the people who wrong their own souls”

95.Fode Drame: And We most certainly are able to show you [while you are alive in this world] that which We promise them.

96.Fode Drame: Repel the evil with that which is most excellent. We truly know that which they describe with their tongue.

97.Fode Drame: And say, “O my Lord! I seek refuge with You from the promptings of the devils

98.Fode Drame: And I seek refuge with You, O my Lord, lest they be present with me.”

99.Fode Drame: Until such a time when the death will come to one of them, then he will say, “O my Lord! Send me back [in the earth].”

100.Fode Drame: Perhaps that I may do righteous deeds within the time which is given to me as a delay. Nay! That is just a word that he is saying it [he will not do it even if he is sent back] and behind them there is a boundary until the day that they will be resurrected.

101.Fode Drame: And when the trumpet is blown then there will be no ties of family between them on that day nor will they be asking about one another [out of concern].

102.Fode Drame: Whosoever’s balance [of good deeds] is heavy, it is they who will be the prosperers.

103.Fode Drame: And whosoever’s balance [of good deeds] is light, it is they who have put their own souls in loss and will abide forever in the hellfire.

104.Fode Drame: The fire will scorch their faces and they will look grimly therein.

105.Fode Drame: Were not my signs related to you but you used to belie them.

106.Fode Drame: They will say, “O our Lord! Our ill luck had overtaken us and we were a people who had gone astray.

107.Fode Drame: O our Lord! Take us out of it [the hell fire] and if we return back to our former ways, then it will be us who will have done wrong to our own souls.

108.Fode Drame: He will say, “Be there in abject and vile and do not speak to Me.”

109.Fode Drame: Indeed there used to be a group of my slaves who used to say, “O our Lord, we believe so forgive us and have mercy on us, for You truly are the best of those who are merciful.”

110.Fode Drame: But you took them for a jest so much so that they made you forget My remembrance and you used to laugh at them.

111.Fode Drame: Truly I have rewarded them for what they were patient, that today they are the successful ones.

112.Fode Drame: He will say, “How many numbers of years did you stay in the earth?”

113.Fode Drame: They will say, “We stayed a day or part of a day, ask those who know how to count.”

114.Fode Drame: He will say, “You stayed only a little only if you did know.

115.Fode Drame: Did you then think that We only created you for sport and that you will not be brought back to Us?”

116.Fode Drame: Therefore exalted is Allah, the King, the Truth. There is no deity save He. Lord of the gracious throne.

117.Fode Drame: And whoever invokes any other deity along with Allah, he has no proof thereby and then his reckoning is only with his Lord. Truly the disbelievers will not prosper.

118.Fode Drame: And say, “O my Lord! Forgive and bestow mercy, for You truly are the best of those who are merciful.”

1.Fode Drame: It is a surah [chapter] which We have revealed and We have imposed it and in it, We have revealed clear signs so that you may remember.

2.Fode Drame: The fornicating woman and the fornicating man, flog each of them a hundred lashes and let not tenderness for both of them sway you in the matter of the religion of Allah if you truly believe in Allah and in the last day and let their punishment be witnessed by a party of the believers.

3.Fode Drame: The fornicating man must not marry except a fornicating woman or a woman who ascribes partners to Allah and a fornicating woman is not married except to a fornicating man or to a man who ascribes partners to Allah. Such a thing is forbidden unto the believers.

4.Fode Drame: And those men who accuse chaste women with fornication [or adultery] and do not produce four witnesses, flog them with eighty lashes and do not accept their witnessing ever after and those are the renegades.

5.Fode Drame: Except those men who repent thereafter and amend their wrong deeds with righteous deeds and truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

6.Fode Drame: And those men who accuse their wives and there are no witnesses for them except themselves, thus the witnessing of one of them counts as four witnessings taking an oath by Allah that He is of those who are truthful.

7.Fode Drame: And in the fifth time [he should assert] that let Allah’s curse be on him if he is of those who are the liars.

8.Fode Drame: And it pushes away the punishment from her [the wife] if she bears witness four times by Allah that truly he is of those who are liars.

9.Fode Drame: And the fifth time [she should assert] that let Allah’s anger be on her if he is of those who are the truthful.

10.Fode Drame: And was it not for the favor of Allah and His mercy upon you and that Allah is Acceptor of repentance, All-wise.

11.Fode Drame: Truly those who came with slander, they are a party among you. Do not count it as evil for you. Nay it is good for you. Unto everyone will be assigned the reward of that which he earned from the sin but the one who was responsible for the greater part of it among them, for him is an awful punishment.

12.Fode Drame: If only when you heard it, the believing men and women had thought well of themselves and had said, “This is an obvious slander.”

13.Fode Drame: If only they brought forth against him four witnesses and since they did not bring forth the witnesses, then surely in the sight of Allah, they are the liars.

14.Fode Drame: Had it not been for the favor of Allah and His mercy upon you in this world and in the hereafter, surely an awful punishment would have touched you for the rumor in which you indulged in.

15.Fode Drame: As you eagerly seized it with your tongues and said from your mouths for which you had no knowledge and you deemed it as a light matter while it is of great consequence in the sight of Allah.

16.Fode Drame: And if only when you heard it you had said, “It is not meet for us to speak about this. Glory be unto you [O Allah]. This is an egregious fabrication.”

17.Fode Drame: Allah admonishes you that you must not repeat the like of it ever after if you are truly believers.

18.Fode Drame: And Allah makes the signs clear for you and Allah is All-knowing, All-wise.

19.Fode Drame: Truly those who love that offensive rumors spread among those who believe, for them there is painful punishment in this life and in the hereafter and Allah knows while you know not.

20.Fode Drame: And had it not been for the favor of Allah and His mercy upon you and that Allah is indeed All-tender, Most-merciful.

21.Fode Drame: O you who believe, do not follow the footsteps of Satan and whosoever follows the footsteps of Satan, he [Satan] but commands unto things which are offensive and wicked. Had it not been for Allah’s favor and His mercy upon you, He would not sanctify anyone of you ever. But Allah sanctifies the one whom He pleases and Allah is All-hearing, All-knowing.

22.Fode Drame: And let not those who have been blessed among you with favor [from Allah] and with abundance swear not to give to those who are near of kin and to the poor and to those who have migrated in the way of Allah but let them pardon and overlook. Do you not love that Allah should forgive you? and Allah is Oft-Forgiving Most-merciful.

23.Fode Drame: Truly those who accuse the chaste women, the women who are innocent minded about all kinds of evil, the believing women, they [the accusers] are cursed in this life and in the hereafter and for them is an awful punishment.

24.Fode Drame: On a day their tongues and their hands and their feet will witness against them for that which they used to go.

25.Fode Drame: On that day Allah will pay them their true rewards in full and they will know that Allah is the truth who makes everything clear.

26.Fode Drame: The indecent women are for the indecent men and the indecent men are for the indecent women and the women who are decent are for the men who are decent and the men who are decent are for the women who are decent. They are innocent from any guilt that they say [of them]. For them is forgiveness and a gracious provision.

27.Fode Drame: O you who believe do not enter houses other than your own houses until you announce yourself and send a word of peace to the people therein. It is better for you perhaps that you may remember.

28.Fode Drame: And if you find no one therein, do not enter until the permission is given unto you and if you are told to go back, go back. This is purer for you and Allah is All-knowing with all that you do.

29.Fode Drame: And there is no guilt unto you if you enter houses which are uninhabited wherein lies some benefit for you and Allah knows all that you reveal and all that you conceal.

30.Fode Drame: Tell the believers to lower part of their gazes and to safeguard their chastities. That is purer for them. Truly Allah is All-acquainted with all that they manufacture.

31.Fode Drame: And tell the believing women to lower part of their gazes and to safeguard their chastities and that they should not reveal their ornaments except that which is ordinarily exposed of it and let them lower down their clothings on their bosoms and they should not reveal their ornaments except to their husbands or to their fathers or to the fathers of their husbands or to their son or to the son of their husbands or to their brothers or to the sons of their brothers or to the sons of their sisters or to their women or to those that their right hands possess [male or female] or to dependent men who have no need of women or to the children who have not been awakened to the desire for women and that they should not stump their feet to make known what they hide from their ornaments. And O you the believers, turn in repentance altogether to Allah perhaps you may prosper.

32.Fode Drame: And marry those who are single among you and those who are righteous among your slaves; male and female. If they be indigent, Allah will provide them with abundance from His favor and Allah is All-encompassing, All-knowing.

33.Fode Drame: And let those who do not find means for marriage keep their chastity till Allah provides for them from His favor. And those who seek a deed of manumission from among those whom your right hands possess, accept their request if you find good in them and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given unto you and do not coerce your maid slaves unto prostitution while they seek to guard their chastity in order that you seek a trifling gain of this life and whosoever coerce them, Lo! Allah after their coercion is Oft-Forgiving Most-merciful.

34.Fode Drame: And truly We have sent down unto you signs which make things clear and a parable about those who have gone before you and an admonition for those who revere Allah.

35.Fode Drame: Allah is the light of the heavens and of the earth. Likeness of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp. The lamp is within a glass. The glass looks like a brilliant star lit from a blessed olive tree that is neither in the east nor in the west. Its oil almost nearly illuminates even though fire has not touched it. It is a light upon a light. Allah guides unto His light whom He pleases and Allah sets forth the parables for the mankind and Allah is All-knowing about everything

36.Fode Drame: in houses which Allah has permitted to be raised and for His name to be remembered therein and wherein is He glorified in the mornings and in the evenings

37.Fode Drame: by men whom neither trade nor traffic distracts from the remembrance of Allah or from establishing prayer or from paying the sanctifying dues. They fear a day wherein the hearts and the sights will turn upside down.

38.Fode Drame: So that Allah may reward them according to the best of the deeds that they have done and may increase them from His favor and Allah provides for whom He pleases without calculation.

39.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieve, their deeds are like a mirage in a desert which the thirsty takes to be water until when he comes to it, he does not find it to be anything but he finds Allah with him, thereupon He gives him his reckoning in full and Allah is Swift in the reckoning.

40.Fode Drame: Or like darknesses in a wavy sea covered by a wave, with a wave above it, and a cloud above it; darknesses one above another. If he were to put forth his hand he hardly sees it. For whom Allah does not provide a light, for him there is no light.

41.Fode Drame: Have you not seen that it is Allah for whom glorifies whosoever is in the heavens and in the earth and also the birds with their wings spread out? Each has known his prayer and his glorification and Allah is All-knowing about all that they do.

42.Fode Drame: And for Allah is the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth and unto Allah is the final ending.

43.Fode Drame: Have you not seen that Allah draws a cloud, then He puts it together, then He reduces it into a pile and then you see the rain coming out from between it and He sends down from the heaven from mountains therein from hail with which He strikes whom He pleases and averts from whom He pleases. The brilliance of its lightning almost nearly snatches away the sights.

44.Fode Drame: Allah causes the night and the day to alternate. Truly in that is a lesson for those who are endowed with sight.

45.Fode Drame: And it is Allah who has created every animal from water. And among them are such as move on their bellies and among them are such as move on two legs and among them are such as move on four. Allah creates what He pleases and truly Allah has power over everything.

46.Fode Drame: Truly We have revealed signs that make things clear and Allah guides whom He pleases to a path most upright.

47.Fode Drame: And they say, “We believe in Allah and in the messenger and we obey” but then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not the believers.

48.Fode Drame: And when they are summoned unto Allah and His messenger so that he may judge with wisdom between them, Lo! A party of them turns away.

49.Fode Drame: But if the right is in their favor, they will come to him in willing submission.

50.Fode Drame: Is there a disease in their hearts or they have doubt or they fear that Allah and His messenger would wrong them. Nay it is they who are those who wrong their own souls.

51.Fode Drame: The only word from the believers when they are summoned unto Allah and His messenger so that he may judge between them with wisdom is that they say, “We heard and we obeyed.” And it is only they who are going to prosper.

52.Fode Drame: And whoever obeys Allah and His messenger and defers to Allah and reveres Him, it is they who are going to attain success.

53.Fode Drame: And they swear by Allah with their most solemn oath that if you command them [to set out] they will certainly set out. Say, “Do not swear.” It is a well-known obedience. Allah truly is well acquainted with all that you do.

54.Fode Drame: Say, ”Obey Allah and obey the messenger but if you turn back then he is only answerable for that with which he is charged and you are answerable for that with which you are charged and if you obey him, you will be rightly guided. And there is no other responsibility upon the messenger except the clear deliverance of the message.”

55.Fode Drame: Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds from among you that He will surely appoint them as vicegerents in the earth as He did appoint those before them as vicegerents and He will surely establish for them their religion which He has chosen for them out of His pleasure and He will most certainly give them security in replacement for their fear. They must then worship Me and ascribe nothing as partner to Me and whosoever turns to disbelief after that, truly it is they who are the renegades.

56.Fode Drame: And establish the prayer and give the sanctifying dues and obey the messenger so that perhaps you may receive mercy.

57.Fode Drame: And do not think that those who disbelieve are going to escape in the earth. Their final abode is the fire and what a woeful place of ending.

58.Fode Drame: O You who believe, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not attained to puberty among you ask your permission [before they come in upon you] at three times; before the morning prayer, and when you lay down your dresses in the afternoon, and after the night prayer. Three occasions of privacy for you, and after them there is no guilt upon you nor upon them due to the customary traffic between one another among you. Thus Allah makes clear the signs for you and Allah is All-knowing, All-wise.

59.Fode Drame: And when the children among you attain to puberty, let them also ask the permission to come in upon you as did those who were before them. Thus Allah makes clear for you His signs and Allah is All-knowing, All-wise.

60.Fode Drame: And the women who are advanced in age, who do not look forward to getting married, there is no guilt upon them if they lay aside their outer garments without the flagrant display of their ornaments. However it is better for them to stay modest and Allah is All-hearing, All-knowing.

61.Fode Drame: There is no guilt on the blind nor a guilt on the lame nor a guilt on the sick nor on yourself if you eat from your houses or from the houses of your fathers or from the houses of your mothers or from the houses of your brothers or from the houses of your sisters or from the houses of your paternal uncles or from the houses of your paternal aunts or from the houses of your maternal uncles or from the houses of your maternal aunts or from the houses to which you possess the keys thereof or from your friends [houses]. There is no guilt on you if you eat together or separately. And when you enter houses send the greetings of peace upon yourselves; a greeting from Allah blessed and pure. Thus Allah makes clear for you the signs so that perhaps you may understand.

62.Fode Drame: The only true believers are those who believe in Allah and in His messenger and those when they are with him on a decisive matter they do not go until they ask for his permission. Truly those who ask for your permission [to leave] are those who truly believe in Allah and in His messenger and when they ask your permission to leave in view of some of their affairs, give permission to such as you please from among them and ask forgiveness from Allah for them. Truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most-merciful.

63.Fode Drame: Do not make the call of the messenger among you like the call of some of you unto others. Truly Allah knows those who slip away from among you stealthily. Let those who go against his commandment beware lest a tribulation befalls them or lest a painful punishment afflicts them.

64.Fode Drame: Lo! indeed belongs to Allah all that is in the heavens and in the earth. Truly He knows that which you are on and the day they will be brought back unto Him, then He will certainly inform them about all that they did and Allah is All-knowing about everything.

1.Fode Drame: Blessed is the one who sent down the criterion upon His slave so that he may be a warner for the worlds.

2.Fode Drame: It is He for whom is the dominion of the heavens and of the earth and He has not taken a child for Himself and there is no partner for Him in the Dominion and He has created everything and then has measured it with a perfect measurement.

3.Fode Drame: And they have taken besides Him deities who create nothing but they themselves are created and they have no control over harm or benefit for themselves and they have no control over death or life or resurrection.

4.Fode Drame: And the disbelievers said, “This [Quran] is nothing except a lie that he has contrived and other people helped him with it. Indeed they have come up with a wrong against their own souls and a false witnessing.”

5.Fode Drame: And they said, “Tales of the people of the past which he has requested to be written and which are dictated to him morning and evening.”

6.Fode Drame: Say, “It is revealed by the One who knows the secret in the heavens and in the earth.” Truly He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

7.Fode Drame: And they said, “What manner of a messenger is this who eats the food and walks in the markets? If only an angel was sent down upon him to be a warner with him

8.Fode Drame: or if only a treasure is bestowed upon him or if there is a garden for him where he eats from.” And those who have wronged their own souls said, “You are following but a man who is bewitched.”

9.Fode Drame: See how they set the similitudes for you, therefore they have gone astray so they cannot find a way.

10.Fode Drame: Blessed is He who if He so willed would have made for you better than that, gardens under which the rivers flow, and would have made for you palaces.

11.Fode Drame: Nay! They have belied the hour and We have prepared a blazing fire for anyone who belies the hour.

12.Fode Drame: When it [the fire] sees them, they hear its angry roar and its hissing yet from a far place.

13.Fode Drame: And when they are thrown in a tight place therefrom, bound in chains, they will pray thereupon for annihilation.

14.Fode Drame: Today do not pray for only one annihilation but pray for many annihilations.

15.Fode Drame: Say, “Is that better or the garden of eternity which is promised to those who revere Allah?” For them it is a reward and a place of final ending.

16.Fode Drame: For them therein is all that they wish for, they will abide therein eternally. It is a promise which is going to be requested from your Lord.

17.Fode Drame: And a day that He will gather them and all that they worship besides Allah and He will say, “Is it you who have led these slaves of mine astray or is it they themselves who have led themselves astray from the way?”

18.Fode Drame: They will say, “Glory be unto You it was not fitting for us to take allies besides You but You have given them and their fathers temporary enjoyment until they forgot the remembrance and so they became a people devoid of all good.”

19.Fode Drame: Lo! They [the worshipped] have indeed belied you [the worshippers] in all that you say, so you cannot find an escape nor can you find help and whosoever wrongs his own soul from among you, We will make him taste a great punishment.

20.Fode Drame: We have not sent before you from the messengers except that they indeed ate food and walked in the markets and We have made you a trial for one another, so will you be patient? And truly Your Lord is All-seeing.

21.Fode Drame: And those who do not expect to meet us say, “If only angels were sent down upon us or only if we saw our Lord.” Truly they have grown great in their own eyes and they have trespassed a great trespassing.

22.Fode Drame: A day when they will see the angels, there will be no glad tidings on that day for the evildoers and they will say, “Let there be a boundary that will completely safeguard us [from the fury of Our Lord].”

23.Fode Drame: And We shall proceed to any deed that they may have done and We will make it like dust scattered away.

24.Fode Drame: The companions of the garden on that day will be better as for the place of rest and will be most excellent as for the station.

25.Fode Drame: And a day the heaven will be rent with clouds and the angels will be sent down again and again.

26.Fode Drame: The true dominion on that day is for Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] and truly it will be a hard day for the disbelievers.

27.Fode Drame: And on a day in which the one who has done wrong to his own soul will bite his hands and will say, “I wish I had taken a way with the messenger.

28.Fode Drame: Woe unto me! Alas I wish I had not taken so and so as a friend.

29.Fode Drame: Indeed he has led me astray from the remembrance after it had come to me. Truly Satan is a relinquisher for the human being.”

30.Fode Drame: And the messenger said, “O my Lord, truly my people have taken this Quran as a thing to be deserted.”

31.Fode Drame: And thus We have appointed for every prophet an enemy from the evildoers and All-sufficient is your Lord as a guide and as a helper.

32.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieve said, “If only the Quran was revealed unto him in one piece” Thus [We have revealed it by stages] so that We may strengthen your heart with it and We have recited it [unto you] a measured recitation.

33.Fode Drame: And they bring you no similitude but that We bring you the truth and a most excellent explanation.

34.Fode Drame: And those who are gathered into hell on their faces, it is they who are worst as for the position and are most in error as for the way.

35.Fode Drame: And indeed We gave Moses the book and We appointed his brother Aaron with him as an assistant.

36.Fode Drame: And We said, “Both of you go to the people who have belied Our signs so We annihilated them a complete annihilation.”

37.Fode Drame: And people of Noah when they belied the messengers, We drowned them and We made them a sign for the mankind and We have prepared for those who wrong their own souls a painful punishment.

38.Fode Drame: And ‘Ad and Thamud and the dwellers of Ar-Rass and many generations in between them.

39.Fode Drame: And unto each of them We set similitudes and each of them We pulverized a complete pulverization.

40.Fode Drame: And they surely must have come upon the town on which was rained a woeful rain. Did they not use to see it? Nay! They did not use to expect resurrection.

41.Fode Drame: And when they see you they but take you as a matter of jest. Is this the one Allah has raised as a messenger?

42.Fode Drame: “Surely he almost nearly would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast to them” and in time to come they will know when they see the punishment who has gone astray the most as for the way.

43.Fode Drame: Have you seen him who has taken his vain desires as his god? Are you then going to be a trustee over him?

44.Fode Drame: Do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are but like cattle. Nay! They are the ones gone astray the most as for the way.

45.Fode Drame: Have you not seen your Lord how He causes the shadow to extend. Had He so willed, He would have caused it to be still then We cause the sun to lower on it.

46.Fode Drame: Then We will raise it up unto Us a gentle raising.

47.Fode Drame: And it is He who made the night for you a dress and the sleep for you a rest and has made the day a resurrection.

48.Fode Drame: It is He who sent the winds as glad tidings ahead of His mercy and We sent down from the heaven a pure water.

49.Fode Drame: So that We may revive a dead land with it and that We may cause to drink from it many of those that We have created, - cattle and human beings.

50.Fode Drame: And We have distributed it among them so that they may remember but most people refuse anything except ingratitude.

51.Fode Drame: If We had so wished, We would have surely raised a warner in every township.

52.Fode Drame: Therefore do not obey those who are ungrateful and strive against them with it [Quran] an utmost striving.

53.Fode Drame: It is He who caused the two oceans to flow. This one is sweet and fresh and this one is salty and bitter and He has made between them a boundary and an unassailable demarcation.

54.Fode Drame: And it is He who created human from the water and has made for him kinship through blood and through marriage and truly your Lord is All-powerful.

55.Fode Drame: And they worship besides Allah what does not benefit them nor harm them and truly the disbeliever is a helper against His Lord.

56.Fode Drame: And We have not sent you except as bringer of glad tidings and a warner.

57.Fode Drame: Say, “I do not ask of you any fee for it. It is but for such one who may wish to take a way to His Lord.”

58.Fode Drame: So put your trust on The Ever-living who dies not and glorify [Him] along with His praise and sufficient it is that He is All-acquainted with the sins of His slaves.

59.Fode Drame: He who created the heavens and the earth and that which is between them in six periods and then He firmly established Himself on the throne. Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful]; ask such who is well acquainted with Him.

60.Fode Drame: And whenever they are told, “Prostrate yourself to Ar-Rahman.” They say, “and who is Ar-Rahman? Are we to prostrate ourselves for whatever you command us?” and it increases them in aversion.

61.Fode Drame: All blessed is He who has made in the heaven constellations of stars and has made in it a blazing lamp and a light-giving moon.

62.Fode Drame: And it is He who has made the night and the day to alternate for such a one who seeks to remember Allah or seeks to offer gratitude.

63.Fode Drame: And the servants of Ar-Rahman those who walk on the earth gently and when the ignorant ones address them they say, “Peace.”

64.Fode Drame: And those who spend the night for their Lord prostrating and standing.

65.Fode Drame: And those who say, “O Our Lord! Turn away from us the punishment of hell”. Surely it’s punishment is abasing.

66.Fode Drame: Truly it is woeful as a resting place [at night] and [woeful] as a station [in the day].”

67.Fode Drame: And those who when they spend, they are neither extravagant nor miserly and they hold a middle position between them.

68.Fode Drame: And those who do not invoke any other deity with Allah and those who do not kill the soul that Allah has made sacred except by the right and they do not commit adultery or fornication. Whoever does these, he will contract a sinful burden.

69.Fode Drame: And the punishment for him will be doubled on the day of resurrection and he will abide in it forever in a state of humiliation.

70.Fode Drame: Except such a one who turns back to Allah in repentance and reaffirms his belief and does a righteous deed. Truly it is they whose evil deeds are replaced by Allah with virtuous deeds and Allah surely is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

71.Fode Drame: And whoever turns back to Allah in repentance and does a righteous deed, he therefore does truly turn to Allah with a complete repentance.

72.Fode Drame: And those who do not witness the falsehood and when they pass by idle talk, they pass in a gracious manner

73.Fode Drame: And those who when they are reminded about the signs of their Lord, they do not fall upon them deaf and blind.

74.Fode Drame: And those who say, “O Our Lord grant unto us from our spouses and our children such as are coolness of eyes and make us leaders for those who safeguard their own souls.”

75.Fode Drame: It is they who are rewarded with the lofty mansions [in the heaven] for that they were patient and they will be met therein with greetings of life and peace.

76.Fode Drame: To abide therein forever. How excellent it is as a place of resting and as a station.

77.Fode Drame: Say, “Were it not for your supplications, My Lord would not mind you at all but indeed you have belied [Allah’s promise] and in time to come, the punishment would become binding [on you].”

1.Fode Drame: Ta. Sin. Mim.

2.Fode Drame: Those are the signs of the book which make things clear.

3.Fode Drame: Perhaps you are going to vex yourself that they be not believers [in this book].

4.Fode Drame: If We had wished, We would have sent down on them from the heaven a sign so that their necks would remain bowed down for it in abject humility.

5.Fode Drame: And never comes to them from Ar-Rahman a newly revealed remembrance but that they turn their face away from it in arrogance.

6.Fode Drame: And indeed they have belied [the remembrance] and soon will come to them the true tidings about that which they used to mock at.

7.Fode Drame: Have they not looked at the earth,- how many things We have caused to grow in it of every graceful kind.

8.Fode Drame: Truly in this surely is a sign but most of them are not believers.

9.Fode Drame: And truly your Lord, He surely is The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

10.Fode Drame: And when your Lord called upon Moses that, “Come to the people who have wronged their own souls;

11.Fode Drame: the people of Pharaoh.” Will they not safeguard their own souls?

12.Fode Drame: He said, “O My Lord, I fear that they will belie me.

13.Fode Drame: And my chest will be constricted and my tongue will not loosen up therefore appoint Aaron a messenger

14.Fode Drame: and they have a right over me and I fear that they will kill me.

15.Fode Drame: He [Allah] said, “Not at all [do not fear]. Both of you go with Our signs. We are with you listening.

16.Fode Drame: So both of you come to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are the messenger of the Lord of the worlds’

17.Fode Drame: ’So send with us the children of Israel’.”

18.Fode Drame: He [Pharaoh] said, “Did we not raise you as a child among us and did you not stay among us many years of your life?

19.Fode Drame: And you did that deed of yours that you did and you are of those who are ungrateful”.

20.Fode Drame: He [Moses] Said, “I did it then when I was of those who are not well guided.

21.Fode Drame: So I fled from you when I feared you so my Lord granted me wisdom and appointed me as one of the messengers.

22.Fode Drame: And is that a favor of which you boast to me even though you have enslaved the children of Israel”.

23.Fode Drame: And Pharaoh said, “And what is the Lord the worlds?”

24.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “The Lord of the heavens and of the earth and whatever is in between if you have certitude.”

25.Fode Drame: And he said to those around him, “Do you not hear?”

26.Fode Drame: He said, “Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”

27.Fode Drame: He said, “Truly your messenger who has been sent to you is surely a madman.”

28.Fode Drame: He said, “The Lord of the east and of the west and what is between them if you truly understand.”

29.Fode Drame: He [Pharaoh] said, “If you take anyone else other than me as a god, then most certainly I will make you one of those who are imprisoned.”

30.Fode Drame: He [Moses] said, “What if I bring you something which is clear.”

31.Fode Drame: He [Pharaoh] said, “Bring it then if you are of those who are the truthful.”

32.Fode Drame: Then he [Moses] cast his staff and Lo! It is a plain serpent.

33.Fode Drame: And he pulled out his hand and Lo! It appeared [shining] white for the beholders.

34.Fode Drame: He [Pharaoh] said to the chieftains around him, “Truly this is surely a well learned magician.

35.Fode Drame: He is seeking to drive you out of your land through his magic so what do you advise?”

36.Fode Drame: They said, “stay him and his brother for a while and send collectors in the cities.

37.Fode Drame: So that they bring unto you every well learned magician.”

38.Fode Drame: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a specific day.

39.Fode Drame: And it was said unto the people, “Are you going to gather?”

40.Fode Drame: That we may follow the magicians if it is they who are the victors.

41.Fode Drame: So when the magicians came they said to Pharaoh, “Is there indeed a reward for us if it is we who are the victors?”

42.Fode Drame: He said, “Yes indeed and you truly will then be of those who are drawn near [unto us].”

43.Fode Drame: Moses said to them, “Throw that which you are going to throw.”

44.Fode Drame: So they threw their ropes and their sticks and they said, “By the honour of Pharaoh, it is certainly we who are going to be the victors.”

45.Fode Drame: And Moses threw his stick and Lo! It was swallowing all the falsehoods which they fake!

46.Fode Drame: Immediately the magicians fell down in prostration.

47.Fode Drame: They said, “We believe in the Lord of the worlds;

48.Fode Drame: Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

49.Fode Drame: He [Pharaoh] said, “You believed in him before I had given you permission. Truly he is surely your leader who has taught you the magic and soon you will come to know. I will most certainly cut your hands and your legs from opposite sides and most certainly I will crucify you all altogether.”

50.Fode Drame: They said, “No harm in the least. We are going to return to our Lord.”

51.Fode Drame: We fervently hope that our Lord will absolve us of our faults since we were the first of the believers.

52.Fode Drame: And We sent our inspiration to Moses that travel by night with My servants, for you indeed are going to be pursued.

53.Fode Drame: Then Pharaoh sent collectors to the cities.

54.Fode Drame: That these are but a band of few.

55.Fode Drame: And they truly are rancorous towards us.

56.Fode Drame: And we therefore are all truly alert.

57.Fode Drame: So We expelled them from gardens and from springs,

58.Fode Drame: and from treasures and from a most gracious station.

59.Fode Drame: Thus it was and We caused the children of Israel to inherit all of that.

72.Fode Drame: He said, “Do they hear you when you invoke them?

73.Fode Drame: or do they benefit you or harm?”

74.Fode Drame: They said, “Nay! We found our fathers acting in this manner.”

75.Fode Drame: He said, “Now look at these things that you are worshipping,

76.Fode Drame: you and your forefathers

77.Fode Drame: most certainly they are an enemy for me except the Lord of the worlds

78.Fode Drame: Who created me so it is He who guides me

79.Fode Drame: and it is He who feeds me and provides drink to slake my thirst

80.Fode Drame: and when I fall sick, it is He who heals me

81.Fode Drame: and it is He who puts me to death and then brings me to life

82.Fode Drame: and it is He who I fervently hope will absolve me of my faults on the day of rewarding.

83.Fode Drame: O my Lord! Grant me wisdom and join me with the righteous

84.Fode Drame: and make for me truthful mention on the tongue of those who will come later.

85.Fode Drame: And make me of those who will be the inheritors of the garden of bliss.

86.Fode Drame: And cover my father with forgiveness as he indeed is of those gone astray.

87.Fode Drame: And do not humiliate me on the day when they will be resurrected;

88.Fode Drame: a day when neither wealth will benefit nor children,

89.Fode Drame: except one who comes to Allah with a peaceful heart

90.Fode Drame: and the garden will be brought near unto those who safeguard their own souls

91.Fode Drame: and the hellfire will be made to appear for those who have gone astray.

92.Fode Drame: And it will be said unto them ‘Where are those things that you used to worship

93.Fode Drame: besides Allah?’ Will they help you [against Allah] or will they help themselves?”

94.Fode Drame: Thereupon they are hurled therein; they and the ones who caused them to go astray

95.Fode Drame: and the hosts of Iblis altogether.

96.Fode Drame: And they will say as they quarreled therein,

97.Fode Drame: “By Allah we were truly in a manifest error

98.Fode Drame: when we made you equals with the Lord of the worlds

99.Fode Drame: and no one else led us astray except the evildoers.

100.Fode Drame: And now there are no interceders for us

102.Fode Drame: And if only there was another chance of return [to the earth] for us, we would be truly of those who are the believers.”

103.Fode Drame: Truly in that surely is a sign and most of them are not believers.

104.Fode Drame: And truly it is your Lord who surely is The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

105.Fode Drame: The people of Noah belied the messengers.

106.Fode Drame: When their brother Noah said to them, “Will you not safeguard your own souls?

107.Fode Drame: I am a trustworthy messenger for you.

108.Fode Drame: So revere Allah and obey me.

109.Fode Drame: And I do not ask you of any fee for it, for my fee is only on the Lord of the worlds.

110.Fode Drame: So revere Allah and obey me.”

111.Fode Drame: They said, “Shall we believe in you when only the lowest of people follow you?”

112.Fode Drame: He said, “What do I know about that which they used to do.

113.Fode Drame: For their reckoning is only upon my Lord if only you were aware.

114.Fode Drame: And I am not going to drive away the believers,

115.Fode Drame: for I am but a manifest warner.”

116.Fode Drame: They said, “If you refrain not O Noah, certainly you will be of those who are stoned [to death].”

117.Fode Drame: He said, “O my Lord! My people have indeed belied me

118.Fode Drame: so judge between me and them with a criterion and save me and those who are with me from among the believers.”

119.Fode Drame: So We saved him and those who were with him in the fully loaded ark.

120.Fode Drame: Then thereafter We drowned those who remained behind.

121.Fode Drame: Truly in that there is surely a sign but most of them were not believers.

122.Fode Drame: And truly your Lord indeed is The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

124.Fode Drame: When their brother Hud said to them, “Will you not safeguard your own souls?

125.Fode Drame: Truly I am for you a trustworthy messenger.

126.Fode Drame: So revere Allah and obey me.

127.Fode Drame: And I do not ask from you of any fee for it, for my fee is only on the Lord of the worlds.

128.Fode Drame: Do you build on every high place a spectacular monument for delightful sport?

129.Fode Drame: And do you choose for yourself magnificent buildings so that you may attain everlastingness?

130.Fode Drame: And when you strike, you strike tyrannically.

131.Fode Drame: So revere Allah and obey me.

132.Fode Drame: And revere Him who has endowed you with all that you know;

133.Fode Drame: he endowed you with cattle and children

134.Fode Drame: and gardens and springs of water.

135.Fode Drame: Lo! I fear for you the punishment of an awful day.”

136.Fode Drame: They said, “It is all the same to us whether you admonish or you are not of those who are the admonishers.

137.Fode Drame: This is nothing but the tradition of the ancients.

138.Fode Drame: And we are not those who are going to be punished.”

139.Fode Drame: And they belied him so We destroyed them. Truly in that surely is a sign but most of them were not believers.

140.Fode Drame: And truly your Lord indeed it is He who is The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

141.Fode Drame: The [people of] Samood belied the messengers.

142.Fode Drame: When their brother Salih said to them, “Will you not Safeguard your souls?

143.Fode Drame: Truly I am for you a trustworthy messenger.

144.Fode Drame: So revere Allah and obey me.

145.Fode Drame: And I do not ask you of any fee for it, for my reward is but on the Lord the worlds.

146.Fode Drame: Will you be left all safe in this which is right here now? -

147.Fode Drame: In gardens and springs of water

148.Fode Drame: and in crops and date-palms with delectable spathes.

149.Fode Drame: And you carve tall houses out of the mountains.

150.Fode Drame: So revere Allah and obey me.

151.Fode Drame: And do not obey the command of those who waste their own souls.

152.Fode Drame: It is they who spread corruption in the land and do not make things right.”

153.Fode Drame: They said, “You are but of those who are bewitched.

154.Fode Drame: You are but a human like us therefore bring a sign if you are of those who are the truthful.”

155.Fode Drame: He said, “This is a she-camel. She has her turn to drink and you have your turn to drink on a day well appointed.

156.Fode Drame: And do not touch her with any harm lest the punishment of an awful day seize you”.

157.Fode Drame: But they hamstrung her and thereupon they became full of regret.

158.Fode Drame: Therefore the punishment seized them. Truly in that indeed is a sign but most of them were not believers.

159.Fode Drame: And truly your Lord, it is He who is The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

160.Fode Drame: And the people of Lot belied the messengers.

161.Fode Drame: When their brother Lot said to them, “Will you not safeguard your souls?

162.Fode Drame: I am indeed for you a trustworthy messenger

163.Fode Drame: so revere Allah and obey me.

164.Fode Drame: And I do not ask you for any fee for it, for my reward is but on the Lord of the worlds.

165.Fode Drame: Of all the people [out of lust] do you come only to men?

166.Fode Drame: And you abandon that which your Lord has created for you from your mates? Nay! You are a people of transgressors.”

167.Fode Drame: They said, “If you refrain not O Lot! You will most certainly be of those who are expelled.”

168.Fode Drame: He said, “Truly I am of those who abhor your doings.

169.Fode Drame: O my Lord! Save me and my family from all that they are doing.”

170.Fode Drame: So We saved him and his family altogether,

171.Fode Drame: except an old woman who was of those who were left behind.

173.Fode Drame: And we rained upon them a rain and how woeful was the rain of those who were warned.

174.Fode Drame: Truly in that indeed is a sign but most of them were not believers.

175.Fode Drame: And your Lord, it is He who indeed is The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

176.Fode Drame: The dwellers of the wooded valley belied the messengers.

177.Fode Drame: When Shoaib said to them, “Will you not safeguard your souls?

178.Fode Drame: I am indeed a trustworthy messenger for you.

179.Fode Drame: So revere Allah and obey me.

180.Fode Drame: And I do not ask you of any fee for it, for my reward is only on the Lord of the worlds.

181.Fode Drame: Fulfill the measure and be not of those who are the cheaters.

182.Fode Drame: And weigh with the most upright scale.

183.Fode Drame: And do not cheat people of their things and do not go about the earth spreading corruption therein.

184.Fode Drame: And revere Him who created you and the past generations.”

185.Fode Drame: They said, “You are but of those bewitched.

186.Fode Drame: And you are but a human like us and we think that you surely are among the liars.

187.Fode Drame: Therefore make fragments of the heaven to fall upon us if you are of those who are the truthful.”

188.Fode Drame: He said, “My Lord knows best about all that you do.”

189.Fode Drame: But they belied him so the punishment of the day of the cloud seized them. Truly it was a punishment of an awful day.

190.Fode Drame: Truly in that is surely a sign and most of them were not believers.

191.Fode Drame: And truly your Lord, it is He who surely is The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

192.Fode Drame: And truly it is most certainly a revelation of the Lord of the worlds.

193.Fode Drame: Revealed by the most trustworthy spirit.

194.Fode Drame: To your heart so that you be of those who are the warners.

195.Fode Drame: In the Arabic tongue which makes things clear.

196.Fode Drame: And it indeed is truly in the books of wisdom of the ancients.

197.Fode Drame: Is it not a sign for them that people of knowledge of the children of Israel do know it?

198.Fode Drame: And had We revealed it to someone of non-Arabic tongue

199.Fode Drame: and he recited it unto them, they were not going to be believers in it.

200.Fode Drame: Thus We have made it to seep through the hearts of the evildoers.

201.Fode Drame: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment

202.Fode Drame: and it will come upon them all of a sudden while they are not aware.

203.Fode Drame: Then they will say, “Are we going to be the ones given respite?”

204.Fode Drame: Or is it that they are asking for Our punishment to be brought on hastily.

205.Fode Drame: Do you see that if We were to make them enjoy [life] for few years,

206.Fode Drame: and thereafter comes to them that which they were promised.

207.Fode Drame: All that they were made to enjoy did not avail them.

208.Fode Drame: And We never did destroy a township except that there were warners for it.

209.Fode Drame: For the purpose of reminding and We were never wrongful [to anyone].

210.Fode Drame: And it was never revealed by the devils.

211.Fode Drame: And it is not fit for them and they cannot [bring it down].

212.Fode Drame: Truly they are kept far from the hearing [of revelation].

213.Fode Drame: Therefore do not invoke with Allah any other deity lest you be of those who are punished.

214.Fode Drame: And warn your kinsfolk who are the nearest.

215.Fode Drame: And lower your wings for those who follow you from among the believers.

216.Fode Drame: And if they disobey you then say, “I am innocent from all that you do.”

217.Fode Drame: And put your trust on The All-mighty, The Most Merciful;

218.Fode Drame: He who sees you when you rise [for prayer]

219.Fode Drame: and your alternate movements among those who prostrate.

220.Fode Drame: For it is He who is The All-hearing, The All-knowing.

221.Fode Drame: Shall I inform you about who it is upon whom the devils come down?

222.Fode Drame: They come down on every lying sinful person.

223.Fode Drame: They [devils] strain their hearing while most of them are liars.

224.Fode Drame: And as for the poets, those who have gone astray follow them.

225.Fode Drame: Have you not seen that they [poets] indeed wander aimlessly in every valley?

226.Fode Drame: And that they say what they do not do.

227.Fode Drame: Except those who believe and do the righteous deeds and remember Allah a lot and seek redress after they are wronged and those who do wrong in time will know which place of return will they return to.

1.Fode Drame: Ta. Seen. These are signs of the Quran and [signs] of a book that makes things clear.

2.Fode Drame: A guidance and glad tidings for the believers.

3.Fode Drame: Those who establish the prayer and give the sanctifying dues while they are certain about the hereafter.

4.Fode Drame: Indeed those who do not believe in the hereafter, We have made their deeds seem goodly to them so they wander in the darkness.

5.Fode Drame: It is they for whom there is the evil of the punishment while it is they who are the biggest losers in the hereafter.

6.Fode Drame: And truly you [O Muhammad] have indeed received the Quran from the presence of One who is All-wise, All-knowing.

7.Fode Drame: When Moses said to his family, “I have indeed perceived a fire and I will soon bring you from it a news [about the way] or I will bring you a burning brand so that you perhaps may warm yourselves.”

8.Fode Drame: And when he came over to it, he was called that, “Blessed be the one in the fire and those around it and glory be to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

9.Fode Drame: O Moses! Truly that is I, Allah, The All-mighty, The All-wise.

10.Fode Drame: And that throw your stick.” But when he saw it quaking as though it were a daemon, he turned his back and did not retrace his steps. “O Moses! Do not fear, for truly the messengers fear not in My presence.

11.Fode Drame: Except one who has done wrong to his soul but then thereafter replaced wrong with good. Truly then I am Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

12.Fode Drame: And put your hand in your pocket and it will come out shining white not due to any harm; among nine signs for the Pharaoh and his people.” Truly they are a people who have transgressed against Allah’s commandment.

13.Fode Drame: But when Our signs openly visible came to them, they said, “This is clear magic.”

14.Fode Drame: And they denied them out of wrongfulness and self-conceit though their souls were ascertained about it. Therefore look how was the ending of the corrupters.

15.Fode Drame: And We indeed gave knowledge to David and Solomon and they both said, “The praise is for Allah who has favored us above many of His servants who are the believers.”

16.Fode Drame: And Solomon succeeded David and he [Solomon] said, “O people! We have been given the knowledge of the speech of the birds and we have been given from all things. Lo! This indeed is the favor, the most clear.”

17.Fode Drame: And before Solomon were gathered his hosts out of the Jinns and of the humans and of the birds as they were pressed forward.

18.Fode Drame: Until when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said, “O you ants! Enter your dwellings lest Solomon and his hosts crush you while they are not aware.”

19.Fode Drame: Thereupon he smiled laughing from her word and he said, “O my Lord, exhort me that I should be grateful for your blessing with which You blessed me and blessed my parents and that I do righteous deeds which You are pleased with and admit me through Your mercy among your servants who are the righteous.”

20.Fode Drame: And he inspected the birds and then he said, “Why is it that I see not the hoopoe or is he one of the absentees?

21.Fode Drame: I will most certainly punish him a severe punishment or I will most certainly slaughter him or else he must bring me a clear proof.”

22.Fode Drame: But he did not tarry for long and he said [when he arrived], “I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you [Solomon] have not encompassed and I have come to you from Sheba with an ascertained news.

23.Fode Drame: Behold I found a woman reigning over them and she has been given of everything and she has a magnificent throne.

24.Fode Drame: And I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah and Satan has made their deeds seem goodly in their sights so he hindered them from the way therefore they are not guided.

25.Fode Drame: So that they do not prostrate for Allah Who brings forth that which is hidden in the heavens and in the earth and Who knows what you conceal and what you reveal.

26.Fode Drame: That is Allah. There is no deity except He, Lord of the magnificent throne.”

27.Fode Drame: He said, “We will soon see whether you have said the truth or whether you are one of the liars.

28.Fode Drame: Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them then turn back from them and see what they respond.”

29.Fode Drame: She said, “O you chieftains! Lo! A graceful letter has been delivered to me.

30.Fode Drame: Lo! It is from Solomon and it is ‘In the name of Allah Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful], The Most Merciful.’

31.Fode Drame: ’Do not overbear yourselves against me and come to me in submission.’”

32.Fode Drame: She said, “O you chieftains! Give me your opinions in this matter of mine for I am not going to decide a matter unless you witness with me.”

33.Fode Drame: They said, “We are a people of power and a people of mighty war but the command is yours, so see that which you will command.”

34.Fode Drame: She said, “Truly the sovereigns when they enter a township they corrupt it and they make its noble people into dishonorable ones and it is thus that they act.

35.Fode Drame: And Lo! I am going to send a gift to them and see with what will come back the messengers.”

36.Fode Drame: When he came to Solomon he said, “Will you purvey me with wealth for that which Allah has given me is better than that which He has given you. Nay! You take joy in your gift.

37.Fode Drame: Go back to them. We will certainly come to them with hosts that they cannot withstand and we will most certainly drive them out from there dishonored and disgraced.”

38.Fode Drame: He said, “O you chieftains! Which one of you will bring to me her throne before they come to me in submission?”

39.Fode Drame: A powerful one from the Jinns said, “I will bring it to you before you rise from your station and truly I am indeed strong and trustworthy over it.”

40.Fode Drame: He said the one with whom was knowledge from the book, “I will bring it to you before you wink your eyes.” and when he saw it firmly stationed in his presence he said, “This is from the favor of my Lord so that He may test me whether I will be grateful or I will be ungrateful and whosoever is grateful he is only grateful for the good of his own soul and whosoever is ungrateful Lo! My Lord is All-self-Sufficient, Most Gracious.”

41.Fode Drame: He said, “Change the appearance of her throne for her and we will see if she will be guided or that she will be of those who are not guided.”

42.Fode Drame: So when she came it was said, “Is your throne like this?” She said, “It is as though it is the very one.” [Solomon Said], “And we were given the knowledge before her as we were in submission.”

43.Fode Drame: And she was hindered by that what she used to worship instead of Allah. She truly was from a people who disbelieved.

44.Fode Drame: It was said to her, “Enter the tower” but once she saw it, she thought it to be a wave of water and she uncovered her both legs. He said, “It indeed is a tower which has been paved smooth with crystal.” She said, “O My Lord! I indeed have wronged my own soul and I indeed have now submitted myself with Solomon to Allah, Lord of the worlds.”

45.Fode Drame: And We did send to Thamud their brother Salih saying, “Worship Allah.” But Lo! They became two parties, all contending with one another.

46.Fode Drame: He said, “O my people! Why are you prompted to the evil before the good? If only you seek forgiveness from Allah perhaps you may receive mercy.”

47.Fode Drame: They said, “We augur ill omen from you and from those with you.” He said, “Your ill omen is with Allah. Nay! You are a people under trial.”

48.Fode Drame: And there used to be in the city a clan of nine men who used to do corruption in the land and they did not use to make things right.

49.Fode Drame: They said, “Take a solemn oath from one another by Allah that we will surely attack him and his family by night and then we will surely tell his lawful heir that we did not witness the killing of his family member and we surely are truthful in our claim.”

50.Fode Drame: And they devised a plan and We devised a plan while they were not aware.

51.Fode Drame: Then look at how was the ending of their plan that We indeed annihilated them and their people altogether.

52.Fode Drame: And there their houses are all deserted because of that they wronged their own souls. Indeed in that is truly a sign for a people who know.

53.Fode Drame: And We saved those who believed and used to revere Allah.

54.Fode Drame: And [remember] Lot when he said to his people, “Will you commit the offensive crime while you see openly?

55.Fode Drame: Do you go to the men for the fulfillment of your lust instead of the women? Nay! You are a people who are ignorant.”

56.Fode Drame: But the response of his people was nothing other than that they said, “Drive out the family of Lot from your town for they indeed are a people who deem themselves clean.”

57.Fode Drame: So We saved him and his family except his wife; We decreed her to be among those who were left behind.

58.Fode Drame: And We rained upon them a rain and how woeful is the rain of those who are warned.

59.Fode Drame: Say, “The praise is for Allah and peace is upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is Allah better or those that they ascribe as partners to Him?”

60.Fode Drame: Lo! He who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you from the heaven water with which We cause gardens to grow joyfully bedecked, it was not for you to cause its tree to grow. Is there a deity with Allah? Nay! They are a people who swerve.

61.Fode Drame: Lo! He who made the earth firmly established and He made rivers to flow through it and He made mountains as anchorage for it and He made a boundary between the two oceans. Is there a deity with Allah? Nay most of them know not.

62.Fode Drame: Lo! He who responds to the one in distress when he calls Him and removes the woe and makes you vicegerents of the earth. Is there a deity with Allah? How little do you remember?

63.Fode Drame: Lo! He who guides you in the darknesses of the land and of the sea and He who sends the winds as bearers of good tidings ahead of His mercy. Is there a deity with Allah? Far exalted is Allah above all that they ascribe as partners to Him.

64.Fode Drame: Lo! He who starts the creation and then repeats it and He who provides you sustenance from the heaven and from the earth. Is there a deity with Allah? Say, “Bring your proof if you are indeed truthful.”

65.Fode Drame: Say, “No one in the heavens and in the earth knows the unseen except Allah. And they are not aware of when they will be resurrected.”

66.Fode Drame: Nay! Their knowledge will only attain in the hereafter. Nay they are in incredulity about it; nay, they are all blind with regards to it.

67.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieve said, “What? If we and our fathers had become dust, are we truly going to be brought forth?”

68.Fode Drame: Indeed we were promised this, we and our fathers before but this is nothing except tales of the ancient.

69.Fode Drame: Say, “Travel in the earth and look at how was the ending of the evildoers.”

70.Fode Drame: And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress about that which they devise.

71.Fode Drame: And they say, “When will this promise come to pass, if you are indeed truthful?”

72.Fode Drame: Say, “Perhaps part of that which you are asking for in haste may have already drawn close to you.”

73.Fode Drame: And indeed your Lord is truly the master of favors to the mankind but most of them do not offer gratitude.

74.Fode Drame: And indeed your Lord surely knows all that their chests conceal and all that they reveal.

75.Fode Drame: And there is nothing hidden in the heaven and in the earth except that it is in a book which makes things clear.

76.Fode Drame: Truly this Quran relates unto the children of Israel most of that in which they are at variance.

77.Fode Drame: And indeed it is truly a guidance and a mercy for the believers.

78.Fode Drame: Truly your Lord is going to judge between them by His decree and He is The All-mighty, The All-knowing.

79.Fode Drame: So put your trust in Allah for indeed you are on the truth, the most manifest.

80.Fode Drame: Truly you cannot make the dead hear and you cannot make the deaf hear the call when they turn their back away.

81.Fode Drame: And you are not going to guide the blind from their misguidance. You cannot make hear except one who believes in Our signs while they are in submission.

82.Fode Drame: And when the word will come down upon them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth. It will speak to them saying, “The humankind were not in certitude about Our signs.”

83.Fode Drame: And the day when We shall gather from every nation a group out of those who belie Our signs while they are driven in flocks as they are pressed forward.

84.Fode Drame: Until when they come and He says, “Did you belie My signs while you had not comprehended it in knowledge or what was it that you were doing?”

85.Fode Drame: And the word [of punishment] will fall upon them because they wronged their own souls and behold they will not speak.

86.Fode Drame: Have they not seen that We have made the night so that they may find rest in it and We made the day bright. Truly in that surely are signs for a people who believe.

87.Fode Drame: And the day when the trumpet will be blown. Then everyone in the heavens and everyone in the earth will be stricken with fear except he whom Allah pleases and each of them will come to Him all subdued.

88.Fode Drame: And you see the mountains which you think are fixed while they pass by the way the cloud passes. Handicraft of Allah who has made everything well. Truly He is well acquainted with all that you do.

89.Fode Drame: Whoever comes with the good, for him will be something better out of it while they are saved from the terror of that day.

90.Fode Drame: And whoever comes with the evil, then they will be thrown down on their faces in the fire. Are you rewarded for aught except what you used to do?

91.Fode Drame: I have been commanded only to worship the Lord of this city who has made it sacred and to Him belongs everything and I have been commanded to be of those who have submitted.

92.Fode Drame: And that I should rehearse the Quran. Thus whoever seeks guidance, he is only seeking guidance for the good of his own soul and whoever goes astray then say, “I am only of those who are the warners.”

93.Fode Drame: And say, “The praise is for Allah. He will soon show you His signs therefore you will recognize them and your Lord is not oblivious of all that you do.”

1.Fode Drame: Ta. Sin. Mim.

2.Fode Drame: These are signs of the book that makes things clear.

3.Fode Drame: We relate unto you some of the news of Moses and Pharaoh by the truth for a people who believe.

4.Fode Drame: Truly Pharaoh became overbearing in the land and made its people into factions. He oppressed a group of them slaughtering their male children and keeping alive their females. Truly he was of those who are the corrupters.

5.Fode Drame: And We wish to confer Our grace upon those who were oppressed in the earth and to make them leaders and to make them the inheritors.

6.Fode Drame: And [We wish] to establish them in the earth and to show Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts all that they used to wary about with regards to them [the oppressed].

7.Fode Drame: And We inspired the mother of Moses that suckle him but if you have fear about him, then cast him in the river and do not fear and do not grieve, for surely We are going to return him back to you and We are going to make him one of the messengers.

8.Fode Drame: The people of Pharaoh picked him up for that he is going to be for them an enemy [cause of fear] and grief. Truly Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were sinners.

9.Fode Drame: And Pharaoh’s wife said, “Coolness of eye for me and for you. Therefore do not kill him. Perhaps he may be of benefit to us or we may take him as a son [unto us]” while they were not aware.

10.Fode Drame: And the heart of the mother of Moses became empty. She was almost going to disclose about him had We not fastened her heart so that she may be of those who are the believers.

11.Fode Drame: And she said to his sister, “follow him” so she saw him from a distance while they were not aware.

12.Fode Drame: And We had prohibited unto him to suckle from nurse-mothers before so she [his sister] said, “May I indicate to you a household who may take charge of him for you and they will sincerely look after him.”

13.Fode Drame: So We returned him to his mother so that her eye may find coolness and that she may not grieve and that she may know that the promise of Allah is true but most of them do not know.

14.Fode Drame: And when he reached the fullness of his strength and reached complete maturity of mind, We gave him wisdom and knowledge and it is thus that We reward those who act in excellence.

15.Fode Drame: And he entered the city at a time when its people were off their guard and he found therein two men fighting, this one from his own faction and this one from his enemies, and the one from his faction called out to him for help against the one who is from his enemy, so Moses struck him with his fist and thus he killed him and he said, “This is of the work of Satan. He truly is an enemy who clearly leads people astray.”

16.Fode Drame: He said, “O My Lord! I have indeed wronged my own soul therefore forgive me” so He forgave him, for He indeed is He who is The Oft-Forgiving, The Most Merciful.

17.Fode Drame: He said, “O My Lord! Since that you have blessed me therefore I shall never be a supporter for the evildoers.”

18.Fode Drame: And he spent the night in the city until morning fearful and was vigilant and behold the one who sought his help yesterday is again crying out to him for help. Then Moses said to him, “You indeed are truly in open error.”

19.Fode Drame: But when he wanted to lay hands on the one who was an enemy to both of them he [the Israelite] said, “O Moses, do you want to kill me as you killed a soul yesterday? You want to be but a tyrant in the land and you do not want to be of those who make things right.”

20.Fode Drame: And a man from the farthest end of the city came walking with a graceful demeanor and said, “O Moses! The chieftains are taking counsel against you in order to kill you therefore go out [from here], for I truly am of those who sincerely give you good counsel.”

21.Fode Drame: So he went out from there fearful and he was vigilant. He said, “O My Lord! Save me from the people who do wrong to their own souls.”

22.Fode Drame: And when he turned his face towards Madian he said, “Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the mid-most way.”

23.Fode Drame: And when he came to the water of Madian, he found about it a group of people who were fetching water and he found besides them two women who were holding back [their flock]. He said, “What is the matter with the two of you?” They both said, “We do not give water [to our flock] to drink until the shepherds take their flocks away from the water and our father is a very old man.”

24.Fode Drame: So he watered [their flocks] for them and then he turned away to the shade and then he said, “O my Lord! I am truly in need of any good that you may bestow upon me.”

25.Fode Drame: Soon after, one of the two women came to him walking with shyness. She said, “My father is calling you to pay you the fee for that you fetched the water for us.” and when he came to him and related the stories to him he said, “Fear not. You are safe from the people who wrong their own souls.”

26.Fode Drame: One of the two women said, “O my father! Hire him, truly the best man to hire is the strong, the trustworthy.”
