35.Fode Drame: He who has made us settle in the home of the everlasting abode from His favor. No toil will touch us therein nor will weariness touch us therein.

36.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieve, for them will be the fire of hell. They are not overwhelmed by it so that they die nor its punishment made light upon them. Thus do We reward anyone who is ungrateful.

37.Fode Drame: And they will cry therein for help, “O our Lord! Take us out so that we do righteous deeds not the ones that we used to do.” Have We not lengthened your age so that anyone who wants to remember has a time to remember therein and the warner had come to you. Therefore taste for there is no helper for those who wrong their own souls.

38.Fode Drame: Truly Allah is All-knowing about the unseen of the heavens and of the earth and Truly He is All-knowing about the essence of the bosoms.

39.Fode Drame: He it is who has appointed you vicegerents in the earth. So whoever disbelieves, his disbelief is only against himself. And the disbelief of the disbelievers increases them in nothing in the sight of Allah except in despise and the disbelief of the disbelievers increases them in nothing except in loss.

40.Fode Drame: Say, “Have you seen those partners that you call besides Allah, show me what have they created from the earth?” Have they a partner in the heavens or have We given them a book so that they are on a clear proof from it. Nay! Wrong doers promise one another nothing but delusion.

41.Fode Drame: Truly Allah holds the heavens and the earth lest they fall away and if they do fall away, no one else can hold them except Him. Truly He is indeed All-Magnanimous, Oft-Forgiving.

42.Fode Drame: And they swore by Allah with the most earnest of the oaths that if a warner comes to them, they will surely be better guided than anyone else of the nations but when a warner came to them, it increased them in nothing but aversion.

43.Fode Drame: Due to their arrogance in the land and the scheming of the evil. But the evil scheme will lay siege to no one else except its people. Or are they waiting except for the way of those who went before? You will never find a change in the way of Allah and you will never find an alteration in the way of Allah.

44.Fode Drame: Have they not travelled in the earth so that they looked at how was the ending of those before them while they were more formidable than them in strength. And nothing in the heavens or in the earth will ever frustrate Allah. Truly, He it is who is All-knowing, All-powerful.

45.Fode Drame: And if Allah were to take mankind to task for all that they have earned, He would not have left a single creature on its face but He gives respite to them till an appointed term. But when their term comes, then truly it is Allah who is All-seeing over His slaves.

1.Fode Drame: Ya. Sin.

2.Fode Drame: By the wise Quran.

3.Fode Drame: You indeed are truly one of the messengers

4.Fode Drame: on a path most upright.

5.Fode Drame: It is a revelation of The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

6.Fode Drame: So that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, therefore they are in oblivion.

7.Fode Drame: The sentence has indeed been passed in truth against most of them since they believe not.

8.Fode Drame: We have indeed put fetters around their necks reaching up to their chins so that they are stiff necked.

9.Fode Drame: And We have put a boundary before them and a boundary behind them and then We assailed them so that they cannot see.

10.Fode Drame: It is all equal to them whether you warn them or you do not warn them they will not believe.

11.Fode Drame: You can only warn the one who follows the remembrance and defers to The All-merciful from the unseen. So give him glad tidings of forgiveness and of a most gracious reward.

12.Fode Drame: It is We indeed who give life to the dead and it is We who write all that they send ahead of them and all that they leave behind them and everything We have taken full account of it in a book [imam] most evident.

13.Fode Drame: And set forth for them a parable of the people of the township when the messengers came to it.

14.Fode Drame: When We sent to them two [messengers] but they belied them so We reinforced [them] with a third and they said, “We indeed have been sent unto you.”

15.Fode Drame: They said, “You are but humans like us and The All-merciful has sent down nothing of the sort. You are but lying.”

16.Fode Drame: They said, “Our Lord knows that we indeed have truly been sent unto you

17.Fode Drame: and there is no duty upon us except the most evident deliverance of the message.”

18.Fode Drame: They said, “We indeed augur evil omen from you. If you do not desist, we will most certainly pelt you and a painful punishment will most certainly touch you from us.”

19.Fode Drame: They said, “Your evil omen is only with you. Is it because you are reminded? Nay! You are a people most wasteful.”

20.Fode Drame: And from the farthest end of the city came a man walking with a graceful demeanor, he said, “O my people, follow the messengers.

21.Fode Drame: Obey them who do not ask a reward from you while they are rightly guided.

22.Fode Drame: Why should I not worship the One who has originated me and unto Him you shall be returned?

23.Fode Drame: Should I take any deities besides Him? If The All-merciful intends me harm their intercession will be of no avail to me and they cannot rescue me.

24.Fode Drame: Then I will surely be in a misguidance most evident.

25.Fode Drame: I have indeed believed in your Lord so hear me.”

26.Fode Drame: He was told, “Enter the garden.” He said, “Would that my people had known

27.Fode Drame: how my Lord has forgiven me and has appointed me among those honored with grace.”

28.Fode Drame: And We sent not against his people after him any hosts from the heaven and We were not going to send down.

29.Fode Drame: It was but one deafening blast. Lo! They all lie lifeless.

30.Fode Drame: Oh! Sorrow unto the slaves. No messenger comes to them but that they mock at him.

31.Fode Drame: See they not how many generations before them We destroyed and [see they not] that they do not return back to them.

32.Fode Drame: There is no one among them except that they will all be brought back together to Our presence.

33.Fode Drame: It is a sign for them that the dead land, We give life to it and We bring forth from it a grain so that from it they eat.

34.Fode Drame: And We placed therein gardens of date trees and of grapes and We cause fountains to gush forth therein.

35.Fode Drame: So that they may eat from its produce though it was not their hands that worked it. Will they then not offer gratitude?

36.Fode Drame: Glory be unto the One who has created all pairs from which the earth produces and from themselves and from those that they know not.

37.Fode Drame: And it is a sign for them that the night We divest it of the day and behold they are in darkness.

38.Fode Drame: And the sun it runs towards the resting place for it. That is the measurement of The All-mighty, The All-knowing.

39.Fode Drame: And the moon We have measured for it phases until it comes back like the old crooked date stalk.

40.Fode Drame: It is not fitting for the sun to overtake the moon nor for the night to advance the day. And each swimming in an orbit.

41.Fode Drame: And there is a sign for them that We carried their seed in the heavily laden ship.

42.Fode Drame: And We have created for them from its likeness what they can ride.

43.Fode Drame: If We so pleased, We could drown them and there will be no one for them to cry to for help nor will they be rescued.

44.Fode Drame: But it is a mercy from Us and a temporary enjoyment for a little while.

45.Fode Drame: And when it is said unto them, “Safeguard yourselves from that which is in front of you and from that which is behind you perhaps that you may receive mercy.”

46.Fode Drame: And never comes unto them a sign from the signs of their Lord but that they turn their faces away from it.

47.Fode Drame: And when it is said unto them, “Spend from that what Allah has provided for you.” Those who disbelieve say to those who believe, “Do we feed one which if Allah so pleased would have fed him Himself. You are indeed but in manifest misguidance.”

48.Fode Drame: And they say, “When will this promise come to pass if you are indeed truthful.”

49.Fode Drame: They are waiting but for one deafening blast that will seize them while they are disputing.

50.Fode Drame: Then they will not be able to hand down their will nor will they return back to their folks.

51.Fode Drame: The trumpet was blown Lo! They are pouring out from their graves unto their Lord.

52.Fode Drame: They said, “Woe unto us. Who raised us from our place of resting?” “This is what The All-merciful had promised and the messengers had said the truth.”

53.Fode Drame: It was but one deafening blast Lo! They are all brought together in Our presence.

54.Fode Drame: And today no soul will be wronged in the least and you will not be rewarded except for that which you used to do.

55.Fode Drame: Truly the companions of the garden today are preoccupied in their merriment.

56.Fode Drame: They and their spouses in cool shades are reclining on couches.

57.Fode Drame: Therein for them will be fruits and therein for them will be all that they ask for.

58.Fode Drame: Peace! A word from a Lord Most Merciful.

59.Fode Drame: “Stand apart today O you the evildoers!

60.Fode Drame: Did I not exact a promise on you O children of Adam that you will not serve Satan? Truly he is a most evident enemy for you.

61.Fode Drame: And that you serve Me. This is a path most upright.

62.Fode Drame: And he has indeed misguided many generations of you. Did you then not use to understand?

63.Fode Drame: This is the hell of which you used to be promised.

64.Fode Drame: Burn in it today for that you used to disbelieve.”

65.Fode Drame: Today We will put a seal on their mouths and their hands will speak to Us and their feet will bear witness to all that they used to perpetrate.

66.Fode Drame: And if We Had so pleased, We could have wiped out their eyes so that they race towards the path but how can they see.

67.Fode Drame: And had We so pleased, We could have petrified them on their spots so that they will not be able to go forward nor go back.

68.Fode Drame: And whoever We grant lengthy age, We cause him to decline in the creation. Will they not then understand?

69.Fode Drame: And We have not taught him the poetry and it is not befitting for him. It is but a remembrance and a Quran most evident.

70.Fode Drame: So that he may warn him who is indeed living and the word is made true against the disbelievers.

71.Fode Drame: See they not that We have created for them cattle from among the things that Our hands have worked so that they have ownership on them?

72.Fode Drame: And We have made them subservient to them. From them some are for their ride and from some they eat.

73.Fode Drame: And in them for them are other benefits and drinks. Will they not then offer gratitude?

74.Fode Drame: And they have taken other deities besides Allah perhaps they will be helped [by them].

75.Fode Drame: They cannot help them while they are hosts ready for their service.

76.Fode Drame: Therefore let not their speech aggrieve you. We indeed know all that they conceal and all that they reveal.

77.Fode Drame: Has the human being not seen that it is We who created him from a drop of liquid? Behold he has become a contender most evident.

78.Fode Drame: And he has set forth a parable for Us and he forgot his own creation. He said, “Who can bring the bones to life when they have become rotten?”

79.Fode Drame: Say, “He will bring it to life the One who created it the first time and it is He who is All-knowing about all creation.

80.Fode Drame: He who made a fire for you from the green tree. Lo! You kindle from it.

81.Fode Drame: Is not the one who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them. Nay! He is The All-creator, The All-knowing.”

82.Fode Drame: His command is but when He intends a thing is that He says to it, “Be” and it is.

83.Fode Drame: So glory be unto Him in whose hand lies the inner dominion of everything and unto Him will you be returned.

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Fode Drame: By those [angels] arrayed in ranks.

2.Fode Drame: By those [angels] who are tugging the rope [of Allah].

3.Fode Drame: By those [angels] who proclaim the remembrance [of Allah].

4.Fode Drame: Truly your deity is surely One.

5.Fode Drame: Who is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth and all that is in between them and Lord of the rising points of the sun.

6.Fode Drame: Truly, We have adorned the lower heaven through an adornment of the stars.

7.Fode Drame: And also as a protection against any rebellious Satan.

8.Fode Drame: They cannot strain their hearing to the exalted company and they are driven back from every side.

9.Fode Drame: Cast out and for them is a tormenting punishment.

10.Fode Drame: Except the one who snatches a little fragment and then a piercing blaze follows him.

11.Fode Drame: Interrogate them are they harder to create than those [others] that We have created? Truly We have created them from a consistent clay.

12.Fode Drame: Nay! You do admire with wonderment while they mock.

13.Fode Drame: And when they are reminded, they do not remember.

14.Fode Drame: And when they see a sign, they continue to mock.

15.Fode Drame: And they say, “This is but an evident magic.”

16.Fode Drame: What? When we have died and we have become dust and rotten bones, are we truly going to be raised?

17.Fode Drame: Or our fathers of old?

18.Fode Drame: Say, “Yes and you indeed will be in a state of abject humiliation.”

19.Fode Drame: It is but a single tug of rope and Lo! They all stand wide awake.

20.Fode Drame: And they will say, “Woe unto us. This is the day of recompense.”

21.Fode Drame: This is the day of segregation which you used to belie.

22.Fode Drame: Gather those who have wronged their own souls and their pairs and all that they used to worship

23.Fode Drame: besides Allah and then guide them to the path of the hellfire.

24.Fode Drame: And now stop them for they indeed are going to be questioned.

25.Fode Drame: What is amiss with you that now you are not helping one another.

26.Fode Drame: Nay! Today they are going to willingly submit to Allah.

27.Fode Drame: And they turn to one another as they enquire from one another.

28.Fode Drame: They will say, “You truly used to approach us from the right side.”

29.Fode Drame: They will say, “Nay! You used not to be believers.”

30.Fode Drame: Nor did we have any authority over you. Nay! You were a people who were transgressors.

31.Fode Drame: So the sentence of our Lord has been made true against us. We indeed are surely going to taste [the punishment].

32.Fode Drame: We ourselves were gone on a narrow way so we led you to a narrow way.

33.Fode Drame: Therefore truly on that day, they will be associates in the punishment.

34.Fode Drame: Thus indeed it is that We do unto the evildoers.

35.Fode Drame: Truly they used to persist in their arrogance when they were told that there is no deity except Allah.

36.Fode Drame: And they used to say, “What? Are we indeed going to abandon our deities for the sake of a poet who is possessed?”

37.Fode Drame: Nay! He has come with the truth and has testified to the truth of the messengers.

38.Fode Drame: You indeed are going to taste the painful punishment.

39.Fode Drame: And you are not rewarded except for that which you used to do.

40.Fode Drame: Exempted are the sincere servants of Allah.

41.Fode Drame: For these there will be a special sustenance.

42.Fode Drame: Fruits, while they are in a state honored with grace

43.Fode Drame: in gardens of the bliss,

44.Fode Drame: and on couches facing one another.

45.Fode Drame: A cup from a pure source will be served around unto them.

46.Fode Drame: White, tasteful for the drinkers.

47.Fode Drame: There will be no headache in it [for them] nor will they bleed from it.

48.Fode Drame: And with them are mates with lowered gaze and beauteous.

49.Fode Drame: As though they were eggs well-guarded.

50.Fode Drame: Then they will turn unto one another enquiring.

51.Fode Drame: One from among them will say, “I indeed used to have a companion

52.Fode Drame: Who used to say ‘Are you indeed of those who testified to the truth [about resurrection]

53.Fode Drame: What? After we have died and have become dust and rotten bones, are we truly going to be recompensed [for our deeds]?’”

54.Fode Drame: Another said, “Are you going to look out [and see]?”

55.Fode Drame: And he looked out and saw him in the midst of the hellfire.

56.Fode Drame: He said, “By Allah you indeed almost brought me to my destruction.”

57.Fode Drame: And had it not been for the blessing of my Lord, I would certainly have been of those who are brought [into the fire].

58.Fode Drame: Is it that we are not going to die?

59.Fode Drame: Except for our first death and that we are not going to be punished.

60.Fode Drame: This indeed truly is the magnificent success.

61.Fode Drame: For the like of this, let the workers work.

62.Fode Drame: Is that better as a welcome or the tree of the evil taste.

63.Fode Drame: We have truly made it a trial for those who wrong their own souls.

64.Fode Drame: Truly, it is a tree that grows from the very foundation of the hellfire.

65.Fode Drame: And its produce like unto the heads of the devils.

66.Fode Drame: Thus truly they surely are going to eat from it and they are going to fill their stomachs from it.

67.Fode Drame: And for them, on top of it [the fruit of the tree], there will be surely boiling water as mixture [to the food].

68.Fode Drame: Then indeed their place of return will be to the hellfire.

69.Fode Drame: Truly they found their fathers misguided.

70.Fode Drame: But they went running in their footsteps.

71.Fode Drame: And indeed most of the ancients before them had gone astray.

72.Fode Drame: And We had indeed sent warners among them.

73.Fode Drame: So now look how was the ending of those who were warned.

74.Fode Drame: Exempted are the sincere servants of Allah.

75.Fode Drame: And indeed Noah had cried out to Us and surely We are the best of those who respond.

76.Fode Drame: And We saved him and his folk from the great tribulation.

77.Fode Drame: And We caused his seeds to be the ones to remain.

78.Fode Drame: And We handed down his memory in the later generations.

79.Fode Drame: The word of Peace be on Noah among the nations.

80.Fode Drame: Thus indeed We reward those who act in excellence.

81.Fode Drame: For he indeed was one of Our believing servants.

82.Fode Drame: Then We caused the others to drown.

83.Fode Drame: And truly Abraham was surely of his adherence.

84.Fode Drame: When he came to his Lord with a peaceful heart.

85.Fode Drame: When he said to his father and to his people, “What is it that you are worshipping?

86.Fode Drame: What? Are you seeking besides Allah false gods?

87.Fode Drame: “So what do you think about the Lord of the worlds?”

88.Fode Drame: Then he took a look into the stars.

89.Fode Drame: So he said, “I indeed am sick.”

90.Fode Drame: So they turned their backs on him and left.

91.Fode Drame: Then he turned around to their gods and said, “Will you not eat?

92.Fode Drame: What is amiss with you? Will you not speak?”

93.Fode Drame: Then he turned around upon them striking them with the right hand [of power].

94.Fode Drame: So they came towards him making haste

95.Fode Drame: He said, “Do you worship that which you have sculpted yourselves?

96.Fode Drame: Whilst it is Allah who created you and all that you work.”

97.Fode Drame: They said, “Build him a building [of fire] and throw him in the blaze.”

98.Fode Drame: Thus they sought to undo him through their evil scheme but We caused them to be the ones brought most low.

99.Fode Drame: And he said, “I indeed am going to go to my Lord for soon He will guide me.

100.Fode Drame: O my Lord! Grant me one from the righteous [son].”

101.Fode Drame: Then We gave him the glad tidings about a boy who is forbearing.

102.Fode Drame: But when he attained the age of serious work with him he said, “My dear son! I indeed see in my dream that I indeed am slaughtering you so look then what is your view?” He said, “O my father! Do as you are commanded. You will soon find me, if Allah pleases, of those who are patient.”

103.Fode Drame: So when they both submitted and he laid him prostrate on his forehead,

104.Fode Drame: and We called out to him that, “O Abraham!

105.Fode Drame: You have indeed made the vision come true.” Thus do We indeed reward those who act in excellence.

106.Fode Drame: Truly this, surely it was the trial, the most evident.

107.Fode Drame: And We ransomed him with a magnificent sacrifice.

108.Fode Drame: And We handed down his remembrance in later generations.

109.Fode Drame: Word of peace be on Abraham!

110.Fode Drame: Thus do We reward those who act in excellence.

111.Fode Drame: Indeed he was from Our servants who were true believers.

112.Fode Drame: And We gave him the glad tidings of Isaac as a prophet from the righteous.

113.Fode Drame: And We bestowed Our blessing on him and on Isaac. And among their descendants are those who are evidently excellent in deeds for the benefit of their own souls and are those who evidently do wrong to their own souls.

114.Fode Drame: And We indeed bestowed our favor on Moses and Aaron.

115.Fode Drame: And We saved both of them and their people from the great tribulation.

116.Fode Drame: And We helped them so it was they who were the victorious.

117.Fode Drame: And We gave the two of them the book that is made clear.

118.Fode Drame: And We guided both of them to the path most upright.

119.Fode Drame: And We handed down their remembrance in later generations.

120.Fode Drame: Word of Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.

121.Fode Drame: Truly thus indeed do We reward those who act in excellence.

122.Fode Drame: Truly both of them were from Our believing servants.

123.Fode Drame: And truly Elijah was surely from among the messengers.

124.Fode Drame: When he said to his people, “Will you not revere Allah?

125.Fode Drame: Will you invoke Baal and forsake the most excellent of the creators?

126.Fode Drame: That is Allah, your Lord and Lord of your forefathers.”

127.Fode Drame: But they belied him so they indeed are truly of those who are brought [to Our judgment].

128.Fode Drame: Exempted are the sincere servants of Allah.

129.Fode Drame: And We handed down his remembrance in the later generations.

130.Fode Drame: Word of Peace be on Elijah.

131.Fode Drame: Truly thus do We reward those who act in excellence.

132.Fode Drame: Truly he was from among Our believing servants.

133.Fode Drame: And indeed Lot was truly from the messengers.

134.Fode Drame: When We saved him and his family altogether.

135.Fode Drame: Except an old woman who was among the bygones.

137.Fode Drame: And truly you pass them by in the morning

138.Fode Drame: “and at night. Will you not then understand?”

139.Fode Drame: And indeed Jonah was truly from the messengers.

140.Fode Drame: When he fled like a runaway slave to the laden ship.

141.Fode Drame: And he took part in drawing the lots but he was of those who lost.

142.Fode Drame: So the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy.

143.Fode Drame: Had it not been that he indeed was of those who glorify Allah.

144.Fode Drame: He would surely have remained in its belly till the day that they will be raised.

145.Fode Drame: Then We cast him on the arid shore while he was in a state of inertia.

146.Fode Drame: And We caused a gourd like tree to grow over him.

147.Fode Drame: And thereafter We sent him to a hundred thousand [people] or more.

148.Fode Drame: And they believed so We provided them a brief enjoyment [of this life] for a while.

149.Fode Drame: Now enquire from them is it that the daughters are for your Lord and the sons are for them?

150.Fode Drame: Or that We created the angels as females while they were present?

151.Fode Drame: Lo! Truly from their falsehood they surely say,

152.Fode Drame: “Allah had begotten” and truly they are the liars.

153.Fode Drame: Did He choose daughters above the sons?

154.Fode Drame: What is amiss with you? What is this manner in which you dispose?

156.Fode Drame: Or is it that for you there is an evident authority?

157.Fode Drame: Then bring along your book if you are indeed truthful.

158.Fode Drame: And they have invented a blood tie between Him and the Jinns and indeed the Jinns know that truly they surely are going to be brought [to the day of judgment].

159.Fode Drame: Glorified be Allah from all that they invent about him.

160.Fode Drame: Exempted are the sincere servants of Allah.

161.Fode Drame: And truly you and all that you worship,

162.Fode Drame: you are not going to cause anyone to be tempted by it,

163.Fode Drame: except one who is going to burn in the hellfire.

164.Fode Drame: “And there is not one among us except that for him is a station well marked.

165.Fode Drame: And truly we surely are those who stand in rows.

166.Fode Drame: And truly we surely are those who glorify Allah.”

167.Fode Drame: And indeed they truly used to say

168.Fode Drame: “Had there been with us a remembrance from those of old,

169.Fode Drame: we would certainly have been the sincere servants of Allah.”

170.Fode Drame: But now they have disbelieved in it and in time they will come to know.

171.Fode Drame: And indeed Our word has gone forth for Our slaves, the messengers.

172.Fode Drame: That truly it is they who surely will be helped [by Allah].

173.Fode Drame: And that truly Our hosts, it is surely they who will be the victors.

174.Fode Drame: So turn away [O Muhammad] from them till a while.

175.Fode Drame: And observe them, for in time they will come to see.

176.Fode Drame: Are they calling for Our punishment to come in haste.

177.Fode Drame: But when it comes down on their territory, Lo! How woeful is the morning of those who are warned.

178.Fode Drame: So turn away from them till a while.

179.Fode Drame: And observe, for in time they will come to see.

180.Fode Drame: Glory be unto your Lord, the Lord of the might for all that they invent about him.

181.Fode Drame: And the word of peace be unto the messengers.

182.Fode Drame: And the praise be unto Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

1.Fode Drame: Sad. By the Quran full of the remembrance.

2.Fode Drame: Nay those who disbelieve are in vain glory and dissension.

3.Fode Drame: How many of a generation before them have We destroyed and they called out [for salvation] when the time of escape had long gone by.

4.Fode Drame: And they wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves and the disbelievers say, “This is a magician full of lies.”

5.Fode Drame: Has he made the deities into one deity? Truly this surely is a thing astonishing.

6.Fode Drame: And the chiefs among them go about [saying] that, “Walk [on your way] and hold steadfastly onto your deities. Truly this surely is a thing most desired.

7.Fode Drame: We have never heard of this in the later religion. This is but a fabrication.

8.Fode Drame: Is the remembrance sent down on him from among us?” Nay they are in incredulity about My remembrance. Nay! They have not yet tasted My punishment.

9.Fode Drame: Or is it that with them are the treasures of mercy of your Lord, The All-mighty, The All-endowing?

10.Fode Drame: Or is it that theirs is the dominion of the heavens and of the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend into the doors [of the heavens and the earth].

11.Fode Drame: Whatever hosts of the confederates there may be, they are bound to be defeated.

12.Fode Drame: Before them belied the people of Noah and ‘Ad and Pharaoh, the owners of the pegs [The pyramids]

13.Fode Drame: and Thamud and people of Lot and the inhabitants of the wooded vales. Those are the confederates.

14.Fode Drame: There is no one [of them] except that they belied the messengers so My chastisement was rightly passed [against them].

15.Fode Drame: And these are waiting for nothing except for one deafening blast from which there will be no recovering for them.

16.Fode Drame: And they say, “O our Lord! Bring to us in haste our share [of punishment] before the day of reckoning.”

17.Fode Drame: Bear with patience all that they say and remember Our servant David, the master of power. Truly he was one who was crier to Allah.

18.Fode Drame: We indeed caused the mountains to be subjects [to him] they glorify with him [Our praises] in the evening and at sunrise,

19.Fode Drame: and the birds all assembled, all crier unto Him [after his manner].

20.Fode Drame: And We strengthened his kingdom and We gave him the wisdom and distinctiveness in speech.

21.Fode Drame: And has the news of the contendents come to you when they scaled the wall of the innermost chamber?

22.Fode Drame: When they suddenly came in upon David so he was attained by fear from them. They said, “Do not fear. We are two contendents. One of us has trespassed against the other therefore judge between us by the truth and do not transgress and guide us to the path most even.

23.Fode Drame: This indeed is my brother. He has ninety nine ewes and I only have one ewe but he said, ’Put her in my charge’ and he has overwhelmed me in speech.”

24.Fode Drame: He said, “He has indeed wronged you by asking to add your ewe to his ewes and truly many of the associates do trespass against one another except those who have full belief and work righteousness and few are they.” Thereupon David thought that We had just tried him so he sought forgiveness from his Lord and fell bowing down and returned [to his Lord].

25.Fode Drame: So We granted forgiveness to him about that and truly for him with Us is truly a place of proximity and an excellent place of return.

26.Fode Drame: O David! We have indeed appointed you as a vicegerent on earth therefore judge between people by the truth and do not follow the false desire lest it leads you astray from the way of Allah. Truly those who go astray from the way of Allah, for them there will be a formidable punishment because they forgot the day of reckoning.

27.Fode Drame: And We have not created the heaven and the earth and all that is in between them in vain. That is the thought of those who disbelieve. But woe from the fire unto all those who disbelieve.

28.Fode Drame: Shall We make those who believe and do righteous deeds like those who spread corruption in the earth? or shall We make those who revere Allah like those who transgress [against their Lord]?

29.Fode Drame: It is a book which We have sent down unto you full of blessings so that they may acknowledge in truth its signs and so that the people of heart take [it] for remembrance.

30.Fode Drame: And unto David We gave Solomon, - Best of the slaves. Truly he was a crier [unto Allah].

31.Fode Drame: When at eventide was brought before him the steeds of thorough breed.

32.Fode Drame: And he said, “I indeed have taken the love of the good [horses] above the remembrance of my Lord until it [the sun] disappeared behind the veil [of darkness of the night]

33.Fode Drame: Bring them back to me” and he fell to passing his hands over [their] legs and necks.

34.Fode Drame: And We had indeed tried Solomon and had thrown upon his chair a lifeless body then he returned to Us in repentance.

35.Fode Drame: He said, “O my Lord! Forgive me and bestow upon me a dominion which shall not be fitting for anyone [to have] after me. Truly you are The All-endowing.”

36.Fode Drame: Then We made the wind subservient to him. It moved gently by his command wherever he aims.

37.Fode Drame: And the devils [Jinns] of every builder and [every] diver [were made subservient to him].

38.Fode Drame: And others bound together in the fetters.

39.Fode Drame: This is Our gift so give or hold back without reckoning.

40.Fode Drame: And truly for him in Our presence surely is a station of proximity and an excellent place of return.

41.Fode Drame: And remember Our slave Job when He cried out unto his Lord that, “Satan has indeed touched me with fatigue and suffering.”

42.Fode Drame: Strike with your foot [the ground]. This is a cool bath and a drink.

43.Fode Drame: And We bestowed upon him, his family and a like number of them with them as a mercy from Us and as a remembrance for the people of heart.

44.Fode Drame: And hold with your hand a bundle of branches and with it hit and do not break your oath. Truly We found him one who was patient. How best of the slaves. Truly he was a crier [unto his Lord].

45.Fode Drame: And remember Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob; masters of the power and of the sight.

46.Fode Drame: We indeed have selected them purely for the remembrance of the home.

47.Fode Drame: And they indeed in Our sight are truly of those who were the chosen, the select.

48.Fode Drame: And remember Ishmael, and Elisha and Zul-kifl. All of them from the select.

49.Fode Drame: This is a remembrance. And as for those who revere Allah, is truly an excellent place of return;

50.Fode Drame: gardens of everlastingness, the doors will be open for them.

51.Fode Drame: Therein they will be reclining and therein they will be calling for lots of fruits and for drinks.

52.Fode Drame: And with them will be women with lowered gaze well matched.

53.Fode Drame: This is what you are promised for the day of reckoning.

54.Fode Drame: This indeed truly is Our provision [for you] which will never finish.

55.Fode Drame: This [is a glad tiding]. But indeed for the transgressors truly there is a place of return most evil;

56.Fode Drame: Hell - they will burn therein how woeful is the resting place.

57.Fode Drame: This is a boiling water and a freezing drink, let them taste it then,

58.Fode Drame: and another from a similar form all paired.

59.Fode Drame: This is a crowd erupting with you, no welcome for them. They indeed are going to be the ones burning in the fire.

60.Fode Drame: They say, “Nay! No welcome for you. It is you who have prepared this for us”. And how woeful is the place of dwelling.

61.Fode Drame: They say, “O our Lord! Whosoever has sent this forth for us, double then his punishment in the fire.”

62.Fode Drame: And they say, “What is the matter with us that we do not see some men that we used to count as from the evil ones?

63.Fode Drame: Is it that we took them for a jest or is it that the sights have wandered from them?”

64.Fode Drame: Truly that is surely the mutual recrimination of the people of the fire.

65.Fode Drame: Say, “I am but a warner and there is no deity except Allah, The One, The All Over-powering,

66.Fode Drame: Lord of the heavens and of the earth and of whatever is in between them, The All-mighty, The Oft-Forgiving.

67.Fode Drame: Say, “That is a magnificent news.”

68.Fode Drame: But you have turned away from it.

69.Fode Drame: I had no knowledge regarding the chieftains of the on-high as they disputed.

70.Fode Drame: It is only revealed to me that I am but an evident warner.

71.Fode Drame: When your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create a human out of clay.

72.Fode Drame: And once I have created him even [between water and dust] and I have blown in him from My spirit, then fall down prostrate for him.”

73.Fode Drame: So the angels fell prostrate all of them altogether;

74.Fode Drame: except Iblis, he grew arrogant and was one of the disbelievers.

75.Fode Drame: He said, “O Iblis! What has prevented you from prostrating for that which I have created with My both hands? Have you become one of the great ones or are you one of those of high?”

76.Fode Drame: He Said, “I am better than him. You created me from fire and You created him from clay.”

77.Fode Drame: He said, “Go out of it, for truly you are a pelted one.

78.Fode Drame: And truly My curse is on you until the day of the recompense.”

79.Fode Drame: He said, “O my Lord! Then give me respite until the day they shall be raised.”

80.Fode Drame: He said, “So you indeed are among those who are given the respite

81.Fode Drame: till the day of the appointed time”.

82.Fode Drame: He [Iblis] said, “And by Your might, I will surely cause them to go astray from the right path all of them”

83.Fode Drame: except Your servants among them who are the selected ones.

84.Fode Drame: He [Allah] said, “So it is the truth and the truth is what I say.

85.Fode Drame: Surely I will fill hellfire with you and with those who follow you among them altogether.”

86.Fode Drame: Say [O Muhammad], “I do not ask you for any reward for it nor am I of those who take it upon themselves.”

87.Fode Drame: It is but a remembrance for the worlds.

88.Fode Drame: And you will surely come to know its ascertained news after a little while.

1.Fode Drame: Revelation of the book from Allah, The All-mighty, The All-wise.

2.Fode Drame: Truly We have revealed the book unto you by the truth so worship Allah while making the religion sincere only for Him.

3.Fode Drame: Truly the sincere religion is for Allah only but those who have taken allies besides Him [they say], “We worship them not except that they may bring us very close to Allah.” Truly Allah will judge between them with wisdom in all that wherein they differ. Truly Allah does not guide one who is a liar, ungrateful.

4.Fode Drame: Had Allah willed to take [unto Himself] a son, truly He would have chosen that which He pleases from whatever He creates. Glory be unto Him. He is Allah, The One, The All Over-powering.

5.Fode Drame: He created the heavens and the earth by the truth. He causes the night to wrap around the day and He causes the day to wrap around the night and He has made the sun and the moon subservient, each running to an appointed term. Truly He is The All-mighty, The Oft-Forgiving.

6.Fode Drame: He created you from one life then He made its mate out of it and has sent down for you eight pairs from the cattle. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in three darknesses. That is Allah your Lord for Him is the dominion. There is no deity save He. Where then are you being turned away?

7.Fode Drame: If you show ingratitude, truly Allah is All-self-sufficient from you but He does not please the ingratitude for His slaves. But if you are grateful, He is pleased with it for your sake and no bearer of a burden can bear the burden of another and then unto your Lord will be your place of return. Then He will inform you about all that you used to do. Truly He is All-knowing about the essence of the bosoms.

8.Fode Drame: And when harm touches the human being, he calls unto his Lord turning back to Him but then when He grants him a grace from Himself, he forgets that unto Whom he used to cry before and he makes equals to Allah so that he may misguide [others] from His path. Say, “Enjoy your ingratitude for a little.” Truly you are of the companions of the fire.

9.Fode Drame: Is the one who devoutly worships in the hours of the night prostrating and standing, wary of the hereafter and places his hope in the mercy of his Lord [equal to one who does not]? Say, “Are those who know equal to those who do not know?” It is only the people of the heart who remember.

10.Fode Drame: Say, “O my slaves who believe, revere your Lord.” For those who act in excellence in this world, there is an excellent reward for them and Allah’s earth is wide. Only those who are steadfast and patient are given their reward in full without calculation.

11.Fode Drame: Say, “I indeed am commanded to worship Allah making the religion sincere for Him.”

12.Fode Drame: And I have been commanded that I should be of the first of those who have submitted themselves to Allah.

13.Fode Drame: Say, “I indeed fear should I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous day.”

14.Fode Drame: Say, “It is Allah that I worship making my religion sincere for Him.”

15.Fode Drame: Therefore you worship that which you please besides Him. Say, “Truly the losers are those who have lost their own souls and their families on the day of resurrection.” Lo! That is the most evident loss.

16.Fode Drame: There will be for them from above them waves from the fire and from beneath them waves [from the fire]. That is what Allah forewarns His servants with. Therefore O My servants revere Me.

17.Fode Drame: And those who keep themselves far from the Taghoot lest they serve it and they turn to Allah [in hope] for them are the glad tidings therefore give the glad tidings to My slaves.

18.Fode Drame: Those who hear the word and then follow the most excellent of it. It is they whom Allah has truly guided and it is they who are the people of the heart.

19.Fode Drame: Is one on whom the sentence of the punishment has passed [like one on whom the word of mercy has been made true]? Are you then going to rescue one who is in the fire?

20.Fode Drame: But those who revere their Lord, for them there will be mansions, above them mansions built high, the rivers flow beneath them. This is the promise of Allah. Allah fails not the promise.

21.Fode Drame: Have you not seen that Allah has sent down water from the sky and then caused it to run through waterways in the earth to water springs, then with it He brings forth a crop in various colors, then it moves into luxuriance, then you see it turn yellow, then He makes it into debris? Truly in that surely is a remembrance for the people of the heart.

22.Fode Drame: Is he whose bosom Allah has expanded towards self-submission [for Allah] so that he is on a light from his Lord [not better guided]? But woe unto those whose hearts are hard towards the remembrance of Allah. Those are in misguidance most evident.

23.Fode Drame: Allah has sent down the most excellent discourse as a book in pairs similar to one another. The skins of those who defer to their Lord shrink at it. Then their skins and their hearts soften towards the remembrance of Allah. That is the guidance of Allah He guides thereby whom He pleases and whoever Allah causes to go astray, there is no guide for him.

24.Fode Drame: Is one who wards off the evil punishment through His face on the day of resurrection [not better]? And it is told unto those who wrong their own souls, “Taste that which you used to perpetrate.”

25.Fode Drame: Those before them belied so the punishment came upon them from where they were not aware.

26.Fode Drame: So Allah made them taste the humiliation in this life but truly the punishment of the hereafter is greater if only they knew.

27.Fode Drame: And We have set forth for the mankind in this Quran from every type of similitude so that perhaps they may take to remembrance;

28.Fode Drame: a Quran in Arabic that has no crookedness [obscurity] so that perhaps they may revere Allah.

29.Fode Drame: Allah has set forth a parable… a man who is owned by partners who are at variance with one another and a man who is wholly dedicated to one man. Are the two equal in similitude? The praise is for Allah. Nay most of them do not know.

30.Fode Drame: Truly you [O Muhammad] are going to die and they too are certainly going to die.

31.Fode Drame: Then on the day of resurrection you most certainly will dispute with one another in the presence of your Lord.

32.Fode Drame: Who then does more wrong to his own soul than one who contrives a lie against Allah or belies the truth when it comes to him? Is there not in the hellfire an abode for the disbelievers?

33.Fode Drame: And he who comes with the truth and he who testifies to it, it is they who are those who safeguard their own souls.

34.Fode Drame: For them will be all that they please in the presence of their Lord. That is the reward of those who act in excellence.

35.Fode Drame: So that Allah may remove from them the worst of that they had done and may reward them their reward according to the best that they used to do.

36.Fode Drame: Is Allah not All-sufficient for His servant? But they try to frighten you with those besides Him. And whoever Allah causes to go astray, for him there is no guide.

37.Fode Drame: And whosoever Allah guides, for him there is no one to misguide. Is Allah not All-mighty, Master of retribution.

38.Fode Drame: And if you ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth?” They will surely say, “It is Allah.” Say, “Do you then see that those you invoke besides Allah, if Allah wills harm to me, will they be able to remove His harm or if He wills mercy for me, will they be able to hold back His mercy?” Say, “Allah is All-sufficient for me” and in Him let those who trust put their trust.

39.Fode Drame: Say, “O my people! Work hard from your stand, I am going to work hard [from my stand] and in time you will come to know.

40.Fode Drame: Who it is upon whom will come a punishment that will humiliate him [in this life] and upon whom will come down an abiding punishment [in the hereafter].”

41.Fode Drame: We have indeed sent down the book by the truth unto you for [benefit of] the mankind so whoever takes guidance it is for the benefit of his own soul and whoever wanders away from guidance, he only does so for the harm of his own soul and you are not a trustee over them.

42.Fode Drame: Allah it is He who takes the souls at the time of their death and the ones who have not died [he takes] at the time of their sleep. As for the one on whom the sentence of death He has passed, He withholds but the others He sends back till an appointed term. Truly in that surely are signs for a people who reflect.

43.Fode Drame: Or is it that they have taken unto themselves intercessors other than Allah? Say, “Even though they have dominion over nothing nor do they have understanding?”

44.Fode Drame: Say, “The intercession altogether is only for Allah. Dominion of the heavens and of the earth belongs to Him and unto Him you will be brought back.”

45.Fode Drame: And when Allah all alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the hereafter feel repugnant but when those besides Him [whom they have taken as partners] are mentioned lo! They are filled with joice.

46.Fode Drame: Say, “O Allah, Originator of the heavens and of the earth, Knower of the unseen and of the witnessed! It is You who judges between your slaves with wisdom in all that they used to differ therein.

47.Fode Drame: Those who wrong their own souls, even if they possessed all that is in the earth altogether and the like of it with it, they will surely pay it as a ransom from the evil of the punishment on the day of resurrection. And it was exposed unto them from Allah that which they never expected.

48.Fode Drame: And the evils of all that they perpetrated became exposed to them and they were besieged by all that they used to mock at.

49.Fode Drame: And whenever harm touches the human being, he cries out unto Us but when We endow him with a grace from Us, he says, “It is only given to me because of a knowledge.” Nay! It is a trial but most of them do not know.

50.Fode Drame: Truly, this was said by those before them but all that they earned was of no avail to them.

51.Fode Drame: So the evils of what they had perpetrated befell them. And those who had wronged their own souls from among these, the evils of that they have perpetrated will soon befall them and they are not going to be out of reach.

52.Fode Drame: Do they not know that Allah widens the sustenance for whom He pleases and constricts it [for whom He pleases]. Truly in that surely are signs for a people who believe.

53.Fode Drame: Say, “O my slaves those who have been wasteful towards their own souls! Do not despair from the mercy of Allah.” Truly Allah forgives the sins altogether. Truly He it is who is The Oft-Forgiving, The Most Merciful.

54.Fode Drame: And turn yourselves back to your Lord and submit yourselves for Him before the punishment comes upon you then you will not be helped.

55.Fode Drame: And follow the best of that which has been sent down unto you from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you are not aware.

56.Fode Drame: Lest a soul says, “Alas unto me for that I have been neglectful with regards to Allah and I was indeed one of those who were jesters.”

57.Fode Drame: Or lest it says, “If only Allah had guided me, I would surely have been among those who safeguard their own souls.”

58.Fode Drame: Or lest it says when it sees the punishment, “If only there could be a second turn for me, then I would most certainly be of those who act in excellence.”

59.Fode Drame: Nay! My signs did indeed come to you but you belied them and you grew arrogant and you were of those who disbelieved.

60.Fode Drame: And on the day of resurrection you will see those who lied against Allah their faces darkened. Is there not a dwelling place in hellfire for those who are arrogant?

61.Fode Drame: And Allah will save those who revere Him unto their place of salvation, no evil [fear] will touch them nor will they grieve.

62.Fode Drame: Allah is the Creator of all things and He is Trustee over everything.

63.Fode Drame: The keys of the heavens and of the earth belong to Him. But those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah, it is they who are the ones in loss.

64.Fode Drame: Say, “O you the ignorants! Do you then command me that I worship any other than Allah?”

65.Fode Drame: And it has indeed been revealed unto you and unto those before you that if you ever ascribe partners to Allah, surely your deeds will fall to naught and surely you will be among the ones in loss.

66.Fode Drame: Nay! Allah alone do you worship and be among those who are grateful.

67.Fode Drame: And they have not evaluated Allah to His true worth. The earth altogether will be in His fist on the day of resurrection and the heavens will be rolled up like a scroll by His right hand. Glory be unto Him and far exalted is He above all that they ascribe as partners unto Him.

68.Fode Drame: And the trumpet was blown into and everyone in the heavens and everyone in the earth was dazed except whom Allah pleases. Then it was blown into again and lo! They are all standing wide awake.

69.Fode Drame: And the earth brightened with the light of its Lord and the book was laid down and the prophets and the witnesses were brought forth and it [the matter] was decreed between them by the truth and they are not wronged.

70.Fode Drame: And every soul was rewarded in full for all that it had done and He knows best about all that they do.

71.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieved were driven to the hellfire in flocks until when they came to it, its doors were opened and its guardians said to them, “Did not the messengers from among yourselves come to you relating the signs of your Lord to you and warning you of the meeting of this day of yours?” They said, “Indeed.” But word of the punishment was already fulfilled upon the disbelievers.

72.Fode Drame: It was said unto them, “Enter you the doors of the hellfire to abide therein forever. How woeful is the dwelling place of those who are arrogant.”

73.Fode Drame: And those who revered their Lord were driven to the paradise in flocks until when they came to it and its doors were opened and its guardians said unto them, “Peace be on you. You are pure so enter it to abide herein forever.”

74.Fode Drame: And they said, “The praise is for Allah who has made His promise to us true and has caused us to inherit the earth we dwell in the garden wherever we please.” And how graceful is the reward of the workers.

75.Fode Drame: And you will see the angels surrounding the throne, they glorify the praise of their Lord and the matter between them was decreed by the truth and it was said, “The praise is for Allah, Lord of the worlds.”

1.Fode Drame: Ha. Mim.

7.Fode Drame: Those who carry the throne and those who are around it, glorify the praise of their Lord and they profess their belief in Him and they seek forgiveness for those who believe [saying],”O our Lord, You encompass everything in mercy and in knowledge, therefore grant forgiveness to those who have turned back to you and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of the hellfire.

8.Fode Drame: And admit them, O our Lord, into gardens of eternal bliss which you have promised them and those who are righteous among their fathers and their spouses and their progenies. Truly it is You who is The All-mighty, The All-wise.

10.Fode Drame: Truly those who disbelieved will be called that, “Surely Allah’s despise is greater than your despise of yourselves as you were called unto the faith but you disbelieved.”

11.Fode Drame: They said, “O our Lord! You have put us to death twice and You have brought us to life twice so we have admitted to our sins. Now is there any way to get out?”

12.Fode Drame: This is so because of that when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved but when partners were ascribed to Him, you believed. Truly the decision belongs to Allah, The All-high, The All-great.

13.Fode Drame: He it is who shows you His signs and sends down sustenance for you from the heaven. But none truly remembers except one who turns back to Allah.

14.Fode Drame: Therefore invoke Allah making the religion sincere for Him even though the disbelievers may be averse.

15.Fode Drame: Exalted [is He] in ranks, Master of the throne, He sends down the spirit from His commandment upon anyone He pleases from among His slaves so that he may warn of the day of the encounter.

16.Fode Drame: The day when they will all stand out, nothing is hidden from Allah about them. For Whom is the dominion today? It is for Allah, The One, The All Over-powering.

17.Fode Drame: Today every soul is rewarded for that which it had earned. There is no wronging today. Truly Allah is Swift in reckoning.

18.Fode Drame: And warn them of the day of close doom when the hearts will chokingly reach the throats. There will be no intimate friend nor intercessor worthy to be obeyed for those who wrong their own souls.

19.Fode Drame: He [Allah] knows the cheatings of the eyes and all that the bosoms conceal.

20.Fode Drame: And Allah judges by the truth and those they invoke besides Him, do not judge by anything. Truly Allah it is He who is The All-hearing, The All-seeing.

21.Fode Drame: Have they not travelled in the earth and seen how was the ending of those who were before them. They were stronger than them in power and [stronger] in traces left in the earth but Allah seized them for their sins and there was no protector for them from Allah.

22.Fode Drame: That was so because their messengers used to come to them with the clear signs but they disbelieved so Allah seized them. Truly He is All-strong, Formidable in the chastisement.

23.Fode Drame: And indeed We had sent Moses with Our signs and with a most evident authority

24.Fode Drame: to Pharaoh and Hamaan and Qarun but they said, “This is a magician full of lies.”

25.Fode Drame: So when he came unto them from Our presence with the truth they said, “Kill the sons of those who believe with him and keep the females alive.” but the scheme of the disbelievers is in nothing except error.

26.Fode Drame: And Pharaoh said, “Let me kill Moses and let him call upon his Lord. For indeed I fear lest he changes your religion or lest he cause the corruption to be apparent in the land.”

27.Fode Drame: And Moses said, “I indeed seek refuge in my Lord and in your Lord from every arrogant who believes not in the day of the reckoning.”

28.Fode Drame: And a man from family of Pharaoh who was a believer and hid his belief said, “Are you going to kill a person because he says my Lord is Allah and he has come to you with clear signs from your Lord? And if he is a liar, his lie is only against him but if he is truthful some of the things which he has promised you will come upon you, for truly Allah guides not anyone who is wasteful, full of lies.

29.Fode Drame: “O my people, the dominion is yours today paramount in the earth but who can help us against the might of Allah if it comes upon us.” Pharaoh said, “I do not show you except what I see and I do not guide you except to the way of right guidance.”

30.Fode Drame: And the one who had believed said, “O my people, I fear for you the likeness of the day of the Confederates.

31.Fode Drame: Like the fate of the people of Noah and ‘Ad and Thamud and those that came after them and Allah never intends for the slaves any wronging.

32.Fode Drame: And O my people! I Indeed fear about you regarding the day of mutual calling.

33.Fode Drame: The day when you will turn your back going away, there is no protector for you against Allah and whomsoever Allah causes to go astray, for him there is no guide.

34.Fode Drame: And indeed Joseph came to you before with clear signs but you ceased not to be in incredulity regarding that which he came with to you until when he died you said, “Allah will never raise a messenger after him.” It is thus that Allah makes go astray anyone who is wasteful doubtful.

35.Fode Drame: Those who argue about the signs of Allah without any authority which had come unto them. How great a despise it is in the sight of Allah and in the sight of those who believe. Thus Allah puts a seal on every heart which is arrogant, peremptory.

36.Fode Drame: And Pharaoh said, “O Hamaan! Build for me a lofty tower perhaps I will reach up to the gates;

37.Fode Drame: the gates of the heavens so that I may behold unto the god of Moses but sincerely I do think that he is a liar.” And thus the evil of his work was made seemly to Pharaoh and he was hindered from the way. And the scheme of Pharaoh is all but in perdition.

38.Fode Drame: And the one who believed said, “O my people! Follow me and I will guide you to the way of right guidance.

39.Fode Drame: O my people! The life of this world is nothing but a temporary enjoyment and truly it is the hereafter that indeed is the permanent home.

40.Fode Drame: Whoever works an evil he will not be rewarded except for the like of it and whoever man or woman does a righteous deed while he is a believer, it is those who will enter the paradise and they will be provided with sustenance therein without calculation.

41.Fode Drame: and O my people! What is amiss for me that I call you to the salvation while you call me to the fire?

42.Fode Drame: You call me so that I disbelieve in Allah and so that I ascribe partners to Him regarding that for which I have no knowledge while I call you to The All-mighty, The Oft-Forgiving.

43.Fode Drame: It is no wonder that which you call me unto, there is no true call for him in this life nor in the hereafter and that our place of returning is to Allah and that those who are wasteful, it is they who are the companions of the fire.

44.Fode Drame: And in time, you will come to remember that which I told you and I delegate my affair unto Allah. Truly Allah All-Seeing about the slaves.”

45.Fode Drame: So Allah safeguarded him against the evils of all that they plotted and the evil of the punishment befell Pharaoh’s folk.

46.Fode Drame: The fire, they are exposed unto it morning and evening and the day the hour will come [it will be said], “Make enter the people of Pharaoh to severest of the punishment.”

47.Fode Drame: And when they will mutually argue in the fire, and the weak ones will say to those who grew arrogant, “We indeed were followers for you then are you able to take care for us of a portion from the fire?”

48.Fode Drame: And those who grew arrogant will say, “We indeed are all in it for truly Allah has decided between the slaves.”

49.Fode Drame: And those in the fire will say to the guardians of the hellfire, “Call your Lord so that He may remit for us the punishment of one day.”

50.Fode Drame: They will say, “Did your messengers not use to come to you with clear signs?” They will say, “yes indeed.” They will say, “Then call.” But the call of the disbelievers is nothing but in error.

51.Fode Drame: Truly We most certainly will give victory to Our messengers and to those who believed in the life of this world and on the day when the witnesses will stand.

52.Fode Drame: The day when the excuses of those who wronged their own souls will be of no benefit and there will be for them the curse and there will be for them an evil home.

53.Fode Drame: We did indeed grant to Moses the guidance and We caused the children of Israel to inherit the book

54.Fode Drame: As a guidance and as a remembrance for the people of the heart.

55.Fode Drame: So be patient truly Allah’s promise is true and ask forgiveness for your sin and glorify the praises of your Lord in the evening and in the morning.

56.Fode Drame: Truly those who argue about the signs of Allah without any authority that has come to them, truly there is nothing in their bosoms except arrogance and they are never going to attain to it [the greatness]. Therefore seek refuge in Allah. Truly it is He who is The All-hearing, The All-seeing.

57.Fode Drame: Truly the creation of the heavens and of the earth is greater than the creation of the humankind but most of the human beings do not know.

58.Fode Drame: And are not equal the one who is blind and the one who is seeing and are not [equal] those who believe and work righteous deeds and those who do evil. How little is that you take to remembrance.

59.Fode Drame: Truly the hour is surely going to come there is no doubt in it but most of the humankind does not believe.

60.Fode Drame: And your Lord said, “Call Me and I shall answer you.” Truly those who make themselves arrogant to serve Me, they shall soon enter hellfire in abject humiliation.

61.Fode Drame: Allah, He it is who made the night for you that you may find rest in it and the day as a time to see. Truly Allah is surely master of favor unto the mankind but most of the mankind does not offer gratitude.

62.Fode Drame: That is Allah your Lord, Creator of everything. There is no other deity save He. Where then are you rebuffed?

63.Fode Drame: Thus are turned away those who used to deny the signs of Allah.

64.Fode Drame: Allah is He who has made the earth for you a dwelling place and the heaven a canopy and has formed you and has made your forms most excellent and has provided for you from the good things. That is Allah, your Lord so blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds.

65.Fode Drame: He is The Ever-living there is no deity except He therefore invoke Him making the religion sincere for Him. The praise be for Allah, Lord of the worlds.

66.Fode Drame: Say, “I have indeed been prohibited to worship those that you call on besides Allah after when the clear signs have come to me from my Lord and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.”

67.Fode Drame: He it is who created you from dust, then from liquid, then from a clot of blood, then he brings you forth as a child then so that you may reach the fullness of your strength, then that you may become old people – there are still among you whose souls are taken before that – and so that you may reach an appointed term and so that perhaps you may understand.

68.Fode Drame: It is He who gives life and takes life but if He decrees a matter, all He says to it is, “Be” and it is.

69.Fode Drame: Have you not seen those who argue about the signs of Allah how they are turned away.

70.Fode Drame: Those who belie the book and that which We sent down with Our messengers and in time, they will come to know.

71.Fode Drame: When the fetters shall be in their necks and the chains, they will be dragged

72.Fode Drame: in the scalding water then they will be burned in the fire.

73.Fode Drame: Then it is told to them, “Where are all those that you used to ascribe as partners

74.Fode Drame: besides Allah?” They said, “They have gone missing from us. Nay we never used to call out on anything before.” It is thus that Allah causes the disbelievers to go astray.

75.Fode Drame: That is because you used to exult in the earth without the truth and because you used to walk with conceit.

76.Fode Drame: Enter the doors of the hellfire to abide therein forever and how woeful is the dwelling place for those who are arrogant.

77.Fode Drame: So be patient, for Truly the promise of Allah is true. Then indeed either We show you some of that which We promise them or We take you [unto Us] for truly unto Us they will be returned.

78.Fode Drame: And We indeed sent messengers before you, among them there are those whom We have mentioned to you and among them are those that We have not mentioned to you and it is not fitting for a messenger to bring a sign except with the permission of Allah. And when the commandment of Allah comes, decree is done by the truth and the people of falsehood come to loss there at.

79.Fode Drame: Allah it is He who made the cattle for you so that some of them you ride and some of them you eat.

80.Fode Drame: And there are other benefits for you in them and so that on them you may attain to a need in your bosoms and on them as well as on the ships you are carried.

81.Fode Drame: And He shows you His signs then which of the signs of Allah will you deny?

82.Fode Drame: Have they not travelled in the land and looked at how was the ending of those before them. They were more numerous than them and greater in power and in traces in the land but all that they used to earn did not avail them.

83.Fode Drame: So when their messengers came to them with clear signs, they exulted in that which they had from the knowledge and befell them that which they used to mock at.

84.Fode Drame: But when they saw Our fury they said, “We believe in Allah alone and we disavow all that by which we used to be those who ascribe partners to Allah.”

85.Fode Drame: But their faith was not to benefit them after they saw Our fury. [It is] Allah’s way which has passed among His slaves and there at the disbelievers came to loss.

13.Fode Drame: But if they turn away then say, “I warn you of a doom like the doom of ‘Ad and of Samood.”

14.Fode Drame: When the messengers came to them from before them and from after them [saying] that, “Do not worship any except Allah.” They said, “If our Lord had so pleased He would have surely sent down angels. We are therefore disbelievers in that which you are sent with.”

15.Fode Drame: As of ‘Ad they then grew arrogant in the earth without the truth and they said, “Who is greater than us in power?” Have they not seen that Allah who has created them, He is greater than them in power but they used to deny Our signs.

16.Fode Drame: So We sent against them a wind of extreme coldness in days of ill omen so that We may make them taste the punishment of humiliation in the life of this world but truly the punishment of the hereafter is more humiliating and they will not be helped.

17.Fode Drame: And as for Samood, We indeed gave them guidance but they preferred the blindness over the guidance so the doom of the humiliating punishment seized them because of that which they used to perpetrate.

18.Fode Drame: But We saved those who believed and used to safeguard their own souls.

19.Fode Drame: And the day when the enemies of Allah will be driven on pressed forward to be gathered to the fire.

20.Fode Drame: Until when they come after it their hearings and their sights and their skins will witness against them about all that they used to do.

21.Fode Drame: And they said to their skins, “Why have you witnessed against us?” They said, “Allah has made us to speak and is the one who causes everything to speak and it is He who created you the first time and unto Him you will be returned.”

22.Fode Drame: And you did not use to care to hide yourself lest your hearing and your sight and your skins witness against you but you thought that Allah would not know much of what you used to do.

23.Fode Drame: That was the thought that you thought about your Lord it has ruined you therefore you became of the ones in loss.

24.Fode Drame: If they show patience, the fire is yet an abode for them and if they seek to be pleased with, they are not among those who will be pleased with.

25.Fode Drame: And We have decreed for them companions and they made seem goodly to them all that was before them and all that was after them and the sentence of the truth passed against them to be among nations who passed before them from among the Jinns and the humans. Truly they were indeed in loss.

26.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieve said, “Do not listen to this Quran and make idle talk in the course of its recitation so that perhaps you may triumph.”

27.Fode Drame: And surely We will make those who disbelieve taste a formidable punishment and We will surely reward them with the worst of what they used to do.

28.Fode Drame: That is the reward of the enemies of Allah; the fire – therein is the home of eternity for them as a reward for that they used to deny Our signs.

29.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieve said, “O our Lord! Show us those who misguided us from the Jinns and the humans and we will place both of them under our feet so that they be among the lowest.”

30.Fode Drame: Truly those who said, “Our Lord is Allah” and then they stood upright, the angels come down upon them [saying], “Do not fear and do not grieve and glad tidings be for you about the paradise which you were promised.

31.Fode Drame: We are your allies in the life of this world and in the hereafter and therein for you is all that your souls desire and therein is for you all that you ask for

32.Fode Drame: a welcome gift for homecoming from [a Lord] Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.”

33.Fode Drame: And who is more excellent in speech than one who calls unto Allah and works righteous deeds and says, “I am indeed one of those who have submitted to Allah.”

34.Fode Drame: And the good and the evil are not equal. Pushback [evil] with that which is most excellent and one between you and him there is an enmity, lo! It is as though he is an ally and an intimate friend.

35.Fode Drame: And none receives it except those who are patient and none receives it except one who is of the most magnificent fortune.

36.Fode Drame: And if ever a prompting from Satan prompts you then seek refuge with Allah. Truly He it is who is The All-hearing, The All-knowing.

37.Fode Drame: And among His signs are the night and the day and the sun and the moon. Do not prostrate to the sun nor to the moon but prostrate to Allah, the One who created them if it is indeed Him that you worship.

38.Fode Drame: But if they grow arrogant, as for those who are in the presence of your Lord, they glorify Him by the night and by the day and they do not feel bored.

39.Fode Drame: And among His signs is that you see the earth in a lifeless state but when We send down the water on it, it moves and swells up. Truly the One who brought it to life is surely the One who brings the dead to life. Truly He has power over all things.

40.Fode Drame: Truly those who bring crookedness into Our signs, they are not hidden unto Us. Is the one who is thrown into the fire better or the one who comes safe on the day of resurrection? Do what you please. Truly He is All-seeing about what you do.

41.Fode Drame: Truly those who disbelieved in the remembrance when it came to them [let them know] that it surely is a book unassailable.

42.Fode Drame: The falsehood does not come to it from before it nor from behind it. It is sent down from One All-wise, All-praise-worthy.

43.Fode Drame: There was nothing said to you except that which was said to the messengers before you. Truly your Lord is surely Master of forgiveness and Master of painful chastisement.

44.Fode Drame: And had We made it a Quran in a non-Arabic tongue, they would have surely said, “If only its signs were explained in detail!” What? A non-Arabic [book] and an Arab [messenger]. Say, “It is for those who believe a guidance and a healing.” But for those who do not believe, there is a heaviness in their ears and it is a blindness unto them. Those are called from a place far removed.

45.Fode Drame: And We had indeed given the book to Moses but they disagreed in it and had it not been for a word that had gone forth from your Lord, the matter surely had been decreed between them. And they truly are in doubtful incredulity about it.

46.Fode Drame: Whoever works a righteous deed is indeed for the benefit of his own soul and whoever does evil, it is against himself. And your Lord is not the doer of wrong to the slaves.

47.Fode Drame: Knowledge of the hour is referred back to Him. And no fruits come forth from their sheaths and no female bears nor lays down except by His knowledge. And the day He will call them out, “Where are those that you ascribed as partners to Me?” They will say, “We declare unto You that there is no single witness among us.”

48.Fode Drame: And all those that they used to invoke before had gone missing from them and they sensed that there is no place of escape for them.

49.Fode Drame: The human being never gets sated from asking for good but if the harm touches him, lo! He is all hopeless all despairing.

50.Fode Drame: And if We do make him taste a mercy from Us after a distress which touched him, he is sure to say, “This is for me and I do not think that the hour will ever come to pass and if I am ever brought back to my Lord, certainly with Him for me is [nothing but] the goodly reward.” Surely We are going to inform those who disbelieve about all that they did and surely we will make them taste from a tough punishment.

51.Fode Drame: And when We bestow grace on the human being, he turns his face away and keeps aloof on his own but when the harm touches him, lo! He is master of a most elaborate supplication.

52.Fode Drame: Say, “See you that if it were from Allah and you disbelieved in it, then who is more misguided than one who is in a dissension far removed.”

53.Fode Drame: Soon We will show them Our sings on the horizons and within themselves until it becomes clear to them that truly He is the truth. Does it not suffice that your Lord, truly He is a Witness over all things.

54.Fode Drame: Truly they are indeed in a confusion about meeting their Lord. Truly He indeed is All-encompassing about everything.

1.Fode Drame: Ha. Mim.

2.Fode Drame: ‘Ain. Sin. Qaf.

3.Fode Drame: Thus He, sends inspiration unto you and unto those before you; Allah, The All-mighty, The All-wise.

4.Fode Drame: For Him is all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth and He it is The All-high, The All-magnificent.

5.Fode Drame: The heavens well-nigh turn asunder from above them and the angels glorify the praises of their Lord and they seek forgiveness for those in the earth. Truly Allah indeed it is He The Oft-Forgiving, The Most Merciful.

6.Fode Drame: And those who take allies besides Him, Allah is the keeper over them and you are not a trustee over them.

7.Fode Drame: And thus have We inspired unto you a Quran in Arabic so that you warn the mother of the cities and those around it and that you warn of the day of the gathering about which there is no doubt. A party in the paradise and a party in the blazing fire.

8.Fode Drame: And had Allah so pleased, He would have made them into one nation but He admits into His mercy whom He pleases and as for those who wrong their own souls, there is no ally for them nor a helper.

9.Fode Drame: Or is it that they have taken allies besides Him? Indeed Allah is He who is The Ally and it is He who brings the dead to life and it is He who has power over everything.

10.Fode Drame: And whatever it is in which you disagree, the decision thereof is unto Allah. That is Allah my Lord, in Him do I put my trust and unto Him do I turn back.

11.Fode Drame: Originator of the heavens and of the earth. He has made for you pairs from yourselves and pairs from the cattle. Through it He multiplies you. There is nothing like Him and He is The All-hearing, The All-seeing.

12.Fode Drame: For Him are the keys of the heavens and of the earth. He widens the sustenance for whom He pleases and He constricts [it for whom He pleases]. Truly He is All-knowing about everything.

13.Fode Drame: He has instituted for you from the religion that which He had enjoined to Noah and that which We have inspired unto you and that which We had enjoined to Abraham and Moses and Jesus saying, “Establish the religion and do not be divided in it.” It seems exorbitant to those who ascribe partners to Allah that which you call them unto. Allah chooses unto Himself whom He pleases and guides unto Himself who turns back [to Him].

14.Fode Drame: And they were not divided except after that the knowledge had come to them due to their mutual begrudging. And had it not been for a word that had gone forth from your Lord till an appointed term, the matter would have been decreed among them. And truly those who are made to inherit the book after them are surely in doubtful incredulity about it.

15.Fode Drame: Therefore do call unto that and stand upright as you have been commanded and do not follow their vain desires and say, “I believe in all books that Allah has sent down and I have been commanded that I should be just between you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. For us are our deeds and for you your deeds. There is no recrimination between us and you. Allah will gather us altogether and unto Him is the place of final coming.”

16.Fode Drame: But those who continue to dispute about Allah after that people have responded to Him, their proof is refutable in the eyes of their Lord and anger is upon them and for them is a formidable punishment.

17.Fode Drame: Allah it is He who has sent down the book by the truth and [sent] the balance and for all that you know perhaps the hour is well close.

18.Fode Drame: Those who do not believe in it, ask for it to be hastened and those who believe [in it] are solicitous over it, for they know that it is the truth. Truly indeed those who dispute about the hour are surely in a misguidance far removed.

19.Fode Drame: Subtle [in His mercy] is Allah to His slaves, He provides sustenance to whom He pleases and He is The All-strong, The All-mighty.

20.Fode Drame: And he who wants the harvest of the hereafter, We give him increase in his harvest and he who wants the harvest of this world, We will give him from it but he will have no share in the hereafter.

21.Fode Drame: Or is it that they have ascribed partners to Allah who have instituted for them something of the religion for which Allah has not given permission and had it not been for the word of final judgment, truly the matter would have been decreed between them and truly for the wrongdoers there will be a painful punishment.

22.Fode Drame: You will see those who wrong their own souls solicitous over that which they have perpetrated but it is going to fall on them. As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, they will be in lush gardens of the paradise. There will be for them all that they pleased in the presence of their Lord. That it is the most great favor.

23.Fode Drame: That is what Allah brings glad tidings of to His slaves who believe and do righteous deeds. Say, “I ask from you no reward for it except the affection in the kinship.” and whosoever does an excellent deed, We will add excellence for him in it. Truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, All-grateful.
