24.Fode Drame: Or is it that they say that he has contrived a lie against Allah but had Allah pleased, He would put a seal on your heart. And Allah erases the falsehood and makes the truth come true through His words. Truly, He is All-knowing about the essence of the bosoms.

25.Fode Drame: He it is who accepts the repentance from His servants and who pardons the evil deeds and who knows all that you do.

26.Fode Drame: And He responds to those who believe and do righteous deeds and He gives them increase from His favor and as for the disbelievers, there would be for them a formidable punishment.

27.Fode Drame: And if Allah were to open wide the sustenance for His slaves, they would surely seek corruption in the earth but He sends down in due measure what He pleases. Truly He is All-acquainted, All-seeing about His slaves.

28.Fode Drame: And He it is who sends down the rain after that they had lost hope and He spreads His mercy and He it is The Ally, The All-praiseworthy.

29.Fode Drame: And among His signs are the creation of the heavens and of the earth and of all the creatures that He has scattered in them and He it is who is All-powerful to gather them whenever He pleases.

30.Fode Drame: And whatever calamity befalls you surely it is because of what your hands have perpetrated although He pardons a lot of it.

31.Fode Drame: And you are not going to be out of reach in the earth and there is no one for you besides Allah as an ally or as a helper.

32.Fode Drame: And among His signs are the ships in the ocean towering like mountains.

33.Fode Drame: If He pleases, He can cause the wind to be still so that they [the ships] remain stagnant on its surface. Truly in that are surely signs for any who is full of patience and full of gratitude.

34.Fode Drame: Or He can cause them to perish because of all that they have perpetrated although He does pardon a lot of it.

35.Fode Drame: And so that they know those who argue about Our signs that there is no escape for them.

36.Fode Drame: Whatever is given to you from anything, it is but a temporary enjoyment of the life of this world and what is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who believe and who put their trust in their Lord.

37.Fode Drame: And those who keep away from major sins and from offences and when they are angry, they forgive.

38.Fode Drame: And those who respond to their Lord and establish regular prayer and their affair is shared among them and those who spend from what We have provided them with.

39.Fode Drame: And those who when they are trespassed against, they resist [the trespassing].

40.Fode Drame: And the price for ill is ill like unto it but one who pardons and amends, indeed his reward is upon Allah. Truly He does not love the wrongdoers.

41.Fode Drame: And surely whoever makes resistance for himself after wrong has been done to him, for those indeed there is no way against them.

42.Fode Drame: The way is only against those who wrong the people and who seek to trespass in the earth without the truth. Truly those for them there will be a painful punishment.

43.Fode Drame: And truly one who exercises patience and forgives, that indeed is surely among the most resolute affairs.

44.Fode Drame: And whosoever Allah causes to go astray, there is no ally for him after Him. And you will see the wrongdoers when they see the punishment they will say, “Is there any way of returning?”

45.Fode Drame: And you will see them as they are exposed unto it that they are humbled from humiliation looking with stealth glances. And those who believed will say, “Truly the ones in loss on the day of resurrection will be those who have put their own souls and their families in loss.” Truly the wrongdoers will be in a most enduring punishment.

46.Fode Drame: And there will be no allies for them to help them other than Allah and whoever Allah causes to go astray, for him there will be no way.

47.Fode Drame: Respond to your Lord before comes a day from Allah that cannot be turned back. There will be no place of refuge for you on that day and there will be no chance of denial for you.

48.Fode Drame: But if they turn away, surely We have not sent you as a keeper over them. All that is on you is but the clear deliverance [of the message]. And when We indeed give the human being a taste of a mercy from Us, he exults in it. But when ill befalls them because of that which their hands have sent forth, then truly the human being is full of ingratitude.

49.Fode Drame: For Allah is the dominion of the heavens and of the earth. He creates what He pleases. He gifts females to whom He pleases and He gives the males to whom He pleases.

50.Fode Drame: Or He gives them in pairs of males and females and He makes barren whom He pleases. Truly He is All-knowing, All-powerful.

51.Fode Drame: And it is not fitting for a human that Allah should speak to him [directly] except as an inspiration or from behind a veil or that He sends a messenger to inspire by His leave what He pleases. Truly He is All-high, All-wise.

52.Fode Drame: And thus We have inspired unto you a spirit from Our commandment. You never knew before what was the book or what was the faith but We have made it a light We guide by it whom We please from Our servants and truly you do guide to a path most upright,

53.Fode Drame: to the path of Allah for whom is all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth and truly unto Allah end all the affairs.

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Fode Drame: Ha. Mim.

2.Fode Drame: By the book which makes things evident.

3.Fode Drame: Truly We have made it a Quran in Arabic so that perhaps you may understand.

4.Fode Drame: And truly it is in Our presence in the mother of the book truly most high full of wisdom.

5.Fode Drame: Shall We withdraw the remembrance from you in disdain and consign you to oblivion because you are a people who are wasteful to your own souls.

6.Fode Drame: And how many a prophets did We send among the past nations.

7.Fode Drame: And never came unto them a prophet but that they used to mock at him.

8.Fode Drame: So We destroyed those who were greater than them in force and the example of the past nations went forth.

9.Fode Drame: And if you were to ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth?” Surely they will say, “The All-mighty, The All-knowing created them.”

10.Fode Drame: He who made the earth as a cradle for you and He made for you ways in it so that perhaps you may find guidance.

11.Fode Drame: And He who sends down the rain from the heaven in due measure so We raise a dead land with it. It is thus that you will be brought forth.

12.Fode Drame: And He it is who has created all the pairs and has made for you from the ship and from the cattle what you ride on.

13.Fode Drame: So that you may firmly establish yourselves on their backs and then remember the blessings of your Lord when you have firmly established yourself on them and say, “Glory be unto the One who has made these subservient unto us and we were never going to make them subservient on our own

14.Fode Drame: and truly unto our Lord, we surely are going to turn back.”

15.Fode Drame: And they have assigned unto Him a portion out of his bondsmen. Truly the human being is surely evidently full of ingratitude.

16.Fode Drame: Or is it that He has taken unto Himself daughters out of that which He has created while He has favored you with the sons.

17.Fode Drame: And when one of them is given the glad tidings about that which he has set forth as a parable for Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful], his face turns and remains darkened while he chokes with inner rage.

18.Fode Drame: Is he then the one who is raised in the ornament and while he is in the course of the argument does not make things evident.

19.Fode Drame: And they claim the angels, who are themselves servants of Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful], to be females. Did they witness their creation? Their witnessing will soon be written and they will be asked.

20.Fode Drame: And they said, “Had Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] so pleased, we would have not worshipped them.” They have no knowledge about that. All they do is to invent lies.

21.Fode Drame: Or is it that We have given them a book before it so that they are holding fast unto it?

22.Fode Drame: Nay! They said, “We have indeed found our fathers on a way and we indeed are guided by following their footsteps.”

23.Fode Drame: And thus it is that We never sent before you a warner in a township but the ones who were indulged in affluence would say, “We have indeed found our fathers on a way and we indeed are going to follow on their footsteps.”

24.Fode Drame: He [the warner] said, “Even if I bring you better guidance than the one you found your fathers upon?” They said, “We indeed are disbelievers in that with which you have been sent.”

25.Fode Drame: So We exacted our right from them and look at how was the ending of those who belie.

26.Fode Drame: And when Abraham said to his father and to his people, “I truly disavow all that you worship

27.Fode Drame: except He who originated my creation and truly it is He who shall guide me.”

28.Fode Drame: And he made it a word to remain in his posterity so that perhaps they may return back.

29.Fode Drame: Nay! I have given these and their fathers temporary enjoyment until the truth came to them and a messenger most evident.

30.Fode Drame: And when the truth came to them they said, “This is magic and we indeed disbelieve in it.”

31.Fode Drame: And they said, “If only this Quran was sent down on a great man of the two townships.”

32.Fode Drame: Are they the ones who distribute the mercy of your Lord? We have distributed among them their livelihood in the life of this world. And We have raised some of them above others in ranks [of this world] so that some of them may take others in their service but the mercy of your Lord is better than all that they gather.

33.Fode Drame: And had it not been that humankind might become one nation, We would surely have made for those who disbelieve in Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] roofs for their houses made out of silver and stairs [of silver too] on which they mount.

34.Fode Drame: And for their houses doors [of silver] and beds [of silver] on which they recline,

35.Fode Drame: as well as of gold. And all this is but the temporary enjoyment of this world but the hereafter is better in the presence of your Lord for those who revere Him.

36.Fode Drame: And whosoever turns a blind eye to the remembrance of Ar-Rahman [The All-Merciful], We will decree for him a Satan and he will become for him a close companion.

37.Fode Drame: And they indeed do hinder them from the way while they think that they are indeed well guided.

38.Fode Drame: Until when he comes to Us, he will say, “I wish there had been between me and you the distance between the two easts, how woeful the companion [you are].”

39.Fode Drame: But since you had wronged your own souls, it will never be of any benefit to you today that you are partners in the punishment.

40.Fode Drame: Is it you who can make the deaf to hear or who can guide the blind and one who indeed is in most evident misguidance?

41.Fode Drame: Even if We were to take you away, surely We are going to exact Our right from them.

42.Fode Drame: Or that We show you that which We had forewarned them about, surely We have enforcing power over them.

43.Fode Drame: Therefore hold fast unto that which We have inspired to you. Truly you are on a path most upright.

44.Fode Drame: And indeed it [the Quran] is truly a remembrance for you [O Muhammad] and for your people and in time you will all be questioned.

45.Fode Drame: And inquire of those We have sent before you from among Our messengers, “Did We ever appoint other deities who were worshipped besides Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful]?”

46.Fode Drame: And We indeed sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and to his chieftains and he said, “Truly I am a messenger of the Lord of the worlds.”

47.Fode Drame: But when he came to them with Our signs, lo! They held them in derision.

48.Fode Drame: And We didn’t show them a sign except that it was greater than its sister and We seized them with the punishment so that perhaps they may return.

49.Fode Drame: And they said, “O you the magician! Invoke your Lord for Us by virtue of the covenant which He has made with you, truly we are surely going to accept the guidance.”

50.Fode Drame: But when We lifted the punishment from them lo! They are the ones who broke promise.

51.Fode Drame: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people he said, “Is the kingdom of Egypt not mine and do these rivers not flow beneath me? Will you not then see?

52.Fode Drame: Am I not better than this who is an insignificant and who hardly makes himself clear?

53.Fode Drame: Then why is it that armlets of gold have not been bestowed on him or that angels have not come with him in pageant.”

54.Fode Drame: Thus he incited his people and so they obeyed him. Truly they were a people who transgressed against Allah’s commandment.

55.Fode Drame: So at length when they caused Us grief, We exacted Our right from them so We drowned them altogether.

56.Fode Drame: So We made them a precedent and an example for those yet to come.

57.Fode Drame: And when the similitude of the son of Mary was set forth, lo! Your people raise an uproar about it.

58.Fode Drame: And they said, “Are our deities better or he [Jesus]?” They only set it forth for you for the sake of argument. Nay! They are a people who are given to contention.

59.Fode Drame: He is but a servant on whom We bestowed Our grace and We made him an example for the children of Israel.

60.Fode Drame: And had We pleased We could have made of you angels succeeding one another as vicegerents in the earth.

61.Fode Drame: And he [Jesus] indeed is truly a mark of the final hour therefore be in no confusion about it and follow me [Muhammad]. This is a path most upright.

62.Fode Drame: And do not let Satan hinder you. Truly he is for you an enemy most evident.

63.Fode Drame: And when Jesus came with the clear signs he said, “I have indeed come to you with the wisdom and so that I make clear to you some of that in which you disagree. Therefore revere Allah and obey me.”

64.Fode Drame: Truly Allah, He alone is my Lord and your Lord therefore serve Him. This is a path most upright.

65.Fode Drame: But the parties disagreed among them and woe unto those who wronged their own souls from the punishment of a painful day.

66.Fode Drame: What are they waiting for other than the hour that it should come upon them suddenly while they are not aware.

67.Fode Drame: Intimate friends that day will be enemies for one another except those who revere Allah.

68.Fode Drame: “O My servants! There is no fear on you today nor will you grieve.”

69.Fode Drame: Those who believed in Our signs while they submitted.

70.Fode Drame: “Enter the garden you and your spouses with your hearts filled with joy.”

71.Fode Drame: They will be waited upon with trays of gold and with goblets and therein will be all that the souls could desire and the eyes could find delight in while you will abide therein forever.

72.Fode Drame: Those are the gardens which you are made to inherit because of all that you used to do.

73.Fode Drame: Therein for you will be abundance of fruits from which you will eat.

74.Fode Drame: Truly the evildoers will be in the punishment of hellfire to abide therein forever.

75.Fode Drame: It will not be made to relent on them while they will be full of despair therein.

76.Fode Drame: And We did not wrong them in the least but it is only they who wronged their own souls.

77.Fode Drame: And they cried out, “O Malik! [Guardian of the hellfire] let your Lord make an end of us.” He said, “Truly you are going to stay on.”

78.Fode Drame: We have indeed brought the truth unto you but most of you detest the truth.

79.Fode Drame: Or is it that they have made a resolve about a matter and We too are indeed going to make a resolve.

80.Fode Drame: Or do they think that We do not hear their inner thoughts and their secret counsels? Nay! Our messengers are present with them taking records.

81.Fode Drame: Say, “If there were to be a son for Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful], I indeed would be the first of the servants.”

82.Fode Drame: Glory be unto the Lord of the heavens and of the earth, [and glory be unto] Lord of the throne, from all that they attribute [to Him].

83.Fode Drame: So let them indulge in their idle palavers and let them play until they meet the day of theirs of which they are promised.

84.Fode Drame: And He it is who is deity in the heaven and deity in the earth and He alone is The All-wise, The All-knowing.

85.Fode Drame: And blessed is He for whom is the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth and all that is between them and with Him lies the knowledge of the hour and unto Him you will be returned.

86.Fode Drame: And those that they invoke besides Him will have no power to the intercession, except one who witnesses by the truth. And they know this very well.

87.Fode Drame: And if you do ask them, “Who created them?” They will surely say, “It is Allah.” Where then are you turned away?

88.Fode Drame: And his [Prophet Muhammad] utterance, “O my Lord! These truly are a people who do not believe.”

89.Fode Drame: So turn away from them and say, “Peace.” And in time they will come to know.

1.Fode Drame: Ha. Mim.

2.Fode Drame: By the book that makes things clear.

3.Fode Drame: We indeed sent it down in a blessed night. We indeed are warners.

4.Fode Drame: In it [that night] every wise commandment is put in detail,

5.Fode Drame: a commandment from Our presence. Truly it is We who are the senders.

6.Fode Drame: A mercy from your Lord. Truly He it is who is The All-hearing, The All-knowing;

7.Fode Drame: Lord of the heavens and of the earth and what is between them if you truly are people of certitude.

8.Fode Drame: There is no deity except He. He gives life and puts to death; your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.

9.Fode Drame: Nay! They are in incredulity, playing.

10.Fode Drame: Therefore watch out for a day when the heaven will bring forth a smoke most evident.

11.Fode Drame: It [smoke] will cover the people. This is a painful punishment.

12.Fode Drame: “O our Lord! Lift off the punishment from us we are indeed believers.”

13.Fode Drame: Where will they now find the remembrance when a messenger most evident had already come to them.

14.Fode Drame: But they turned away from him and they said, “A madman who had been instructed.”

15.Fode Drame: We are indeed going to lift off the punishment for a little while for surely you are going to re-offend.

16.Fode Drame: The day [is coming] when We will deal out the greatest strike, truly We are going to exact Our right.

17.Fode Drame: And We had indeed tried before them people of Pharaoh and a messenger most gracious had come to them.

18.Fode Drame: [He Said], “Give unto me the slaves of Allah. Truly I am for you a messenger most trustworthy.”

19.Fode Drame: And that, “Do not raise yourself high above Allah. Truly I am coming to you with an authority most evident.

20.Fode Drame: And I indeed seek refuge in my Lord and in your Lord lest you stone me.

21.Fode Drame: And if you do not believe me, then keep yourself aloof from me.”

22.Fode Drame: So he called his Lord [saying], “These are a people who truly are evildoers.”

23.Fode Drame: [Allah said] “Then go forth at night with My slaves for truly you are going to be pursued.

24.Fode Drame: And leave the sea in complete stillness. Truly they are a host who certainly are going to be drowned.”

25.Fode Drame: They left behind how many a gardens and springs,

26.Fode Drame: and crops and places of dwelling most gracious,

27.Fode Drame: and a graceful life in which they were in full indulgence.

28.Fode Drame: Thus [We had blessed them] and so We made other people inherit it.

29.Fode Drame: Neither the heaven nor the earth wept for them and they were not looked upon.

30.Fode Drame: And We did save the children of Israel from the humiliating punishment

31.Fode Drame: from Pharaoh. Truly he ranked high among those who have wasted their souls.

32.Fode Drame: And We had indeed chosen them knowingly above the people.

33.Fode Drame: And We had granted them from the signs those in which there is a trial most evident.

34.Fode Drame: Truly these ones they indeed say,

35.Fode Drame: “There is nothing except our first death and we are not going to be resurrected.

36.Fode Drame: Then bring back our fathers if you are indeed truthful.”

37.Fode Drame: Are they better or the people of Tubba and those before them? We destroyed them. Truly they were evildoers.

38.Fode Drame: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them sporting.

39.Fode Drame: We did not create both of them except by the truth but most of them do not know.

40.Fode Drame: Truly the day of the final decision is their appointment altogether.

41.Fode Drame: A day when no master can avail a subject in the least nor will they be helped,

42.Fode Drame: except one whom Allah has blessed with His mercy [can avail]. Truly He is The All-mighty, The Most Merciful.

43.Fode Drame: Truly the tree of Zaqqum.

44.Fode Drame: Will be the food of the sinful one.

45.Fode Drame: Like molten brass; it simmers in the bellies.

46.Fode Drame: Like the simmering of scalding water.

47.Fode Drame: “Seize him and lift him up into the middle of the burning fire.

48.Fode Drame: Then pour over his head from the punishment of the scalding water.

49.Fode Drame: Taste it! Truly it is you [who thought you] are The All-mighty, The All-gracious.

50.Fode Drame: Truly this is what in which you used to be in confusion.”

51.Fode Drame: Truly those who revere Allah will be in a station most secured,

52.Fode Drame: in gardens and fountains.

53.Fode Drame: They wear from fine silk and from embroideries, facing one another.

54.Fode Drame: Thus it is and We married them with ladies of paradise with beautiful eyes.

55.Fode Drame: They will call therein for every kind of fruit while they are in complete safety.

56.Fode Drame: They will not taste the death therein save the former death and He will save them from the punishment of the burning fire.

57.Fode Drame: A favor from your Lord. That is the most magnificent success.

58.Fode Drame: We have made it [Quran] easy with your tongue only so that they may come to remembrance.

59.Fode Drame: Therefore watch for they too are watching.

1.Fode Drame: Ha. Mim.

2.Fode Drame: Revelation of the book from Allah, The All-mighty, The All-wise.

3.Fode Drame: Truly in the heavens and in the earth are surely signs for the believers.

4.Fode Drame: And in your own creation and in all that He spreads from among the earthly creatures, there are signs for a people who have certitude.

5.Fode Drame: And in the alternation of the night and of the day and in that what Allah has sent down as sustenance from the heaven and thus He causes the earth to come to life after its death and in movement of the winds are signs for a people who understand.

6.Fode Drame: Those are the signs of Allah which We relate unto you by the truth so then through which other discourse after Allah and His signs will they believe?

7.Fode Drame: Woe unto every fabricator of falsehood, sinful one.

8.Fode Drame: He hears the signs of Allah related unto him but then he insists in [his] arrogance as though he did not hear it so give him glad tidings of a painful punishment.

9.Fode Drame: And when he comes to know of anything from Our signs, he takes it for a jest. Those for them there will be a debasing punishment.

10.Fode Drame: From behind them is hellfire and all they have earned will be of no avail to them in the least nor [will be of avail to them] those they have taken as allies besides Allah and for them there will be an awful punishment.

11.Fode Drame: This is a guidance and those who disbelieve in the signs of their Lord, for them there will be a painful punishment from an abomination.

12.Fode Drame: Allah it is He who has made the ocean subservient for you so that the ship may sail through it by His command and so that you may seek from His favor and so that perhaps you may offer gratitude.

13.Fode Drame: And He has made subservient to you all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth altogether from Him. Truly in it are surely signs for a people who reflect.

14.Fode Drame: Say unto those who believe to seek forgiveness for those who do not look forward to the days of Allah so that He may reward every people for what they used to earn.

15.Fode Drame: Whoever does a righteous deed, it is surely for the good of his own soul and whoever does evil, it is against it and then unto your Lord will you be brought back.

16.Fode Drame: And We had indeed granted the children of Israel the book and the wisdom and the prophethood and We provided them from the good things and We favored them over the world.

17.Fode Drame: And We gave them clear signs from the commandment but they disagreed only after that the knowledge had come to them because of their mutual begrudging. Truly your Lord will judge between them on the day of resurrection in all that in which they used to disagree.

18.Fode Drame: Then now We have put you on a wide way from the commandment therefore follow it and do not follow the vain desires of those who do not know.

19.Fode Drame: Truly they will not avail you from Allah in the least and truly the wrongdoers are allies of one unto another while Allah is The Ally of those who safeguard their own souls.

20.Fode Drame: These are clear proofs for the mankind and a guidance and a mercy for a people who have certitude.

21.Fode Drame: Or is it that those who perpetrate evil deeds think that We will make them like those who believe and do righteous deeds? Their life and their death is equal [to Us]. How evil is that which they dispose.

22.Fode Drame: And Allah created the heavens and the earth by the truth and so that every soul may be rewarded for what it has earned and they will not be wronged.

23.Fode Drame: Have you seen the one who has taken his vain desires as his god? so Allah let him go astray knowingly and He put a seal on his hearing and on his heart and He put a veil on his sight. Who then will guide him after Allah? Will you not then come to remembrance?

24.Fode Drame: And they said, “It is nothing but our life of this world. We die and we live and nothing will annihilate us except the time.” There is no knowledge for them about that. They are in nothing but wishful thinking.

25.Fode Drame: And whenever Our signs are related unto them clearly, their argument is nothing except that they say, “Bring back our fathers if you are indeed truthful.”

26.Fode Drame: Say, “It is Allah who gives you life and then He puts you to death and then He will gather you onto the day of resurrection. There is no doubt in it but most of the mankind do not know.”

27.Fode Drame: And for Allah is the dominion of the heavens and of the earth. And the day when the hour will come to pass, that day the people of falsehood will be in loss.

28.Fode Drame: And you will see every nation kneeling down. Every nation will be called to their book, “Today you will be rewarded for all that you used to do.”

29.Fode Drame: This book of Ours speaks about you by the truth. Truly We used to record all that you used to do.

30.Fode Drame: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, [right then] their Lord will make them enter into His mercy. That is the triumph, the most evident.

31.Fode Drame: And as for those who disbelieved, “Were not My signs used to be related unto you but you grew arrogant and you were a people who were evildoers.”

32.Fode Drame: And when it is said, “Truly Allah’s promise is true and the Hour, there is no doubt in it.” You say, “We do not know what is the hour. We are but making a guess and we are not those who are certain.”

33.Fode Drame: And unto them appeared the evil of things that they had done and the things that which they used to mock at overtook them.

34.Fode Drame: And it will be said, “Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this day of yours and your abode is the fire and there are no helpers for you.

35.Fode Drame: That is so because you used to take Allah’s signs for a matter of jest and the life of this world deceived you.” So today they will not be taken out from it nor will they be excused.

36.Fode Drame: Then the praise is for Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.

37.Fode Drame: And for Him is the grandeur in the heavens and in the earth and He is The All-mighty, The All-wise.

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Fode Drame: Ha. Mim.

2.Fode Drame: The revelation of the book from Allah, The All-mighty, The All-wise.

3.Fode Drame: We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them except by the truth and for an appointed time but those who disbelieved have turned away from that of which they were warned.

4.Fode Drame: Say, “Have you seen all that you invoke besides Allah, show me what they have created from the earth or is there a part for them in the heavens? Bring me a book before this [Quran] or traces of knowledge if you are truthful.”

5.Fode Drame: And who is more misguided than one who calls besides Allah such a one who will not respond back to him till the day of resurrection while they [the gods] are completely oblivious about their invocation.

6.Fode Drame: And when the mankind is gathered, they [the gods] will be enemies unto them and they [the gods] will deny their worshipping of them.

7.Fode Drame: And whenever Our signs are related unto them clearly, those who disbelieve say to the truth when it comes to them, “This is a magic most evident.”

8.Fode Drame: Or do they say, “He has contrived it.” Say, “If I did contrive it, then you have no power over anything with Allah for me. He is All-knowing about all that in which you indulge. Sufficient is He as a witness between me and you and He is The Oft-Forgiving, The Most Merciful.”

9.Fode Drame: Say, “I am not an innovation from the messengers nor do I know what is going to be done to me nor unto you. I but follow that which is inspired unto me and I am but a warner most evident.”

10.Fode Drame: Say, “Do you see if it were from Allah and you disbelieved in it while a witness from the children of Israel witnessed a like of it, so he believed [in it] but you grew arrogant. And Allah does not guide the people who wrong their own souls.”

11.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieved said to those who believed, “Had this [Islam] been a good thing they would not have come to it before us.” And since they did not find guidance through it so they will say, “This is but an ancient fabrication.”

12.Fode Drame: And before it was the book of Moses a leader and a mercy and this is a book testifying [to that which came before it] in Arabic tongue so that it may warn those who wrong their own souls and is a glad tiding for those who act in excellence.

13.Fode Drame: Truly those who say, “Our Lord is Allah and then they stand upright, then there is no fear on them nor do they grieve.”

14.Fode Drame: Those are the owners of the garden to abide therein forever as a reward for all that they used to do.

15.Fode Drame: We have commended unto the human being kindness to his parents. His mother born him with hardship and laid him down with hardship and his bearing and his weaning is thirty months until when he reaches the fullness of his strength and reaches forty years he says, “O my Lord! Exhort me so that I give gratitude for your blessing with which you blessed me and my both parents and that I work righteous deed which You may be pleased with and put righteousness for me in my descendants. Truly I have turned to You in repentance and truly I am of those who have submitted to you.”

16.Fode Drame: Those are the ones from whom We accept the best of what they worked and We forego their evil deeds [to be] among the owners of the garden, the truthful promise of which they used to be promised.

17.Fode Drame: As for the one who says to his parents, “Fie unto both of you. Do both of you promise me that I will be brought forth [after death] when the generations had passed before me?” But the two of them seek the help of Allah [and they say], “Woe unto you! Believe! Truly Allah’s promise is true.” But he says, “This is nothing but the fables of the ancients.”

18.Fode Drame: Those are the very ones on whom the sentence of the truth has gone forth to be among nations who had passed before them from the Jinns and the humans. Truly they indeed were the ones in loss.

19.Fode Drame: And unto all will be assigned ranks according to that which they had worked and so that He may pay them in full for their deeds and they will not be wronged.

20.Fode Drame: And on the day when the disbelievers will be confronted with the fire, [it will be said unto them], “You have spent out your good deeds in your former life and you had enjoyed it to the fullest so today you will be rewarded with punishment of the humiliation because of that you used to act arrogant in the earth without the truth and because of that you used to transgress against Allah’s commandments.”

21.Fode Drame: And remember the brother of ‘Ad [Hud] when he warned his people in the sand-dunes and the warners had gone forth before him and after him [saying], ”Do not serve anyone except Allah. Truly I fear for you about the punishment of an awful day.”

22.Fode Drame: They said, “Have you come to us to turn us away from our gods so bring to us that with which you threaten us if you are of those who are the truthful.”

23.Fode Drame: He said, “The knowledge is only with Allah but I only deliver unto you that which I have been sent with however I see that you are a people in ignorance.”

24.Fode Drame: And when they saw it as a passing cloud facing their valleys they said, “This is a passing cloud that is going to rain on us.” Nay! This is what you were seeking to be hastened, a wind therein is a painful punishment.

25.Fode Drame: Which [the wind] devastated everything by the command of its Lord so when the morning came over them nothing was seen except their dwelling places. Thus do we reward the people who are the evildoers.

26.Fode Drame: And We indeed had established them in such power which We have not established you in and We made for them hearing and sights and hearts but of no use to them was their hearing or their sight or their understanding in the least since they used to deny Allah’s signs and they were besieged by that which they used to mock at.

27.Fode Drame: And We had indeed destroyed from the townships that are all around you and We presented the signs in many ways so that perhaps they may return back.

28.Fode Drame: If only those that they took as gods to bring them closer to Allah could help them Nay! They went missing from them and that is their falsehood and all that they used to contrive.

29.Fode Drame: And when We turned towards you a company from the Jinns [so that] they listened to the Quran and when they came to its [Quran’s] presence they said, “Be quiet [and listen].” and when [its recitation] was done they turned back to their people as warners.

30.Fode Drame: They said, “O our people! We have indeed heard a book sent down after Moses testifying to that which had gone forth before it. It guides to the truth and to a way most upright.

31.Fode Drame: O our people! Respond to the caller of Allah and believe in Him, He will deliver you from your sins and He will save you from a painful punishment.”

32.Fode Drame: And whosoever does not respond to the caller of Allah, he indeed is not going to be out of reach in the earth and there will be no ally for him besides Him. Those are in misguidance most evident.

33.Fode Drame: Have they not seen that it is Allah who created the heavens and the earth while He was not fatigued through creating them, is able to bring the dead to life. Nay! He indeed has power over everything.

34.Fode Drame: And on the day when the disbelievers will be confronted with the fire, [they will be said], “Is this not the truth?” They will say, “Nay! By our Lord [this is the truth].” He will say, “Then taste the punishment for that you used to disbelieve.”

35.Fode Drame: Therefore be patient as were patient the people of great resolve from among the messengers and do not be in haste for them. For the day they will see that which they were promised it will be as though they had not stayed except an hour of a day. This proclamation… so will anyone be destroyed except the people who are the renegades.

1.Fode Drame: Those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of Allah, He caused their deeds to go amiss.

2.Fode Drame: And those who believed and worked righteous deeds and believed in that which has been sent down unto Muhammad, which is the truth from their Lord, He absolved them from their evils and set their hearts right.

3.Fode Drame: That is because those who disbelieved followed the falsehood and those who believed followed the truth from their Lord. Thus Allah sets forth for the mankind their similitudes.

4.Fode Drame: Therefore when you meet [in war] those who disbelieved, then smiting of the necks until when you have fully gained the upper hand over them, then bind them fast and after that either you show them grace [through pardon] or you take ransom until such a time when the war will lay down its burdens [arms]. Nonetheless, had Allah so pleased, He would have himself taken victory over them but in this way He tries you one by the others. And those who were killed in the way of Allah, He will never cause their deeds to go amiss.

5.Fode Drame: He will soon guide them and will set their hearts right.

6.Fode Drame: And He will make them enter the garden which He has marked out for them.

7.Fode Drame: O you who believe! If you help Allah, He will help you and He will make your feet firmly established.

8.Fode Drame: But as for those who disbelieved, distress will be for them and He will cause their deeds to go amiss.

9.Fode Drame: That is because they hated that which Allah had sent down so He caused their deeds to come to naught.

10.Fode Drame: Have they not travelled in the earth so that they see how was the ending of those who were before them. Allah brought utter devastation on them and the like of it will be for the disbelievers.

11.Fode Drame: That is so because Allah is the master of those who believe and that the disbelievers have no master.

12.Fode Drame: Truly Allah will make enter those who believed and worked righteous deeds into gardens beneath which the rivers flow. As for those who disbelieved, they enjoy [this life] and eat in the manner in which the cattle eat and the fire will be their dwelling place.

13.Fode Drame: And how many a township which were mightier in power than your town [Mecca], which has expelled you [O Muhammad], We destroyed them and there was no helper for them.

14.Fode Drame: Is one who is on a clear proof from his Lord like one to whom the evilness of his deeds have been made seemly and so they followed their vain desires.

15.Fode Drame: The similitude of the garden which has been promised to those who safeguard their own souls [is this]; in it are rivers of water which never stale and rivers of milk the taste of which never changes and rivers of wine delightful for the drinkers and rivers of honey of refined purity. And for them will be there in all kinds of fruits and a forgiveness from their Lord. Can such a one be similar to one who abides forever in the fire and they are given to drink boiling water so that it cuts their bowels into pieces?

16.Fode Drame: And among them are those who listen to you until when they go out from your presence they say to those who are given the knowledge, “What is it that he just said?” Those are the ones on whose hearts Allah has put a seal so that they follow their vain desires.

17.Fode Drame: And as for those who found guidance, He increased them in guidance and He granted them their self-guard.

18.Fode Drame: Are they waiting except for the hour that it should come upon them all of a sudden? and its preconditions have already come. Where then will they find their remembrance once it has come upon them?

19.Fode Drame: Therefore know that there is no god except Allah and seek forgiveness for your sins and for the believing men and women. For Allah knows all your places of movement and all your places of rest.

20.Fode Drame: And those who believe say, “If only a surah [chapter] was revealed” but when a surah was revealed with a definite purport and the fighting is mentioned therein, you see those who have a sickness in their hearts look at you with a look of the one which has been assailed by the death. So woe unto them.

21.Fode Drame: Obedience and a word of kindness and when the matter becomes resolved if only they are truthful to Allah, it would have been best for them.

22.Fode Drame: What then is expected of you should you turn away but that you will spread corruption in the land and that you will cut asunder your ties of kinship.

23.Fode Drame: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed so He caused them to be deaf and caused their sights to go blind.

24.Fode Drame: Do they not receive the Quran [as it came down from Allah] or is it that hearts have their locks on them?

25.Fode Drame: Truly those who have turned away on their backs after that the guidance has been made evident to them, it is Satan who has made [their turning away] seemly to them and has given them a long leash.

26.Fode Drame: That is so because they said unto those who hate what Allah has sent down, “We will obey you in some of the matter.” and Allah knows their secrets.

27.Fode Drame: So how then it will be when the angels take their souls and beat their faces and their backs.

28.Fode Drame: That is so because they followed that which caused Allah’s wrath and they hated His pleasure so He caused their deeds to come to naught.

29.Fode Drame: Or do those in whose hearts is a sickness think that Allah will never bring out their diseases of hearts.

30.Fode Drame: And had We so pleased, We would have shown them to you so that you would have recognized them by their marks but you will surely recognize them by the tone of the speech. And Allah knows all your deeds.

31.Fode Drame: And We will surely try you until We mark out those who struggle [in the way] among you and those who are patient and We shall try [you in] your affairs.

32.Fode Drame: Truly those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of Allah and obstinately opposed the messenger after that the guidance had been made evident for them, they will never hurt Allah in the least and He shall in time bring their deeds to come to naught.

33.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Obey Allah and obey the messenger and do not cause your deeds to go in vain.

34.Fode Drame: Truly those who disbelieved and hindered from the way of Allah and then died while they were disbelievers, Allah will never grant forgiveness to them.

35.Fode Drame: So do not be feeble and then call unto the peace while you are uppermost and Allah is with you and He will never take anything away from your deeds.

36.Fode Drame: The life of this world is nothing but sport and idleness but if you believe and safeguard your own souls, He will give you your reward and He will not ask you for anything from your property.

37.Fode Drame: If He were to ask you from it [your property] and He were to press you hard for it, you will become stingy and thus He will bring out diseases of your hearts.

38.Fode Drame: Here you are, you are called to spend in the way of Allah but there are some among you who will be stingy and whoever is stingy he is only stingy against his own soul and Allah is The All-self-sufficient while you are the needy ones and if you turn away, He will replace with a people other than you and then they will not be like you.

1.Fode Drame: Truly We have opened for you an opening most evident.

2.Fode Drame: So that Allah may remit for you from your veils which came from before and which will come after and may complete His grace on you and may guide you to a path which is most upright.

3.Fode Drame: And that Allah may help you with a help most mighty.

4.Fode Drame: He it is who sent down the tranquility in the hearts of the believers so that they may increase in faith along with their faith and for Allah are the hosts of the heavens and of the earth and truly Allah is All-knowing, All-wise.

5.Fode Drame: So that He may cause the believing men and woman to enter gardens beneath which the rivers flow to abide therein forever and so that He may remove from them their evils and truly that in the sight of Allah is a most magnificent success.

6.Fode Drame: And so that He may punish the hypocrites men and women and those who ascribe partners to Allah, men and women who think of Allah ill thoughts. Upon them is the circle of viciousness and Allah is wroth upon them and He has cursed them and has made ready for them the hellfire and how woeful is a place of ending.

7.Fode Drame: And for Allah are the hosts of the heavens and of the earth and truly Allah is All-mighty, All-wise.

8.Fode Drame: Truly We have sent you as a witness and as a bringer of glad tidings and as a warner.

9.Fode Drame: So that you may believe in Allah and in His messenger and so that you may assist him and that you may hold him in esteem and that you may glorify Him, morning and evening.

10.Fode Drame: Truly those who pledge allegiance to you, they are only pledging allegiance to Allah. Allah’s hand is above their hands. Whoever breaks his promise is only breaking it to the harm of his own soul but whoever fulfills what he has covenanted with Allah, truly He will soon grant him a magnificent reward.

11.Fode Drame: Soon will the desert Arabs who were left behind say to you, “Our properties and by our families kept us engaged so ask forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, “Who has power over anything with Allah if He wills harm for you or if He wills benefit for you.” Nay! Truly Allah is All-acquainted with all that you do.

12.Fode Drame: Nay you conceived that the messenger and the believers will never return back to their families and that was made seemly in your hearts and you conceived the ill-thought and you were a people of complete destitution.

13.Fode Drame: And whosoever does not believe in Allah and in His messenger, truly We have prepared for the disbelievers a blazing fire.

14.Fode Drame: And for Allah is dominion of the heavens and of the earth. He forgives whom He pleases and He punishes whom He pleases and truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

15.Fode Drame: Those who were left behind would say, “When you set out towards the booties to seize them, let us follow you.” They want to change the word of Allah. Say, “You will never follow us.” Thus has Allah said before but they will say, “You are only begrudging us.” Nay they discern not except a little.

16.Fode Drame: Say unto who were left behind from the desert Arabs, “Soon you will be called unto a people of mighty war you either fight them or they surrender and if you obey, Allah will give you a most excellent reward but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.”

17.Fode Drame: There is no blame on the blind nor is there a blame on the lame nor is there a blame on the sick but whosoever obeys Allah and His messenger, He will make him enter into gardens beneath which the rivers flow but whosoever turns away, He will punish him with a painful punishment.

18.Fode Drame: Indeed Allah was pleased with the believers as they pledged their allegiance to you under the tree and He knew what was in their hearts so He sent the tranquility on them and He rewarded them with a victory near at hand.

19.Fode Drame: And many gains of war, they will take them and truly Allah is All-mighty, All-wise.

20.Fode Drame: Allah promised you many gains of war that you will take but He hastened this one for you and He held back the hands of people [of Mecca] from you and so that it may be a sign for the believers and that He may guide you to a path most upright.

21.Fode Drame: And other [gains] which you were not able to have power over but Allah had them encompassed [in His power] and truly Allah has power over everything.

22.Fode Drame: And if those who disbelieve were to fight you, they would have turned the backs [in flight] and then they will find no ally and no helper.

23.Fode Drame: The rule of Allah which had gone forth from before and you will never find a change in the rule of Allah.

24.Fode Drame: And He it was who held their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Mecca after He gave you the upper hand on them and truly Allah is All-seeing about all that you do.

25.Fode Drame: It was they who disbelieved and hindered you from the sacred mosque and the sacrifice held in check from reaching its destination. Were it not for believing men and believing women whom you knew not, lest you trample on them, and a sin will accrue on you because of them unknowingly so that Allah may make enter into His mercy whom He pleases and Had they stood out from one another We surely would have punished the disbelievers from among them with a painful punishment.

26.Fode Drame: Since those who disbelieved put in their hearts the passionate zeal, passionate zeal of the ignorance but Allah sent down His tranquility upon His messenger and upon the believers and caused them to abide by the word of Taqwa [God Reverence] and they were most entitled to it and they were the ones to whom it belonged and truly Allah is All-knowing about everything.

27.Fode Drame: Truly Allah fulfilled the vision by the truth for His messenger. You will surely enter the sacred mosque if Allah pleases in safety, shaving your heads or cutting it short, you will not fear. He knew what you knew not and He made before that a victory near at hand.

28.Fode Drame: He it is who sent His messenger with the guidance and with the religion of the truth so that He may cause it to triumph over the religion all together and Allah suffices as a witness.

29.Fode Drame: Muhammad messenger of Allah and those with him are firm against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating they seek favor from Allah and pleasure. Their marks are in their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their similitude in the Torah and their similitude in the gospel is like a plant which sends forth its shoot and then it supported it and then it grew stout and then it rose up straight on its stalk. It caused the farmers to marvel so that He causes the disbelievers to enrage by them. Allah promise those who believed and did righteous deeds from among them a forgiveness and a most magnificent reward.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Do not go ahead of Allah and His messenger and revere Allah. Truly Allah is All-hearing, All-knowing.

2.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet and do not speak to him in a loud tone in a manner in which you speak loud to one another lest your deeds come to a naught while you are not aware.

3.Fode Drame: Truly those who lower their voices in the presence of the messenger of Allah those are the ones whose hearts Allah has well tried for self-guard. For them is forgiveness and a magnificent reward.

4.Fode Drame: Truly those who call out to you from behind the chambers, most of them do not understand.

5.Fode Drame: If only they had patience until you had come out to them, it would have been better for them and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

6.Fode Drame: O you who believe! If a renegade comes to you with a news, then do investigate lest you harm a people out of ignorance and then you become regretful about that which you had done.

7.Fode Drame: And know that among you is the messenger of Allah. If he were to obey you in many of the matters, you will certainly become stubborn but Allah has caused you to love the faith and has adorned it [the faith] in your hearts and He caused you to abhor the disbelief and the renegation and the disobedience. Those are the ones who are well-guided [to the way].

8.Fode Drame: A favor from Allah and a grace and Allah is All-knowing, All-wise.

9.Fode Drame: And when two groups from the believers fight among themselves then reconcile between them and if one of the two is belligerent against the other then fight against the one who is belligerent until it turns back [complies] to the commandment of Allah. But when it does turn back, then reconcile between them in justice and be upright. Truly Allah loves those who are upright.

10.Fode Drame: The believers are but brothers so reconcile between your two brothers and revere Allah so that perhaps you may receive mercy.

11.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Let not some men despise other men for perhaps they may be better than them and let not some women despise other women perhaps they may be better than them and do not stigmatize one another and do not call one another with sobriquets. Worst name is renegation after the faith and whosoever does not turn in repentance to Allah truly those are the ones who wrong their own souls.

12.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Keep away from much of the suspicion truly some of the suspicion is a sin and do not spy on and do not backbite one another. Would any of you love to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You do abhor it so revere Allah. Truly Allah is Acceptor of repentance, Most Merciful.

13.Fode Drame: O you the mankind! Truly We have created you from a male and a female and We have made you into nations and tribes so that you may recognize one another. Truly the most graceful among you in the sight of Allah is one who reveres Him the most. Truly Allah is All-knowing, All-acquainted.

14.Fode Drame: The desert Arabs said, “We believe.” Say, “You have not believed [in truth] but you just say, ‘We have submitted ourselves’ but the faith has not yet entered into your hearts.” And if you obey Allah and His messenger, He will not cheat you of anything from your deeds. Truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

15.Fode Drame: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and in His messenger and then they did not doubt and they strove with their property and their lives in the way of Allah. Those are the truthful ones.

16.Fode Drame: Say, “Will you inform Allah about your religion? While Allah it is He who knows all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth.” and Allah is All-knowing about everything.

17.Fode Drame: They count it a favor on you that they have entered Islam. Say, “Do not count your embracing of Islam as a favor on me. Rather it is Allah who counts as a favor to you that He guided you to the faith if you were truthful.”

18.Fode Drame: Truly Allah knows the unseen of the heavens and of the earth and Allah is All-seeing about all that you do.

1.Fode Drame: Qaf. By the glorious Quran.

2.Fode Drame: Nay! They wonder that a warner came unto them from among themselves so the disbelievers say, “This is an amazing thing.

3.Fode Drame: Is it that when we have died and we have become dust [we will be returned back to life], that is a returning far from happening.”

4.Fode Drame: We do know what the earth takes away from them and with Us is a book which guards well.

5.Fode Drame: Nay! They belied the truth when it came to them so they are in an affair most confused.

6.Fode Drame: Have they not looked at the heaven above them how We built it high and how We adorned it [with stars] and there are no flaws in it.

7.Fode Drame: And the earth, We stretched it and We cast therein firm mountains and We caused to grow therein of every beautiful pair.

8.Fode Drame: To be a clear sign and a remembrance for every slave who turns to Allah.

9.Fode Drame: And We sent down from the heaven a water most blessed and We caused to grow by it gardens and grains of the harvest

10.Fode Drame: and the date trees lofty with date-stalks neatly arranged

11.Fode Drame: as sustenance for the slaves and We caused a dead land to come to life by it thus is the bringing forth [of the dead].

12.Fode Drame: Before them belied people of Noah, and the owners of the Rass, and Thamud,

13.Fode Drame: and ‘Ad, and Pharaoh, and brethren of Lot,

14.Fode Drame: and the people of wooded vale, and people of Tubba. All of them belied the messengers and so My warning came to pass.

15.Fode Drame: Were we ever worn out by the first creation? Nay! They now are in confusion about a new creation.

16.Fode Drame: And We indeed created the human being and We know what his soul insinuates to him but We are closer to him than the jugular vein.

17.Fode Drame: When the two angels meet one sitting on the right and the other on the left.

18.Fode Drame: He does not utter a word except that in his presence there is a watcher well stationed.

19.Fode Drame: And the throes of death brought along the truth that is what you used to evade from.

20.Fode Drame: And the trumpet is blown into. That is the day of which the warning was made.

21.Fode Drame: And every soul came, along with it a driver and a witness.

22.Fode Drame: You indeed were in oblivion about this and now We have removed from you your veil so your sight today is sharp.

23.Fode Drame: And his companion said, “This is what I have with me all ready.”

24.Fode Drame: So both of you throw in the hellfire every obstinate disbeliever,

25.Fode Drame: every diligent withholder of good, every transgressive doubting one;

26.Fode Drame: who made another deity with Allah so throw him both of you in the formidable punishment.

27.Fode Drame: His companion said, “O our Lord! I did not cause him to transgress but he was in a misguidance far removed.”

28.Fode Drame: He said, “Do not quarrel in My presence for indeed I had already given you the warning.”

29.Fode Drame: The word does not change in My presence nor am I a wrongdoer to the slaves.

30.Fode Drame: A day when We shall say to the hellfire, “Are you full?” and it will say, “Are there more?”

31.Fode Drame: And the garden is brought near for those who safeguard their own souls - not far at all.

32.Fode Drame: “This is what had been promised to you.. for everyone who cries to Allah and guards well his duty.

33.Fode Drame: Who fears Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] from the unseen and comes with a heart that has turned [to Allah].

34.Fode Drame: Enter it with peace.” That is the day of the everlasting life.

35.Fode Drame: There will be for them therein all that they please and from Our presence there will be more.

36.Fode Drame: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in might and they wandered throughout the lands. Was there any place of escape?

37.Fode Drame: Indeed in that truly there is a remembrance for anyone who has a heart, or for one who keenly hearkens, while being a witness.

38.Fode Drame: And We indeed created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six periods and no languor attained to Us.

39.Fode Drame: Therefore be patient about all that they say and glorify the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before the setting.

40.Fode Drame: And within the night do glorify Him and in the wake of the prostrations.

41.Fode Drame: And lend your ear for a day when the caller will call from a place well near.

42.Fode Drame: A day when they will hear the deafening shriek by the truth. That is the day of the forthcoming [of the dead].

43.Fode Drame: Truly it is We who gives life and causes death and unto Us is the place of final coming.

44.Fode Drame: The day when the earth will be rent asunder from them hurriedly coming out. That is a gathering well easy for Us.

45.Fode Drame: We do know about all that they say but you are not a compeller over them so remind through the Quran whosoever fears My warning.

1.Fode Drame: By the scatterers of complete scattering.

2.Fode Drame: And by the bearers of a heavy burden.

3.Fode Drame: And by those who sail with gentleness.

4.Fode Drame: And by those who distribute commandment.

5.Fode Drame: Indeed that which you are promised is surely truthful.

6.Fode Drame: And truly the day of judgment must surely come to pass.

7.Fode Drame: By the heaven which is full of pathways.

8.Fode Drame: Truly you surely are at variance in discourse.

9.Fode Drame: Turned away from it is any who is willing to be turned away.

10.Fode Drame: Curse is on the inventors of lies.

11.Fode Drame: Those who are wandering in darkness, all forgetful.

12.Fode Drame: They ask, “When shall be the day of recompense?”

13.Fode Drame: That will be the day when they will be exposed to the ordeal by the fire.

14.Fode Drame: [They will be told], “Taste you your ordeal. This is what you used to ask to be brought in haste.”

15.Fode Drame: As for those who safeguard their own souls, they will be in gardens and fountains.

16.Fode Drame: Receiving all that their Lord gives them. Truly they used to be before then those who acted in excellence.

17.Fode Drame: They used to sleep but little in the night.

18.Fode Drame: And in the early dawn they used to seek forgiveness.

19.Fode Drame: And in their properties were marked out the right of the beggar and the destitute.

20.Fode Drame: And in the earth there are signs for those who have certitude.

21.Fode Drame: And within your own selves. Will you not then see?

22.Fode Drame: And in the heaven is your provision and all that you are warned about.

23.Fode Drame: And truly by the Lord of the heaven and of the earth, this is surely the truth as much as that you can speak.

24.Fode Drame: Has the news of the gracious guests of Abraham come to you?

25.Fode Drame: When they entered in upon him and they said, “Peace.” He said, “Peace.” Strange people.

26.Fode Drame: Then he went back to his family and came with a fat calf.

27.Fode Drame: And he presented it to them and he said, “Will you not eat?”

28.Fode Drame: Then he sensed a fear from them. They said, “Fear not” and they gave him the glad tidings of a learned boy.

29.Fode Drame: His wife came forward with a loud cry and she smote her face and said, “A barren old woman.”

30.Fode Drame: They said [to her], “Thus has your Lord said this. Truly He it is The All-wise, The All-knowing.”

31.Fode Drame: He said, “And what is your business in hand O you the messengers!”

32.Fode Drame: They said, “We have been sent to a people who are evildoers.

33.Fode Drame: So that We send down on them stones of hard clay.

34.Fode Drame: Well marked from the presence of your Lord for those who waste their own souls.”

35.Fode Drame: And We moved out who were there from among the believers.

36.Fode Drame: And We didn’t find therein except one house of those who submitted to Allah.

37.Fode Drame: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

38.Fode Drame: And about Moses when We sent him to Pharaoh with an authority most evident.

39.Fode Drame: But he turned away to his clan and he said, “A sorcerer or a madman.”

40.Fode Drame: And We seized him and his hosts and then We pitched them into the sea while he was blameworthy.

41.Fode Drame: And about [the people of] ‘Ad when We sent upon them the barren wind.

42.Fode Drame: It leaves nothing of that in which it has come upon until it made it into a rotten remain.

43.Fode Drame: And about Thamud when they were told, “Enjoy for a little while.”

44.Fode Drame: But they transgressed against the commandment of their Lord so they were seized by the thunder strike while they looked on.

45.Fode Drame: Nor were they able to stand nor were they the ones who were victorious.

46.Fode Drame: And the people of Noah from before. They used to be a people who were renegades.

47.Fode Drame: And the heaven, We built it with power and truly We certainly are expanding it.

48.Fode Drame: And the earth, We rolled it out and how best are those who spread out [the earth].

49.Fode Drame: And from everything We have created pairs so that you may remember [the one who has no pair].

50.Fode Drame: Therefore run unto Allah. Truly I am for you from Him a warner most evident.

51.Fode Drame: And do not make another deity with Allah. Truly for you, I am from Him a warner most evident.

52.Fode Drame: Thus never came unto those before them any messenger except that they said, “[He is] a sorcerer or a madman.”

53.Fode Drame: Have they handed down such a counsel unto one another? Nay! They are a people who are transgressors.

54.Fode Drame: So turn away from them and you are not to be blamed.

55.Fode Drame: But remind, truly the reminding do benefit the believers.

56.Fode Drame: And I have not created the Jinns and the humankind except that they serve Me [in truth].

57.Fode Drame: I don’t want any sustenance from them nor do I want that they feed Me.

58.Fode Drame: Truly Allah, He is the Provider of sustenance, The Master of power, The All Firm.

59.Fode Drame: Truly for those who wrong their own souls, is a sin like the sin of their companions so let them not ask Me to hasten it.

60.Fode Drame: Woe then for those who disbelieve from that day of which they are promised.

1.Fode Drame: By the Toor.

2.Fode Drame: And by a book well inscribed.

3.Fode Drame: In a writing well detailed.

4.Fode Drame: And by the house well frequented.

5.Fode Drame: And by the roof most uplifted.

6.Fode Drame: And by the ocean most inflamed.

7.Fode Drame: Truly the punishment of your Lord will surely come to pass.

8.Fode Drame: There is nothing that is going to push it away.

9.Fode Drame: On the day when the heaven will gyrate a complete gyrating.

10.Fode Drame: And the mountains will move a complete movement.

11.Fode Drame: Then woe on that day on those who belie.

12.Fode Drame: Those who are wandering idly in the darkness and playing in the day.

13.Fode Drame: That day they will be pushed towards the fire of hell with a complete pushing.

14.Fode Drame: This is the fire that you used to belie.

15.Fode Drame: Is this then magic or is it that you cannot see.

16.Fode Drame: [Enter and] burn therein. If you bear with patience or you bear not, is all the same for you. You are only rewarded for that which you used to do.

17.Fode Drame: And for those who revered Allah, they will be in gardens and in bliss.

18.Fode Drame: Rejoicing over that which their Lord has given unto them and their Lord saved them from the punishment of hellfire.

19.Fode Drame: “So eat and drink with relish for that which you used to do.”

20.Fode Drame: Reclining on couches well arrayed and We wed them to ladies of paradise with beautiful eyes.

21.Fode Drame: And for those who believed and their descendants followed them with belief, We caused their descendants to be joined to them and We did not cheat them of anything from their deeds. Every person is bounded by that which he earned.

22.Fode Drame: And We supplied them with fruits and meat from all that they desire.

23.Fode Drame: They were exchanging therein a cup. There is no foul word therein nor a sinful word.

24.Fode Drame: And young boys for them will wait upon them and they look as though they are a pearl well preserved.

25.Fode Drame: And some of them turned to the others enquiring.

26.Fode Drame: They said, “Before we used to be in our families full of concern.”

27.Fode Drame: So Allah has visited His grace upon us and He has saved us from the punishment of the fire of pure substance.

28.Fode Drame: Truly aforetime, we used to call upon Him. Truly He is The All pure, The Most Merciful.

29.Fode Drame: Therefore remind, for you are not by the grace of your Lord a soothsayer or a madman.

30.Fode Drame: Or is it that they say, “[He is] a poet.” We are waiting to see what vicissitudes of time have in store for him.

31.Fode Drame: Say, “Wait you, and I indeed am of those who will be waiting with you.”

32.Fode Drame: Is it that their minds compel them unto this or is it that they are a people who are transgressors.

33.Fode Drame: Or is it that they are saying, “He fabricated it.” Nay! They do not believe.

34.Fode Drame: Let them then bring forth a discourse like unto it if they are truthful.

35.Fode Drame: Or is it that they were created out of nothing? Or is it that they are the creators?

36.Fode Drame: Or is it that they created the heavens and the earth? Nay! They have no certitude.

37.Fode Drame: Or is it that the treasures of your Lord are with them? Or is it that they are the ones in control?

38.Fode Drame: Or is that they have a ladder wherein they [climb to] listen? Let then their listener come forth with an authority most evident.

39.Fode Drame: Or is it that the daughters are for Him while for you are the sons?

40.Fode Drame: Or is it that you ask them for a fee so that they are overburdened with debt?

41.Fode Drame: Or is it that the unseen is with them so that they write?

42.Fode Drame: Or is it that they are seeking to plot? But those who disbelieve, it is they who are plotted against.

43.Fode Drame: Or is it that they have a deity other than Allah? Glorified be Allah above all that they ascribe as partners to Him.

44.Fode Drame: And if they were to see a piece falling from the sky, they would say, “[It is] a heaped up cloud.”

45.Fode Drame: So leave them alone until they meet their day wherein they will be stricken with terror.

46.Fode Drame: A day when their plots will be of no avail to them in aught nor will they be helped.

47.Fode Drame: And truly for those who wrong their own souls, there is a punishment less than that but most of them do not know.

48.Fode Drame: And therefore be patient for the decision of your Lord. Truly you are in Our eyes and glorify the praises of your Lord when you rise.

49.Fode Drame: And in the night do glorify Him and at the time of receding [prostration] of the stars.

1.Fode Drame: By the star when it falls.

2.Fode Drame: Your companion [Muhammad] did not go astray nor was he misled.

3.Fode Drame: Nor does he speak out of the vain desire.

4.Fode Drame: It is but an inspiration inspired unto him.

5.Fode Drame: He was taught by [Gabriel] the one formidable in power.

6.Fode Drame: Master of strength and he [Gabriel] rose up in appearance most proportionate.

7.Fode Drame: While he [Gabriel] was in the horizon the most high.

8.Fode Drame: Then he drew near and lowered down.

9.Fode Drame: Till he was at the angle of two bows or even nearer.

10.Fode Drame: And then He inspired unto His slave what He inspired.

11.Fode Drame: Then the [Prophet Muhammad’s] heart did not belie that which he saw.

12.Fode Drame: Are you then disputing with him about that which he sees?

13.Fode Drame: For indeed he [Prophet Muhammad] saw him [Gabriel] at the second descent.

14.Fode Drame: Besides the Lote-Tree of the farthest boundary.

15.Fode Drame: Besides it is garden of the welcoming.

16.Fode Drame: At a time when He was covering the Lote-Tree with that which He covered.

17.Fode Drame: The [Prophet Muhammad’s] sight did not wander nor did it [the sight] transgress.

18.Fode Drame: Truly he saw the most great from among the signs of his Lord.

19.Fode Drame: Have you seen the ‘Lat’ and the ‘Uzza’?

20.Fode Drame: And ‘Manat’, the third one?

21.Fode Drame: Is it that for you are the male and for Him the female?

22.Fode Drame: That then is a division most biased.

23.Fode Drame: These are but names that you have coined, you and your fathers. Allah has not sent down any authority by them. They but follow the wishful thinking and that which the souls desire while the guidance has indeed come unto them from their Lord.

24.Fode Drame: Or is it that the man can get all that he wishes for?

25.Fode Drame: But for Allah is the end and the beginning.

26.Fode Drame: And how many an angel [are there] in the heavens? Their intercession avails nothing except after Allah gives permission for whom He wills and pleases.

27.Fode Drame: Truly those who do not believe in the hereafter do name the angels with the naming of the female.

28.Fode Drame: And there is no knowledge [certitude] for them about that. They but follow the wishful thinking and truly the wishful thinking avails nothing from the truth.

29.Fode Drame: Therefore turn aside from the one who turns away from Our remembrance and does not want except the life of this world.

30.Fode Drame: That is their limit from the knowledge. Truly your Lord knows all about the one who has gone astray from His way and He knows all about the one who has found the guidance.

31.Fode Drame: And for Allah is all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth so that He may reward those who have done evil because of what they have done and may reward those who have acted in excellence with the most excellent [reward].

32.Fode Drame: Those who keep away from the major sins and from the offences except the minor ones. Truly your Lord is abundant in the forgiveness and He knows all about you when He raised you from the earth and when you were covered in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be sanctimonious. He it is who knows all about one who safeguards his soul.

33.Fode Drame: Have you seen the one who has turned back?

34.Fode Drame: And he gives little and he became miserly.

35.Fode Drame: Is the knowledge of the unseen with him so that he can see?

36.Fode Drame: Or is he not informed about that which is in the scripture of Moses?

37.Fode Drame: And of Abraham who fulfilled [the words].

38.Fode Drame: That no bearer of a burden will bear the burden of another.

39.Fode Drame: And that there is nothing for the man except that for which he has labored.

40.Fode Drame: And that his labour will soon be seen.

41.Fode Drame: Then will he be rewarded with the reward most fulfilled.

42.Fode Drame: And that unto your Lord is the final end.

43.Fode Drame: And that it is He who makes laugh and makes weep.

44.Fode Drame: And that it is He who puts to death and gives life.

45.Fode Drame: And that He indeed created the pairs, the male and the female.

46.Fode Drame: From a liquid as it flows out.

47.Fode Drame: And that upon Him lies the other creation.

48.Fode Drame: And that indeed it is He who makes rich and makes upright.

49.Fode Drame: And truly He it is the Lord of the Shi’ra [the Sirius].

50.Fode Drame: And truly He it is who destroyed ‘Ad of the earlier times.

51.Fode Drame: And Thamud and He did not leave any.

52.Fode Drame: And the people of Noah before. Truly they were the most wrongful and the most transgressive.

53.Fode Drame: And the city that was upturned He caused it to fall down.

54.Fode Drame: So that He covered it by that which covered [it].

55.Fode Drame: Then about which of the blessings of your Lord will you dispute?

56.Fode Drame: This is a warner from the warners of the earlier times.

57.Fode Drame: The momentous has drawn near.

58.Fode Drame: There is no remover [of its woes] except Allah.

59.Fode Drame: Do you then marvel at this discourse?

60.Fode Drame: And you laugh and do not weep.

61.Fode Drame: While you are merry-making.

62.Fode Drame: So prostrate for Allah and serve [Him] truly.

1.Fode Drame: The hour has drawn near and the moon is split.

2.Fode Drame: And if they see a sign, they turn aside and they say, “A magic that is going to pass.”

3.Fode Drame: And they belied and followed their vain desires but every commandment must reach its final destination.

4.Fode Drame: And indeed there has come unto them such news wherein there is enough to warn them away.

5.Fode Drame: A wisdom of the uttermost reach but the warnings avail not.

6.Fode Drame: Therefore turn your back on them till the day when the caller will call to something most objectionable.

7.Fode Drame: With their eyes cast down in humility they will come forth from their graves as though they are locusts scattering.

8.Fode Drame: Going in haste towards the caller, the disbelievers will say, “This is a day most hard.”

9.Fode Drame: Before them the people of Noah belied and they belied Our servant and they said, “A madman.” so he was shunned.

10.Fode Drame: So he called out to his Lord that, “I am overwhelmed so come to assistance!”

11.Fode Drame: Therefore We opened the gates of the heaven with water pouring down.

12.Fode Drame: And We caused the earth to gush forth with fountains so the water met according to a commandment which was well devised.

13.Fode Drame: And We carried him onboard [a vessel] made of planks and nails.

14.Fode Drame: It sailed under Our eyes as a requital for such a one who disbelieved.

15.Fode Drame: And We indeed left it as a sign. Is there then any who is going to ponder?

16.Fode Drame: How then did it go with My punishment and My warnings?

17.Fode Drame: And We have indeed made the Quran easy for the remembrance. Is there then any who is going to ponder?

18.Fode Drame: The people of ‘Ad belied [too] and how then did it go with My punishment and My warnings?

19.Fode Drame: We indeed sent against them a freezing wind in a day of continuous ill omen.

20.Fode Drame: Plucking people as though they were trunks of date-tree uprooted.

21.Fode Drame: How then did it go with My punishment and My warnings?

22.Fode Drame: And We have indeed made the Quran easy for the remembrance. Is there then any who is going to ponder?

23.Fode Drame: People of Samood belied the warnings.

24.Fode Drame: And they said, “Are we going to follow one human among us? We then are truly in a misguidance and a mania.

25.Fode Drame: Has the remembrance been sent down on him [alone] from among us? Nay! He is a liar most arrogant.”

26.Fode Drame: They will come to know tomorrow who is the liar most arrogant.

27.Fode Drame: We indeed are going to send the she-camel as a trial for them so watch them [O Salih!] and exercise patience.

28.Fode Drame: And inform them that the water is to be shared between them [and the she-camel]. Each share of the drink will be made available.

29.Fode Drame: But they called their companion and he took it upon himself and hamstrung [her].

30.Fode Drame: How then did it go with My punishment and My warnings?

31.Fode Drame: We indeed sent against them one deafening blast so they became like the broken stalk of a cattle-fold.

32.Fode Drame: And We have indeed made the Quran easy for the remembrance. Is there then any who is going to ponder?

33.Fode Drame: The people of Lot belied the warnings.

34.Fode Drame: We indeed sent against them a shower of pebbles excepting the family of Lot. We took them to safety by early dawn.

35.Fode Drame: As a grace from Our presence. Thus do We requite anyone who offers gratitude.

36.Fode Drame: And indeed he warned them of Our mighty seize but they disputed the warnings.

37.Fode Drame: And they indeed sought to prevail with him about his guests so We blinded their eyes. Therefore taste you My punishment and My warnings.

38.Fode Drame: And indeed a most enduring punishment visited them in the morning.

39.Fode Drame: Taste you therefore My punishment and My warnings.

40.Fode Drame: And We have indeed made the Quran easy for the remembrance. Is there then any who is going to ponder?

41.Fode Drame: And indeed the warnings came unto the people of Pharaoh.
