42.Fode Drame: They belied Our signs all of them, so We seized them with a seizing of one who is All-mighty, All enforcer.

43.Fode Drame: Are your disbelievers better than those ones or do you have a vindication in the former books [of wisdom]?

44.Fode Drame: Or do they say, “We are all together and we are going to triumph.”

45.Fode Drame: The multitude will soon be defeated and they will turn their backs in flight.

46.Fode Drame: Nay! The hour is their appointed time and the hour is most horrendous and most bitter.

47.Fode Drame: Truly the evildoers are in a misguidance and in a mania.

48.Fode Drame: The day when they will be dragged on their faces in the fire. [It will be said unto them], “Taste you then the touch of saqar [a fire that cuts into pieces].”

49.Fode Drame: Truly everything have We created it in due measure.

50.Fode Drame: But Our commandment is nothing except like one twinkling of the eye.

51.Fode Drame: And We indeed destroyed people of your kind [before you]. Is there then any who is going to ponder?

52.Fode Drame: All that they have done is in the former books [of wisdom].

53.Fode Drame: And everything small and big is noted down.

54.Fode Drame: Truly those who revere Allah will be in gardens and rivers.

55.Fode Drame: In a platform of righteousness in the presence of a King, All Enforcer.

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Fode Drame: Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful]

2.Fode Drame: He taught the Quran.

3.Fode Drame: He created the human being.

4.Fode Drame: He taught him clarity in speech.

5.Fode Drame: The sun and the moon are in computation.

6.Fode Drame: And the star and the tree are both in prostration.

7.Fode Drame: And the heaven, He raised it up and He brought down the balance.

8.Fode Drame: So that you do not transgress in the balance.

9.Fode Drame: And establish the weight with equity and do not fall short of the balance.

10.Fode Drame: And the earth, He laid it down smoothly for the living beings.

11.Fode Drame: Therein are fruits and the date-trees with sheathed date-clusters.

12.Fode Drame: And the seeds with husks, and the fragrance.

13.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

14.Fode Drame: He created the human being from dry sounding clay like the pottery.

15.Fode Drame: And He created the Jinns from a smokeless flame from a fire.

16.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

17.Fode Drame: Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests.

18.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

19.Fode Drame: He sent forth the two oceans that meet together.

20.Fode Drame: Between the two is a barrier. They do not transgress.

21.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

22.Fode Drame: Out of the two come out pearls and red-corals.

23.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

24.Fode Drame: And for Him are the ships deployed in the ocean like mountains.

25.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

26.Fode Drame: Everyone thereupon is going to come to an end.

27.Fode Drame: But will abide the face of your Lord; Lord of the majesty and of the grace.

28.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

29.Fode Drame: Everyone in the heavens and in the earth entreats Him. Every day He is in a new manifestation of [His] glory.

30.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

31.Fode Drame: We will soon make Ourselves ready for you O both you burdens!

32.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

33.Fode Drame: O you community of the Jinns and of the humans! If you are able to pass through the regions of the heavens and of the earth then pass through. You will not pass except with an authority.

34.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

35.Fode Drame: Against both of you [without an authority] will be sent flames from a fire and shower of iron so you will not triumph.

36.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

37.Fode Drame: And when the sky is cleft asunder so that it becomes a red rose like an unguent.

38.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

39.Fode Drame: On that day neither a man nor a jinn will be asked about his sin.

40.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

41.Fode Drame: The evildoers will be recognized by their marks so they will be seized by the forelocks and by the feet.

42.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

43.Fode Drame: “This is the hell which the evildoers belied.”

44.Fode Drame: They take turns between it [the hellfire] and a scalding boiling water.

45.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

46.Fode Drame: And as for the one who fears the station of his Lord, there will be two gardens.

47.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

48.Fode Drame: Both of them full of trees with luxuriant branches.

49.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

50.Fode Drame: In each of the two [gardens] will be two fountains with free-flowing water.

51.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

52.Fode Drame: In them there will be two kinds from each fruit.

53.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

54.Fode Drame: Reclining on beds the stuffing of which is from fine brocade and the fruits of the two gardens are near at hand.

55.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

56.Fode Drame: In them are maidens with gaze confined [to their spouses] neither man nor jinn had attained to them before them.

57.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

58.Fode Drame: As though they are pearls and rubies.

59.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

60.Fode Drame: Is the reward for excellence any other than the excellence?

61.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

62.Fode Drame: And below these two [gardens], there are two [other] gardens.

63.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

64.Fode Drame: Dark in color from extreme greenness.

65.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

66.Fode Drame: In them are two fountains with slow flowing water.

67.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

68.Fode Drame: In them are fruits and dates and pomegranates.

69.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

70.Fode Drame: In them are mates of refined goodness and excellence

71.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

72.Fode Drame: Mates of paradise confined in their tents.

73.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

74.Fode Drame: Neither man nor jinn had attained to them before them.

75.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

76.Fode Drame: Reclining on green carpets and tapestry of excellence.

77.Fode Drame: Then which of the graces of your Lord will both of you [Jinns and Humans] belie?

78.Fode Drame: Blessed is the name of your Lord; Lord of the Majesty and of the Grace.

56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Fode Drame: When the great happening comes to pass.

2.Fode Drame: There is no soul who will then deny its happening.

3.Fode Drame: Lowering [some souls] and raising [other souls].

4.Fode Drame: When the earth is shaken with a full shaking.

5.Fode Drame: And the mountains are pulverized to a complete pulverization.

6.Fode Drame: So that they become dust scattered all over.

7.Fode Drame: And then you will become three kinds.

8.Fode Drame: Then the people of the right hand;- What are the people of the right hand?

9.Fode Drame: And the people of the left hand;- What are the people of the left hand?

10.Fode Drame: And the foremost in rank [in the sight of Allah] are those who are foremost [in good deeds].

11.Fode Drame: Those are the ones who are drawn nearest to Allah.

12.Fode Drame: In the gardens of felicity.

13.Fode Drame: A multitude from the former people.

14.Fode Drame: And a few from the later people.

15.Fode Drame: They will be on eiderdown beds.

16.Fode Drame: Reclining thereupon facing one another.

17.Fode Drame: Youths immortalized wait upon them.

18.Fode Drame: With goblets and jars and cups [filled] from pure fountains.

19.Fode Drame: They suffer no head-aches from it nor do they bleed.

20.Fode Drame: And with fruits of their choice.

21.Fode Drame: And with meat of birds from what they desire.

22.Fode Drame: And maidens of paradise with beautiful eyes.

23.Fode Drame: Like unto pearls well hidden.

24.Fode Drame: Reward for that which they used to do.

25.Fode Drame: They hear not therein any foul speech nor any sinful words.

26.Fode Drame: Only the saying of Peace! Peace!

27.Fode Drame: And the people of the right hand. What are the people of the right hand?

28.Fode Drame: They are amidst Lote-trees with no thorns.

29.Fode Drame: And in acacias neatly clustered.

30.Fode Drame: And in shade well extended.

31.Fode Drame: And in water pouring out.

32.Fode Drame: And in fruits most abundant;

33.Fode Drame: there is no shortage and is not forbidden.

34.Fode Drame: And in beds raised up.

35.Fode Drame: Truly We have created them [their spouses] a new creation.

36.Fode Drame: And We made them into virgins.

37.Fode Drame: Enamorous and equal in age.

38.Fode Drame: For the companions of the right hand.

39.Fode Drame: A multitude from the former people.

40.Fode Drame: And a multitude of those of later time.

41.Fode Drame: And people of the left hand;- What are the people of the left hand?

42.Fode Drame: [They will be ] in pure smokeless fire and in scalding water.

43.Fode Drame: And in a shade from a choking smoke;

44.Fode Drame: neither cool nor gracious.

45.Fode Drame: Truly they were before this in affluence.

46.Fode Drame: And they used to persist on the most egregious sin.

47.Fode Drame: And they used to say, “Is it that when we die and have become dust and bones are we certainly going to be raised again?

48.Fode Drame: Or our forefathers?”

49.Fode Drame: Say, “Truly those of the former time and those of the later time.”

50.Fode Drame: Will surely be gathered together unto appointment of a day well marked.

51.Fode Drame: Then truly O you who have gone astray, the beliers!

52.Fode Drame: You certainly are going to eat from tree of Zaqqum.

53.Fode Drame: And you are going to fill your bellies from it.

54.Fode Drame: And then you are going to drink upon it from the boiling water.

55.Fode Drame: And you will drink like the drinking of a wandering camel.

56.Fode Drame: This will be their welcome food on the day of reckoning.

57.Fode Drame: It is We who created you, will you not then testify to the truth?

58.Fode Drame: Have you seen [the seed] that you discharge.

59.Fode Drame: Are you the ones who create it? Or are We the one who are the creators?

60.Fode Drame: It is Us who have appointed the death between you and We are not going to be outstripped.

61.Fode Drame: It may be that We may change your likeness and We may create you in a form that you know not.

62.Fode Drame: You did indeed know the first creation. Why then do you not remember?

63.Fode Drame: Have you seen that which you sow?

64.Fode Drame: Is it you who make it grow? Or are we the one who are the growers?

65.Fode Drame: If We so pleased, We would have made it into chaff so that you remained wondering;

66.Fode Drame: “truly we are surely left burdened with debts.

67.Fode Drame: Nay! We are those who are deprived”

68.Fode Drame: Have you seen the water which you drink?

69.Fode Drame: Are you the ones who have brought it down from the clouds? Or are We the one who are the bringers?

70.Fode Drame: If We so pleased, We could make it into bitter water. Will you not then offer gratitude?

71.Fode Drame: Have you seen the fire which you kindle?

72.Fode Drame: Are you the ones who made its tree to grow? Or are We the growers?

73.Fode Drame: It is We who have made it a reminder and a provision for the travelers.

74.Fode Drame: So glorify the name of your Lord, The All-magnificent.

75.Fode Drame: Lo! I swear by the setting of the stars.

76.Fode Drame: And that indeed is surely an oath most magnificent if you only know.

77.Fode Drame: Truly it is surely a Quran, most gracious.

78.Fode Drame: In a book well-guarded.

79.Fode Drame: No one touches it except the ones who are purified.

80.Fode Drame: Sent down from the Lord of the worlds.

81.Fode Drame: Is this the discourse that you are taking slightly?

82.Fode Drame: And you do make your provision by that you belie?

83.Fode Drame: How then when it [the soul] reaches the top of the throat.

84.Fode Drame: While you at that moment look on [helplessly].

85.Fode Drame: And it is We who are closer to him than you but you do not see.

86.Fode Drame: If only you were not under obligation [unto Us].

87.Fode Drame: You can bring it back if you are truthful.

88.Fode Drame: Thus if he is of those drawn near [unto Allah].

89.Fode Drame: Thereupon for him is breath of life and a fragrance and a garden of felicity.

90.Fode Drame: And if he is of the people of the right hand.

91.Fode Drame: Then, “For you is peace from the people of the right hand.”

92.Fode Drame: But if he is of those who belied and have gone astray.

93.Fode Drame: Then a welcome food from the boiling water.

94.Fode Drame: And burning in the hellfire.

95.Fode Drame: Truly this certainly is the truth of the certitude.

96.Fode Drame: So glorify the name of your Lord, The Most-magnificent.

1.Fode Drame: For Allah do glorify all that is in the heavens and in the earth and He it is The All-mighty, The All-wise.

2.Fode Drame: For Him is the dominion of the heavens and of the earth. He gives life and puts to death and He has power over everything.

3.Fode Drame: He is The First and The Last and The All Apparent and The All Hidden and He is All-knowing about everything.

4.Fode Drame: He it is who created the heavens and the earth in six periods and then He established [Himself] on the throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth and what comes out of it and what comes down from the heaven and what ascends in it. He is with you wherever you may be and Allah is All-seeing about whatever you do.

5.Fode Drame: For Him is dominion of the heavens and of the earth and unto Allah are returned all the commandments.

6.Fode Drame: He makes the night to penetrate into the day and He makes the day to penetrate into the night and He is All-knowing about the essence of the bosoms.

7.Fode Drame: Believe in Allah and in His messenger and spend from that in which He made you vicegerents and as for those who believe from among you and spend, for them there is a great reward.

8.Fode Drame: Why will you not believe in Allah when the messenger is calling you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your firm pledge if you were true believers.

9.Fode Drame: He it is who sends down clear signs on His slave so that He may take you out from the darknesses to the light and truly Allah is surely All-tender, Most Merciful to you.

10.Fode Drame: Why will you not spend in the way of Allah when to Allah belongs the inheritance of the heavens and of the earth. They are not equal among you those who spent and fought before the victory. These are greater in rank than those who spent and have fought after [the victory] and to both Allah has promised the excellent [reward] and Allah is All-acquainted with all that you do.

11.Fode Drame: Who is it who will loan unto Allah an excellent loan so that He may multiply it for him and for him is a gracious reward.

12.Fode Drame: The day you will see the believing men and women, their light moving earnestly ahead of them and on their right sides. Good tidings for you today, gardens beneath which the rivers flow to abide therein forever. That is the most magnificent success.

13.Fode Drame: The day that the hypocrites men and women will say to those who believed, “Wait for us! Let us take a brand from your light.” It is said, “Return behind you and fumble around for a light.” Then a bulwark is raised between them. It has a door. As for the inside of it, within it there is the mercy. And as for the outside of it, in front of it there is the punishment.

14.Fode Drame: They will cry out unto them, “Were we not with you?” They will say, “yes indeed. But you brought tribulation upon yourselves and you procrastinated and you doubted and the false hopes deluded you till the commandment of Allah came and the deceiver deceived you about Allah”

15.Fode Drame: So today no ransom will be accepted from you nor from those who disbelieved. Your abode is the fire. It is your master and how woeful the place of ending it is.

16.Fode Drame: Has time not come for those who believe that their hearts should humble for the remembrance of Allah and for that which came down from the truth and that they should not be like those who were given the book before and they found the intervening period so long that their hearts hardened and many of them were renegades.

17.Fode Drame: Know that Allah does make the earth come to life after its death. We have indeed made the signs clear for you so that you may understand.

18.Fode Drame: Truly the men and women who give in charity and loan to Allah an excellent loan, it will be multiplied for them and for them there is a gracious reward.

19.Fode Drame: Those who believe in Allah and in His messengers, they are those who are true [in their faith] and the witnesses are in the presence of their Lord. For them is their reward and their light and as for those who disbelieved and belied Our signs, these are the people of the hellfire.

20.Fode Drame: Know that the life of this world is nothing but sport and idleness and adornment and mutual vaunting amongst you and competition in amassing the wealth and the children. [The life of this world] is like a rain the growth of which is admirable to the disbelieving [farmers], then it increases in growth and then you see it turning yellow then it becomes chaff. And in the hereafter [there is] a formidable punishment and also a forgiveness and also a good pleasure [Ridhwan] from Allah and the life of this world is nothing but the enjoyment of delusion.

21.Fode Drame: Race with one another towards a forgiveness from your Lord and [towards] a garden whose wideness is like the wideness of the heaven and of the earth. It is made ready for those who believe in Allah and in His messengers. This is favor of Allah that He gives to whoever He pleases and Allah is the master of the most magnificent favor.

22.Fode Drame: No calamity happens in the earth nor within your own souls except that it is written in a book before We fashion it (the calamity). Truly that is easy for Allah.

23.Fode Drame: So that you do not mourn over that which you fail to attain nor exult over that which He gave you and Allah does not love any who is self-conceited, self-vaunting.

24.Fode Drame: Those who hold back and enjoin withholding on men and whosoever turns his back, truly Allah, He it is The All-self-sufficient, The All-praiseworthy.

25.Fode Drame: We have indeed sent Our messengers with clear signs and with them We sent down the book and the balance so that the mankind may stand in uprightness; and We sent down the iron in which there is mighty strife but also benefits for the mankind; and so that Allah may mark out those who help Him and His messengers from the unseen. Truly Allah is All-strong, All-mighty.

26.Fode Drame: And We have indeed sent Noah and Abraham and We have placed in their descendants the prophethood and the book and among them are ones who were well guided but many of them were renegades.

27.Fode Drame: Then We made Our [other] messengers to follow on their footsteps and then We followed them with Jesus son of Mary and We gave him the gospel and We placed in the hearts of those who follow him, tenderness and mercy. Whereas the monasticism, they invented it. We did not prescribe it upon them all but to seek the pleasure of Allah, yet they did not take care of it [the monasticism] with its proper care so We gave to those who believe among them their rewards but many of them are renegades.

28.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Revere Allah and believe in His messenger. He will give you two measures from His mercy and He will make for you a light by which you walk and He will forgive you [your sins] and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

29.Fode Drame: So that the people of the book may know that they have no power over anything from the favor of Allah and that the favor is in the hand of Allah. He gives it to whomsoever He pleases and Allah is the master of the most magnificent favor.

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Fode Drame: Allah indeed heard the words of the woman who was arguing with you concerning her husband and she complained to Allah and Allah hears dialogue of the two of you. Truly Allah is All-hearing, All-seeing.

2.Fode Drame: Those among you who abandon their wives by claiming them to be as forbidden to them as their mothers, they are not their mothers. Their mothers are only those who gave them birth and truly they are saying a most objectionable speech and a false witnessing. Truly Allah is surely Oft-pardoning, Oft-Forgiving.

3.Fode Drame: And those who abandon their wives claiming that they are as forbidden to them as their mothers and thereafter want to go back on what they have said, they must free a bondsman before they touch one another. This you are exhorted to do and Allah is All-acquainted with all that you do.

4.Fode Drame: And whosoever does not find the means [to free a bondsman] then he must fast two consecutive months before they touch one another and whosoever is not able [to fast two consecutive months] then he must feed sixty needy ones. That is so in order that you may affirm your belief in Allah and in His messenger and these are the boundaries set by Allah and as for those who disbelieve, for them is a painful punishment.

5.Fode Drame: Truly those who defy Allah and His messenger, they will be overthrown as were overthrown those who were before them and We have indeed sent down clear signs and as for the disbelievers, for them is a debasing punishment.

6.Fode Drame: The day Allah will raise them altogether and He will inform them about all that they had done. Allah has taken full record of it while they forgot it and Allah is All-witness over everything.

7.Fode Drame: Have you not seen that Allah knows all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth? There is no secret counsel among three except that He is their fourth nor among any five except that He is their sixth nor less than that nor more except that He is with them wherever they may be. Then He will inform them about all that they had done, on the day of resurrection. Truly Allah is All-knowing about everything.

8.Fode Drame: Have you not seen those who were forbidden from secret counsels but then they went back to that from which they were forbidden and they counsel among themselves about sinfulness and transgression and disobedience to the messenger and when they come to you, they greet you by that which Allah has not greeted you with and they say within themselves, “Why does Allah not punish us for what We say?” Enough for them is hellfire to burn therein. What a woeful place of ending.

9.Fode Drame: O you who believe! When you hold secret counsels among you, do not counsel one another unto sinfulness and transgression and disobedience of the messenger rather counsel one another unto piety and self-guard. And revere Allah unto whom you shall be gathered.

10.Fode Drame: The secret counsel is only from Satan so that the believers may grieve but it is not going to harm them in the least except by the permission of Allah and in Allah let the believers put their trust.

11.Fode Drame: O you who believe! When you are told to make room in the assemblies, do make room and Allah will make room for you and when you are told to rise up, do rise up and Allah will raise [in ranks] those who believe among you and as for those who are given the knowledge [even many more] ranks and Allah is All-acquainted with all that you do.

12.Fode Drame: O you who believe! When you take counsel with the messenger, then do offer alms ahead of your counsel. That is better for you and purer. But if you do not find the means then truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, All-merciful.

13.Fode Drame: Are you concerned that you have to offer alms ahead of your counsel? So since you have not done and Allah has turned to you and accepted your repentance, therefore establish the prayer and pay the sanctifying dues and obey Allah and His messenger and Allah is All-acquainted with all that you do.

14.Fode Drame: Have you not seen those who have taken as allies a people with whom Allah is wroth with? They are neither of you nor of them and they swear on the lie while they know.

15.Fode Drame: Allah has made ready for them a formidable punishment. Truly how evil was that which they used to do.

16.Fode Drame: They have taken their oaths as a shield so they hindered from the way of Allah and therefore for them there is a debasing punishment.

17.Fode Drame: Their wealth and their children will never avail them from Allah in the least. These are people of the fire. They will abide therein forever.

18.Fode Drame: The day Allah will raise them altogether and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and they think that they are on something. Lo! they indeed are the liars.

19.Fode Drame: Satan has prevailed with them so he caused them to forget remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Truly the party of Satan, they are the ones in loss.

20.Fode Drame: Truly those who defy Allah and His messenger, those are among those brought lowest.

21.Fode Drame: Allah has written, “I will most certainly triumph, I and My messengers,” Truly Allah is All-strong, All-mighty.

22.Fode Drame: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and in the last day loving with fondness those who defy Allah and His messenger even though they may be their fathers or their children or their brethren or their clan. These are the ones He has written faith in their hearts and has strengthened them with a spirit from Him. And He will make them enter into gardens beneath which the rivers flow to abide therein forever. Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. These are the party of Allah. Truly the party of Allah, they are the prosperers.

1.Fode Drame: For Allah has glorified all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth and He it is The All-mighty, The All-wise.

2.Fode Drame: It is He who expelled those who disbelieved among the people of the book from their homes right from the first gathering. You did not think that they will go forth and they thought that their fortresses were going to protect them from Allah but Allah came upon them from where they did not expect and He cast the terror in their hearts. They demolished their houses with their own hands and with the hands of the believers therefore take a lesson O you who are endowed with the sight!

3.Fode Drame: Had Allah not decreed upon them the banishment, He surely would have punished them in this life and for them in the hereafter will be the punishment of the fire.

4.Fode Drame: This is so because they have contended against Allah and His messenger and whosoever contends against Allah, then truly Allah is formidable in retribution.

5.Fode Drame: Whatever date-trees you might have cut down or left standing on their foundations indeed was by the permission of Allah and so that He may humiliate the renegades.

6.Fode Drame: And whatever gains of war which Allah may have bestowed on His messenger from them, it was not through your raiding of them with horses or with camels but Allah gives authority to His messengers over any that He pleases and Allah has power over everything.

7.Fode Drame: Whatever gains of war Allah may have bestowed on His messenger from the people of the townships are for Allah and for the messenger and for the near of kin and the orphans and the needy ones and the wayfarer so that it does not become a monopoly between the rich among you. And whatever the messenger brings unto you, take it and whatever he forbids you from, then [from it] keep away and revere Allah. Truly Allah is Formidable in the chastisement.

8.Fode Drame: For the poor migrants who were driven out from their homes and from their properties, they seek favor from Allah and [His] good pleasure and they help Allah and His messenger. These are the ones who are true in faith.

9.Fode Drame: And those who were established in the home and in the faith before them, they love whosoever migrates to them and they find in their bosoms no hankering after that which they [migrants] were given and they give preference over their own selves even when they were in dire hunger. And whosoever is protected against the selfishness of his own soul, truly those are the prosperers.

10.Fode Drame: And those who came after them they say, “O our Lord! Forgive us [our sins] and for our brothers who preceded us in the faith and do not put rancor in our hearts against those who have believed. O our Lord! Truly you are All-tender, Most-merciful.”

11.Fode Drame: Have you not seen those who have taken to hypocrisy, they say to their brethren who have disbelieved from among the people of the book, “If you are driven out, we will go out with you and we will not obey anyone in regards to you ever and if you are fought against, we certainly will help you.” And Allah bears witness that indeed they are most certainly liars.

12.Fode Drame: If they are driven out they will not go out with them and if they are fought against, they will not help them and if they help them, they will certainly turn their backs in flight and then they will not be helped.

13.Fode Drame: Truly the fear of you is greater in their bosoms than [the fear] of Allah. This is because they are a people who do not discern.

14.Fode Drame: They will not fight you altogether except in fortified townships or from behind walls. Their strife is mighty among them. You think that they are united altogether but their hearts are divergent. That is because they are a people who do not understand.

15.Fode Drame: Like the fate of those who were before them a short while ago. They tasted the evil outcome of their affair and for them will be a painful punishment.

16.Fode Drame: Similar to the fate of Satan who says to the human being, “Disbelieve” but when he has disbelieved he says, “I indeed disavow you for I indeed fear Allah, Lord of the worlds.”

17.Fode Drame: The ultimate fate of both of them is that both of them will be in the fire to abide therein forever and that is the reward of those who wrong their own souls.

18.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Revere Allah and let every soul see that which it has sent forth for tomorrow and revere Allah. Truly Allah is All-acquainted with all that you do.

19.Fode Drame: And be not like those who forgot Allah so He caused them to forget themselves. Those are the renegades.

20.Fode Drame: People of the fire are not equal to the people of the garden. People of the garden, they are the successful ones.

21.Fode Drame: Had We sent down this Quran on a mountain, you will surely see it humble and breaking into pieces out of deference of Allah and those examples We set them forth for the mankind so that perhaps they may reflect.

22.Fode Drame: He Allah, it is He, there is no deity save He, Knower of the unseen and of the witnessed. He is Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful], The Most Merciful.

23.Fode Drame: He Allah, it is He, there is no deity save He, The King, The All-holy, The Peace, The Inspirer of faith, The Superseder, The All-mighty, The All-compelling, The All-grandiose. Glory be unto Allah from all that they ascribe as partners unto Him.

24.Fode Drame: He is Allah, The Creator, The Moulder, The Fashioner, for Him are the most excellent names. All that is in the heavens and in the earth glorify Him and He is The All-mighty, The All-wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Do not take my enemy and your enemy as allies. You approach them with affection when they have disbelieved in that which has come to you from the truth. They expelled the messenger and [expel] you because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you truly have come out to strive in My way and to seek My good pleasure. You offer them affection in secret when I fully know all that you conceal and all that you reveal and whosoever does that among you, he has indeed gone astray from the right way.

2.Fode Drame: If they have you at a disadvantage, they become enemies to you and they stretch their hands and their tongues towards you with evil and they desire that you should also disbelieve.

3.Fode Drame: Neither your ties of kinship nor your children will ever be of any benefit to you. On the day of resurrection, He will part between you and Allah is All-seeing about all that you do.

4.Fode Drame: Indeed there is a most excellent model for you in the person of Abraham and in those who were with him when they said to their people, “We indeed have disavowed you and all that you worship besides Allah. We have rejected you and between us and you has come to be the enmity and the hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone.” Except the word [of promise] of Abraham for his father saying, “I most certainly seek forgiveness for you but I have no control over anything for you from Allah. O Our Lord! In You, we put our trust and unto You we turn back and unto You is the place of final coming.”

5.Fode Drame: O our Lord! Do not make us a trial for those who disbelieve and forgive us O our Lord! For you are The All-mighty, The All-wise.

6.Fode Drame: Indeed there is a most excellent model for you in them for such who looks forward to Allah and the last day and whosoever turns back then truly Allah is The All-self-sufficient, The All-praiseworthy.

7.Fode Drame: Perhaps Allah may well put affection between you and between those who have been your enemy from among them and Allah is All-powerful and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

8.Fode Drame: Allah does not bar you from those who have not fought against you in the religion and who have not driven you out of your homes that you be kind to them and that you treat them with equity. Truly Allah loves those who are equitable.

9.Fode Drame: Allah only bars you from those who have fought against you in the religion and have driven you out from your homes and they have collaborated in driving you out f[rom your homes] that you ally with them and whosoever allies with them, truly those are the ones who have wronged their own souls.

10.Fode Drame: O you who believe, when the believing women come to you migrating [in the way of Allah], do try them [in faith]. Allah knows all about their belief and if you find them to be believing women then do not return them to the disbelievers. They [believing women] are not lawful to them [the disbelievers] and they [the disbelievers] will not be lawful for them [believing women] and give them what they have spent [as dowry] and there is no restriction on you to marry them if you give them their dowries and do not hold unto the guardianship of the disbelieving women so ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgment of Allah. He judges between you and Allah is All-knowing, All-wise.

11.Fode Drame: And if anyone from your wives escapes you to the disbelievers and you in turn get the same opportunity [over them] then give them whose wives have gone forth the like of what they have spent and revere Allah in Whom you are believers.

12.Fode Drame: O you the prophet! When the believing women come to you pledging their allegiance to you that they will not ascribe any as partner to Allah, that they will not steal, and that they will not commit adultery, and that they will not kill their children, and that they will not commit any opprobrium that they contrive between their hands and between their legs and that they will not disobey you in any matter of fair kindness then accept their pledge of allegiance and ask Allah to forgive them. Truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

13.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Do not take as ally a people Allah is wroth with. They have indeed lost hope in the hereafter as the disbelievers have lost hope about the people of the graves.

1.Fode Drame: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth has glorified Allah and He is The All-mighty, The All-wise.

2.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Why do you say that which you do not do.

3.Fode Drame: Egregiously heinous it is in the sight of Allah that you say which you do not do.

4.Fode Drame: Truly Allah loves those who fight in His way in ranks as though they are a building, well-structured.

5.Fode Drame: And when Moses said to his people, “O my people! Why do you hurt me when you surely know that I indeed am messenger of Allah to you?” But when they were bent on crookedness, Allah caused their hearts to be crooked and Allah does not guide the people who are the renegades.

6.Fode Drame: And when Jesus son of Mary said, “O children of Israel! I indeed am messenger of Allah to you testifying to the truth that came before me in Torah and giving glad tidings of a messenger to come after me whose name is Ahmad.” But when he brought clear signs to them, they said, “This is a magic most evident.”

7.Fode Drame: And who does greater wrong to his own soul than one who contrives the lie against Allah while he is being called to self-surrender and Allah does not guide the people who have done wrong to their own souls.

8.Fode Drame: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths but Allah is going to fulfill His light even though the disbelievers may be averse to it.

9.Fode Drame: He it is who sent His messenger with the guidance and with religion of the truth so that He may make it prevail over the religion all of it even though those who ascribe partners to Allah may be averse to it.

10.Fode Drame: O you who believe! May I point out to you a trade which will save you from a painful punishment.

11.Fode Drame: You will believe in Allah and in His messenger and you will strive in the way of Allah with your wealth and with your lives. That is better for you if you indeed know.

12.Fode Drame: then He will forgive you your sins and He will make you enter into gardens beneath which the rivers flow and into goodly abodes in the gardens of felicity. That is the most magnificent triumph.

13.Fode Drame: And another [immediate achievement] which you love.. Help from Allah and a victory close at hand. So give glad tidings to the believers.

14.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Be helpers of Allah as Jesus son of Mary said to the disciples, “Who are my helpers to Allah?” The disciples said, “We are helpers of Allah.” So a party from the children of Israel believed and a party disbelieved. So We gave help to those who believed against their enemies and so they became the ones who prevailed.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Fode Drame: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorify Allah, The King, The All-holy, The All-mighty, The All-wise.

2.Fode Drame: He it is who has sent among the unlettered peoples a messenger from themselves. He relates unto them His signs and he sanctifies them and he teaches them the book and the wisdom even though they were before indeed in misguidance most evident.

3.Fode Drame: And to others among them who have not joined them yet and He it is The All-mighty, The All-wise.

4.Fode Drame: That is Allah’s favor, He gives it to whom He pleases and Allah is the master of favor most magnificent.

5.Fode Drame: The likeness of those who were charged to uphold the Torah, but then they did not uphold it, is as the likeness of the donkey carrying books. How woeful is the likeness of the people who belie Allah’s signs and Allah does not guide the people who do wrong to their own souls.

6.Fode Drame: Say, “O you who have adhered to Judaism! If you claim that you are friends to Allah to the exclusion of other people then yearn for death if you are indeed true in your claim.”

7.Fode Drame: But they will never yearn for it because of that which their hands have wrought and Allah is All-knowing about those who do wrong to their own souls.

8.Fode Drame: Say, “Truly the death from which you are fleeing, it indeed is going to meet you and then you will be brought back to the Knower of the unseen and of the witnessed and then He will inform you about all that you used to do.”

9.Fode Drame: O you who believe! When the call is made for the prayer on the day of Friday, then go to remembrance of Allah with a graceful demeanor and suspend the commerce. That is better for you if you indeed know.

10.Fode Drame: Once the prayer has been completed then scatter in the earth and seek from the bounty of Allah and remember Allah a great deal so that perhaps you may prosper.

11.Fode Drame: But when they see a merchandize or an amusement, they all scuttle away towards it and leave you standing. Say, “What is with Allah is better than the amusement and the commerce.” and Allah is the best of the providers.

1.Fode Drame: When the hypocrites come to you they say, “We bear witness that you indeed are messenger of Allah.” but Allah knows that you indeed are truly His messenger and Allah witnesses that the hypocrites are surely liars.

2.Fode Drame: They have taken their oaths as a shield so they hinder from the way of Allah. Truly evil it is that which they used to do.

3.Fode Drame: That is because they indeed believed, then they disbelieved, so a seal was placed on their hearts therefore they do not discern.

4.Fode Drame: And when you see them, their physical look marvels you and when they speak, you are inclined to listen to their speech. They are but like blocks buttressed up. They think of every outcry as being against them. They are the enemy so beware of them. The curse of Allah be upon them. Where then are they turned away?

5.Fode Drame: And when they are told, “Come! The messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you.” They swerve their heads aside and you see them turning away while they are in arrogance.

6.Fode Drame: It is all the same for them whether you seek forgiveness for them or you do not seek forgiveness for them. Allah will never forgive them. Truly Allah does not guide the people who are the renegades.

7.Fode Drame: They are the ones who say, “Do not spend on those who are with messenger of Allah till they disperse away.” But for Allah are the treasures of the heavens and of the earth but the hypocrites do not discern.

8.Fode Drame: They say, “When we return to Medina, the ones with dignity will drive out from it the ones without dignity.” But the dignity is only for Allah and for His messenger and for the believers but the hypocrites do not know.

9.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Let not your wealth nor your children distract you from remembrance of Allah. Whosoever does that, they indeed are the ones who are in loss.

10.Fode Drame: And spend out of that which We have provided you before the death comes to one of you and then he would say, “O my Lord! If only you could give me respite for a little while so that I may give in charity and I be of those who are the righteous.”

11.Fode Drame: And Allah will never grant respite unto any soul when its term has come and Allah is All-acquainted with all that you do.

1.Fode Drame: For Allah glorifies all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. For Him is the sovereignty and for Him is the praise and He has power over everything.

2.Fode Drame: It is He who created you [all] but among you there is disbeliever and among you there is believer and Allah is All-seeing about all that you do.

3.Fode Drame: He created the heavens and the earth by the truth and He has formed you and has made your forms most excellent and unto Him is the place of final coming.

4.Fode Drame: He knows all that is in the heavens and in the earth and He knows all that you make secret and all that you publicize and Allah is All-knowing about the essence of the bosoms.

5.Fode Drame: Have not the news of those who disbelieved before come to you? So they tasted the evil consequence of their affair and for them there is a painful punishment.

6.Fode Drame: That is so because their messengers used to come to them with clear signs but they said, “Is a mere human going to guide us?” So they disbelieved and they turned away and Allah was self-sufficient and Allah is All-self-sufficient, All-praise-worthy.

7.Fode Drame: Those who disbelieved claim that they will never be raised say, “Nay! By my Lord! you shall most certainly be raised and then you shall most certainly be informed about all that you did and that is easy for Allah.”

8.Fode Drame: Therefore believe in Allah and in His messenger and in the light that We have sent down and Allah is All-acquainted about all that you do.

9.Fode Drame: The day when He will gather you for the day of the gathering – that will be the day of mutual hoodwinking. And whosoever believes in Allah and works a righteous deed, He will remove from him all his inequities and make him enter into gardens under which the rivers flow to abide therein forever. That is the most magnificent triumph.

10.Fode Drame: But those who disbelieve and belie Our signs, they are the people of the fire to abide therein forever and what a woeful place of final coming.

11.Fode Drame: No calamity happens except by the permission of Allah and whoever believes in Allah, He will guide his heart and Allah is All-knowing about everything.

12.Fode Drame: Therefore obey Allah and obey the messenger but if you turn away, nothing is on Our messenger except the deliverance, the most evident.

13.Fode Drame: Allah! There is no deity except He and therefore on Allah let the believers put their trust.

14.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Truly from among your spouses and your children are such who are enemies for you therefore beware of them but if you pardon and you turn away in a goodly manner and you forgive, then truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

15.Fode Drame: Your properties and your children are only a trial and Allah, with Him is a most magnificent reward.

16.Fode Drame: Therefore revere Allah as much as you can, and listen, and obey, and spend, that is better for your own souls and whoever is protected from the selfishness of his own soul, truly they are the ones who are the prosperous.

17.Fode Drame: If you loan to Allah an excellent loan, He will multiply it for you and He will forgive you and Allah is All-Grateful, All-Magnanimous,

18.Fode Drame: Knower of the unseen and of the witnessed, The All-mighty, The All-wise.

1.Fode Drame: O you the prophet! When you divorce the women, divorce them for their prescribed waiting period and compute the waiting period accurately and revere Allah, your Lord. Do not expel them from their houses and nor should they go out unless they come with an open offence. And those are the boundaries of Allah and whoever transgresses the boundaries of Allah, he indeed has wronged his own soul and you do not know if perhaps Allah may bring on a new affair after that.

2.Fode Drame: And when they reach their terms, then either hold onto them in a kindly manner or part with them in a kindly manner and take two just persons among you as witnesses and establish the witnessing for Allah. It is such one among you who believe in Allah and in the last day who are admonished with this and whosoever reveres Allah, He will make a way for him out.

3.Fode Drame: And He will provide for him from where he does not expect and whosoever puts his trust in Allah, truly He is sufficient for him. Truly Allah is going to bring His commandment to conclusion. For Allah has indeed made a due measure for everything.

4.Fode Drame: And those among your women who do not expect any monthly courses if you doubt, then their waiting period shall be three months and as well as those who have not yet began their cycles but the ones who are expectant, their term will be till when they lay down their burdens and whosoever reveres Allah, He will put for him ease in his affair.

5.Fode Drame: That is Allah’s commandment which He sent down to you and whoever reveres Allah, He will remove from him his inequities and He will make magnificent for him a reward.

6.Fode Drame: Make them stay in where you stay within your means and do not malign them in order to harass them and if they are expectant then spend unto them until they lay down their burdens and if they suckle for you then give them their reward and consult between you in a kindly manner but if you come to difficulties between you then another woman will suckle [the baby] for him.

7.Fode Drame: Let the man who is affluent spend from his affluence but the ones whose provision are tightened let him spend from that which Allah has given him. Allah does not charge a soul except that which He has given unto it and soon Allah will make ease after hardship.

8.Fode Drame: And how many a township had transgressed against the commandment of their Lord and His messengers so We took them to account with a thorough reckoning and We punished them with a punishment most objectionable.

9.Fode Drame: So they tasted the evil consequence of their affair and the evil consequence of their affair was but loss.

10.Fode Drame: Allah has prepared for them a formidable punishment so revere Allah O people of the heart who believe! Truly Allah has sent down to you a remembrance.

11.Fode Drame: A messenger who rehearses unto you Allah’s signs which make things clear so that He may bring forth those who believe and do righteous deeds from the darknesses to the light and whosoever believes in Allah and works righteous deeds, He will make him enter into gardens beneath which the rivers flow to abide therein forever. Indeed Allah has made for him an excellent provision.

12.Fode Drame: Allah it is He who created seven heavens and from the earth likes of them. The commandment keeps coming down between them so that you may know that Allah has power over everything and that Allah has encompassed everything in knowledge.

1.Fode Drame: O you the prophet! Why do you make forbidden that which Allah has made lawful to you? You seek the pleasure of your spouses and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2.Fode Drame: Allah has indeed prescribed for you the revocation of your oaths and Allah is your master and He is The All-knowing, The All-wise.

3.Fode Drame: And when the prophet spoke to one of his spouses in confidence a discourse, so that when she divulged it and Allah made him to discover it, he made part of it known and he overlooked other parts so when he informed her about it, she said, “Who informed you about this?” He said, “He informed me the One who is The All-knowing, The All-acquainted.”

4.Fode Drame: If both of you turn to Allah in repentance indeed your hearts have inclined in goodness but if you should back one another against him, then truly Allah is his ally and [so are] Gabriel and the righteous believers, and the angels after all that will back him up.

5.Fode Drame: Perhaps his Lord, if he should divorce you, would give him in replacement wives who are better than you who are submitters to Allah, who are believers, who are devout, who are repentant, who are serving, who are circumambulators, who are middle-aged and are virgins.

6.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Protect your own souls and your families from a fire the fuel of which are the human beings and the stones. In charge of it are angels stout and formidable. They do not disobey Allah in that which He has commanded them and they do all what they are commanded.

7.Fode Drame: “O you who disbelieve! Do not make excuses today. You are only rewarded for that which you used to do.”

8.Fode Drame: O you who believe! Turn back to Allah in repentance with a thorough repentance perhaps your Lord may remove from you your inequities and make you enter into gardens beneath which the rivers flow, the day Allah will not cause the prophet and those who believe with him to be disgraced. Their light goes gracefully in front of them and by their right sides. They will say, “O Our Lord! Perfect our light for us and forgive us. Truly you have power over everything.”

9.Fode Drame: O you the prophet! Do strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be firm towards them. For their abode is hellfire and what a woeful place of final coming.

10.Fode Drame: Allah has set forth a parable for those who disbelieve.. in the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. Both of them were under two of Our righteous servants but they betrayed them so they could not benefit them in anything from Allah and they were told to enter into the fire with those who are entering.

11.Fode Drame: And Allah has set forth a parable for those who believe.. in the wife of Pharaoh when she said, “O my Lord! Build for me a house in your presence in the garden and save me from Pharaoh and his work and save me from the people who do wrong to their own souls.”

12.Fode Drame: And Mary, daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity; and then we blew into it from Our spirit and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and to His books and she was of those who were devout.

1.Fode Drame: Extoled is He in whose hand is the dominion and He it is who has power over everything.

2.Fode Drame: He who created the death and the life so that He may try you and mark out who among you is most excellent in work and He it is The All-mighty, The Oft-Forgiving.

3.Fode Drame: He who created seven heavens in layers. You will see no discrepancy in the creation of Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] therefore turn back the gaze. Do you see any flaw?

4.Fode Drame: Then return the sight a second time and the sight will come back to you abject while it is weary.

5.Fode Drame: And We indeed have adorned the lower heaven with lamps and We have made them missiles to pelt the devils away and We have readied for them punishment of the blazing fire.

6.Fode Drame: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord will be the punishment of the hellfire and how woeful is the place of final coming.

7.Fode Drame: And when they are cast therein they will hear it groaning while it boils up.

8.Fode Drame: It almost tears into pieces from the anger. Every time a group is cast therein its keepers will ask them, “Did a warner not come to you?”

9.Fode Drame: They will say, “Indeed a warner did come unto us but we belied and we said, ‘Allah has sent down nothing and you are but in a misguidance most egregious.’”

10.Fode Drame: And they will say, “Had we but heard or understood, we would not have been from among the people of the blazing fire.”

11.Fode Drame: So they confessed their sin therefore far be removed [from Allah’s mercy] the people of the blazing fire.

12.Fode Drame: Truly those who defer to their Lord from the unseen, for them there is forgiveness and a mighty reward.

13.Fode Drame: So make your speech secret or make it loud, truly He is all knowing about the inner most essence of the bosoms.

14.Fode Drame: Does He not know the One who has created while He it is The All-subtle, The All-acquainted?

15.Fode Drame: It is He who has made the earth for you level so travel in its regions and eat from His sustenance and unto Him is the resurrection.

16.Fode Drame: Do you feel safe that One who is in the heaven may cause the earth to sink down with you? Lo! You see it trembling.

17.Fode Drame: Or do you feel safe that One who is in the heaven may send against you a shower of stones? Then soon you will know how was the consequence of My warning.

18.Fode Drame: And indeed those before them had belied but then how objectionable was My punishment?

19.Fode Drame: Have they not seen the birds above them unfolding their wings and folding them? Nothing holds them up except Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful]. Truly He is All-seeing about everything.

20.Fode Drame: And who is this who is an army for you who can help you besides Ar-Rahman[The All-Merciful]? Truly the disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.

21.Fode Drame: Who is this who can provide for you sustenance if He holds back His provision? Nay! They persist in [their] transgression and rebellion.

22.Fode Drame: Is He who walks cast down on his face better guided or one who walks straight on a path most upright?

23.Fode Drame: Say, “He it is who has made you and has appointed for you the hearing and the sights and the hearts.” How little do you offer gratitude.

24.Fode Drame: Say, “He it is who has proliferated you in the earth and unto Him you shall be gathered.”

25.Fode Drame: They say, “When will this promise come to pass if you are indeed truthful.”

26.Fode Drame: Say, “The knowledge is only with Allah and I am but a warner most evident.”

27.Fode Drame: So when they see it close at hand, the faces of those who disbelieve turn ill and it will be said, “This is that which you used to call for.”

28.Fode Drame: Say, “If Allah were to destroy me and those with me or grant us mercy, who then can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment.”

29.Fode Drame: Say, “That is Ar-Rahman [The All-merciful] We believe in Him and we put our trust in Him and soon you will know who it is who is in misguidance most evident.”

30.Fode Drame: Say, “See you that if your water some morning got sunken into the earth who then will provide you with fresh water?”

1.Fode Drame: Nun. By the pen and all that they write.

2.Fode Drame: You are not a madman with regards to the blessing of your Lord.

3.Fode Drame: And truly for you surely is a reward which will never cut off.

4.Fode Drame: And truly you surely are on a character most magnificent.

5.Fode Drame: So soon you will see and they will see,

6.Fode Drame: which one among you is the one vexed with tribulation.

7.Fode Drame: Truly your Lord, He it is who is All-knowing about who has gone astray from His way and He it is who is All-knowing about those who are well guided.

8.Fode Drame: So do not obey those who are the beliers.

9.Fode Drame: They would want if you could compromise towards them so that they too may compromise.

10.Fode Drame: And do not obey any such who is profuse in oaths, worthless,

11.Fode Drame: slanderous, propagator of foul gossip,

12.Fode Drame: withholder of the good, transgressor, sinful,

13.Fode Drame: overreaching, and beyond all that ignominious.

14.Fode Drame: [He is all this] because he has wealth and children?

15.Fode Drame: When Our signs are related unto him he says, “The tales of the ancients.”

16.Fode Drame: Soon We shall brand him on the nose.

17.Fode Drame: Truly We tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed that they would surely harvest it in the morning;

18.Fode Drame: and they did not make any exceptions [by saying ‘if Allah wills’].

19.Fode Drame: But a besieger from your Lord besieged it while they were sleeping.

20.Fode Drame: And by the morning it was like one completely harvested.

21.Fode Drame: So they called on one another in the morning.

22.Fode Drame: “That do go in the morning early to your crops if you indeed are going to harvest.”

23.Fode Drame: So they departed while they whispered to one another;

24.Fode Drame: that, “Surely let no needy one enter in it on you today.”

25.Fode Drame: And they went forth in the early morning with a youthful zest thinking they have the power [over their crop].

26.Fode Drame: But when they saw it they said, “We indeed most certainly have lost our way.

27.Fode Drame: Nay! Indeed we are the ones bereft [of our crop].”

28.Fode Drame: The righteous among them said, “Did I not tell you ‘why do you not glorify Allah?’”

29.Fode Drame: They said, “Glory be unto our Lord truly we have been of those who wronged their own souls.”

30.Fode Drame: Then they turned to one another blaming one another.

31.Fode Drame: They said, “Woe unto us. We indeed were transgressors.

32.Fode Drame: Perhaps our Lord may give us in replacement one better than it truly we turn back to our Lord in hope.”

33.Fode Drame: Such is the punishment [in the life of this world] but the punishment in the life of the hereafter surely is greater if only they do know.

34.Fode Drame: Truly for those who safeguard their own souls are gardens of the bliss in the presence of their Lord.

35.Fode Drame: Are we going to make those who submit themselves to Allah like the evildoers?

36.Fode Drame: What is amiss with you? What is this manner in which you make judgments?

37.Fode Drame: Or do you have a book in which you study?

38.Fode Drame: Then there is in it for you what to choose?

39.Fode Drame: Or are We under any obligation to you by virtue of a binding oath till the day of resurrection? That truly for you there is whatever you decide?

40.Fode Drame: Ask them which of them will stand as a guarantor for that?

41.Fode Drame: Or do they have ones that are partners with Allah then let them bring their partners if they indeed are truthful.

42.Fode Drame: The day when the veil from Saaq [Allah’s radiance] will be removed and they will be called to the prostration but they will not be able to do it.

43.Fode Drame: With sights cast down overwhelmed by humiliation and they indeed used to be called to the prostration while they were at peace [at heart].

44.Fode Drame: So leave Me alone with such a one who belies this story. We will lead them on from stage to stage from whence they know not.

45.Fode Drame: I give them respite for a while. Truly my stratagem is firm.

46.Fode Drame: Or is it that you ask them for a fee so that they are overburdened with debt?

47.Fode Drame: Or is it that the unseen is in their disposition so that they can write?

48.Fode Drame: Therefore wait patiently for the wise decision of your Lord and do not be like the companion of the fish when he called while he was in distress.

49.Fode Drame: Had not a grace from your Lord caught up with him, he would surely be cast on the arid shore while he was in a state of one worthy of reprove.

50.Fode Drame: But then your Lord raised him up and made him one among the righteous.

51.Fode Drame: And those who disbelieve nearly trip you down with their sights when they hear the remembrance and they say, “Truly he is surely a madman.”

52.Fode Drame: But it is nothing except a remembrance for the worlds.

1.Fode Drame: The clamor.

2.Fode Drame: What is the clamor?

3.Fode Drame: And what informs you about what the clamor is?

4.Fode Drame: Thamud and ‘Ad they belied the day of the dazing concussion.

5.Fode Drame: As for the Thamud they were destroyed by the sweeping deafening blast.

6.Fode Drame: And as for ‘Ad they were destroyed by an overriding freezing wind.

7.Fode Drame: He made it reign over them for seven nights and eight days of continuous succession. You see the people therein fell down as though they are trunks of hollow date-trees.

8.Fode Drame: So do you see any survivors from them?

9.Fode Drame: And Pharaoh and those before him and the cities that were toppled came up with the inequity.

10.Fode Drame: And they disobeyed messenger of their Lord so He seized them with a seizing exceedingly overwhelming.

11.Fode Drame: Truly when the water [of the flood] burst its boundaries We did carry you in the sailing ark.

12.Fode Drame: So that We may make it for you a reminder and that every comprehending ear might comprehend it.

13.Fode Drame: And when the trumpet is blown into with one blow.

14.Fode Drame: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and then crushed with one crushing.

15.Fode Drame: On that day the great event will come to pass.

16.Fode Drame: And the sky turns apart Lo! On that day it will be untenable.

17.Fode Drame: And the angels will be at different sides of it and eight will carry the throne of your Lord above them on that day.

18.Fode Drame: On that day you will be brought forward [to your Lord] and not one single hidden thing will remain hidden about you.

19.Fode Drame: As for him whose book will be given to him in his right hand, then he will say, “Here you are! Read all of you my book!”

20.Fode Drame: Truly I was expecting that I am surely going to meet my reckoning.

21.Fode Drame: So he will be in a life most pleasant,

22.Fode Drame: in a garden most high,

23.Fode Drame: its fruits most near at hand.

24.Fode Drame: Eat you and drink with congratulation for all that you had sent ahead in the days past.

25.Fode Drame: And as for him whose book will be given to him in his left hand, he will say, “Would that I was never given my book.

26.Fode Drame: That I never knew my reckoning.

27.Fode Drame: Would that it were a final death.

28.Fode Drame: My wealth has been of no avail to me.

29.Fode Drame: My authority has perished away from me.”

30.Fode Drame: [It will be said], “Seize him and fetter him.

31.Fode Drame: Then in the blazing fire burn him.

32.Fode Drame: Thereafter put him into a chain the length of which is seventy cubits.

33.Fode Drame: Truly he did not use to believe in Allah, The Most-magnificent,

34.Fode Drame: nor did he use to exhort to the feeding of the needy one.

35.Fode Drame: So today there is no friend for him here.

36.Fode Drame: and nothing to eat except from the pus.”

37.Fode Drame: None will eat it except those who are the iniquitous.

38.Fode Drame: So I do take oath by that which you see.

39.Fode Drame: And by that which you see not.

40.Fode Drame: That it indeed truly is word of a messenger most gracious.

41.Fode Drame: And it is not word of a poet. Little is that which you believe.

42.Fode Drame: Nor is it word of a soothsayer. Little is that which you remember.

43.Fode Drame: It is sent down from Lord of the worlds.

44.Fode Drame: And were he to attribute any false statements unto Us.

45.Fode Drame: We would have surely seized him by the right hand.

46.Fode Drame: Then We would cut from him the life-vein.

47.Fode Drame: And there is no one among you who can stand between him [and Our punishment].

48.Fode Drame: And it indeed is truly a reminder for those who revere Allah.

49.Fode Drame: And We indeed truly know that among you are those who are beliers.

50.Fode Drame: And it indeed truly is a sorrow on the disbelievers.

51.Fode Drame: And it indeed is truly truth of the certitude.

52.Fode Drame: So glorify the name of your Lord, The Most-magnificent.

1.Fode Drame: A questioner questioned regarding a punishment that is going to come to pass.

2.Fode Drame: From the disbelievers there is not going to be any who can ward it off.

3.Fode Drame: From Allah, Lord of the exalted ranks.

4.Fode Drame: The angels and the spirit ascent onto Him in a day the value of which was fifty thousand years.

5.Fode Drame: Therefore be patient with a most nicely patience.

6.Fode Drame: Truly they see it far.

7.Fode Drame: And We see it close.

8.Fode Drame: A day on which the sky will be like molten brass.

9.Fode Drame: And the mountains will be like cotton wool.

10.Fode Drame: And no friend will ask about a friend.

11.Fode Drame: Although they will be in the sight of one another. The evildoer will wish if he could save himself from the punishment of that day by giving in ransom his children,

12.Fode Drame: and his spouse, and his brother,

13.Fode Drame: and his family which gives him shelter,

14.Fode Drame: and all those in the earth altogether,- so that they may save him.

15.Fode Drame: Not at all! There is nothing indeed [for him] except blazing fire.

16.Fode Drame: Which pulls away the skin.

17.Fode Drame: It invites anyone who turned his back in denial and turned away from remembrance.

18.Fode Drame: And collected [wealth] and then hoarded it.

19.Fode Drame: Truly the human being was created anxious.

20.Fode Drame: When evil touches him, he is filled with concern for himself.

21.Fode Drame: But when the good touches him, he is stingy.

22.Fode Drame: Except those who are steadfast in [their] prayers.

23.Fode Drame: Those who are constant in their prayers.

24.Fode Drame: And those in whose wealth there is a right well marked out

25.Fode Drame: for the beggar and the bereaved.

26.Fode Drame: And those who believe the day of recompense to be true.

27.Fode Drame: And those who are solicitous of the punishment of their Lord.

28.Fode Drame: For indeed none is deemed secure from the punishment of their Lord.

29.Fode Drame: And those who safeguard their chastity.

30.Fode Drame: Except to their spouses or to those that their right hands possess, for then indeed they are not to be blamed.

31.Fode Drame: But any who seeks to go beyond that, truly they are the transgressors.

32.Fode Drame: And those who look after their trusts and their covenants.

33.Fode Drame: And those who stand upright for their witnesses.

34.Fode Drame: And those who take good care of their prayers.

35.Fode Drame: It is they who are going to be honored with grace in gardens.

36.Fode Drame: Then what is the matter with those who disbelieve that they scurry in front of you?

37.Fode Drame: In throngs from the right and from the left.

38.Fode Drame: Does every individual among them wish to be entered into garden of bliss?

39.Fode Drame: Not at all! We indeed have created them out of that which they know.

40.Fode Drame: I do swear by the Lord of the easts and of the wests, truly We certainly have the power.

41.Fode Drame: To replace them with ones better than them and We are not going to be outstripped.

42.Fode Drame: So leave them to wade in their idleness and to play till they meet their day which they are promised.

43.Fode Drame: The day they will come forth from the graves in hurry as though they are pouring out towards monuments.

44.Fode Drame: Their sights cast down overwhelmed with humiliation. That is the day which they used to be promised.

1.Fode Drame: We indeed sent Noah to his people [saying], “Do warn your people before a painful punishment comes upon them.”

2.Fode Drame: He said, “O my people! I indeed for you am a warner most evident.

3.Fode Drame: That you should serve Allah and revere Him and obey me.

4.Fode Drame: Then He will forgive you your sins and will give you respite till an appointed term. Truly when Allah’s term comes, it is not delayed if you only knew.”

5.Fode Drame: He said, “O my Lord! I indeed have called my people night and day.

6.Fode Drame: But my call increased them in nothing except in flight.”

7.Fode Drame: And indeed each time I call them so that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears and they cover their faces with their dresses and they persisted and they grew more arrogant in their arrogance.

8.Fode Drame: Then I indeed called them openly.

9.Fode Drame: Then I indeed made the call public for them and made the call private for them.

10.Fode Drame: So I told them, “Seek forgiveness from your Lord, for He truly is Oft-Forgiving.

11.Fode Drame: Then He will send the rain on you in abundance.

12.Fode Drame: And He will provide you with plenty of wealth and children and He will make for you gardens and He will make for you rivers.

13.Fode Drame: What is the matter with you that you do not conceive dignity for Allah?

14.Fode Drame: When it is He indeed Who created you stage by stage.

15.Fode Drame: Do you not see how Allah created seven heavens in layers?

16.Fode Drame: And He put the moon therein as a light and He made the sun a brilliant lamp.

17.Fode Drame: And Allah made you grow out of the earth a growing.

18.Fode Drame: And then He will put you back therein and He will bring you out [of it] a bringing.

19.Fode Drame: And Allah has made the earth for you smooth and in level.

20.Fode Drame: So that you may travel in it in ways wide and extended.”

21.Fode Drame: Noah said, “O My Lord! They have indeed disobeyed me and have followed one whose wealth and children increase him in nothing except loss.

22.Fode Drame: And they plotted a mighty plot.

23.Fode Drame: And they said, ‘Abandon not your gods and abandon not the Wadda nor Suwa’ nor Yaghootha nor Yaooqa nor Nasra.’

24.Fode Drame: And they indeed have caused many to go astray so do not increase the wrongdoers except in misguidance.”

25.Fode Drame: Because of their inequities, they were drowned and they were made to enter a fire but they found no helpers for them besides Allah.

26.Fode Drame: And Noah said, “O my Lord! Do not leave on the earth from the disbelievers anyone to walk around.

27.Fode Drame: For indeed if you leave them [in the earth], they will misguide Your servants and they will breed nothing but transgressing disbeliever.

28.Fode Drame: O my Lord! Grant me forgiveness and unto my both parents and unto such who enters my house as a believer and unto all the believing men and believing women and increase not the wrongdoers except in destruction.”

1.Fode Drame: Say:, It has been revealed unto me that a company from the Jinn had listened and they said, ”We have indeed heard a Quran most marvelous.

2.Fode Drame: It guides to the right way so we believed in it and we will never ascribe anyone as a partner to our Lord.

3.Fode Drame: And that indeed exalted is the glory of our Lord. He has not taken unto Himself a spouse or a son.

4.Fode Drame: And that indeed the foolish one among us used to tell enormities about Allah.

5.Fode Drame: And that indeed we thought that the humans and the jinn were never going to say a lie about Allah.

6.Fode Drame: And that indeed there used to be some men from the humans who used to seek refuge with some men from the Jinn but they [Jinns] only increased them [humans] in distress.

7.Fode Drame: And that indeed they thought just as you thought that Allah is never going to raise anyone as a messenger.

8.Fode Drame: And that indeed we reached out to the heaven but we found it filled with mighty guards and with flames.

9.Fode Drame: And that indeed we used to take up stations there at for eavesdropping. But whosoever eavesdrops now, he will find a flame lying in wait for him.

10.Fode Drame: And that indeed we do not know if it is an ill that is intended against those in the earth or that their Lord intends right guidance for them.

11.Fode Drame: And that indeed among us are the righteous and among us are those who are aught else other than that and that indeed we were of divergent ways.

12.Fode Drame: And that indeed we thought that we will never go beyond the reach of Allah in the earth and that we will never go beyond His reach by flight.

13.Fode Drame: And that indeed when we heard the guidance we believed in it and whoever believes in his Lord, then he will have no fear of cheating nor of distress.

14.Fode Drame: And that among us are those who are the ones who have wholly submitted themselves to Allah and among us are those who have submitted themselves with a reserve and whosoever wholly submits himself to Allah, truly they have sought the right guidance.

15.Fode Drame: And as for those who submit themselves with a reserve, truly they are firewood of the hellfire.”

16.Fode Drame: And if only they had remained upright on the path, We would have certainly given them water to drink in abundance.

17.Fode Drame: So that We may try them thereby and whosoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will make him go through a punishment most mounting.

18.Fode Drame: And that the houses of prayer are only for Allah so none should be invoked along with Allah.

19.Fode Drame: And that indeed when the servant of Allah stood up to invoke Him alone, they nearly thronged around him like the crests from the neck of the horse.

20.Fode Drame: Say, “I only invoke my Lord and I do not ascribe any as a partner to Him.”

21.Fode Drame: Say, “I have no power of control over harm for you nor over right guidance.”

22.Fode Drame: Say, “As for me indeed no one will ever deliver me from Allah and I will never find besides Him anyone to take refuge in.”

23.Fode Drame: It is but a deliverance of the message from Allah and from His messages and whoever disobeys Allah and His messenger, truly there is hellfire for him to abide therein forever.

24.Fode Drame: Until when they see that which they are promised then they will know who is weaker as a helper and who is less in numbers.

25.Fode Drame: Say, “I all but know whether near it is that which you are promised or that my Lord is going to give it an extension.”

26.Fode Drame: Knower of the unseen nor does He cause anyone to take a look at His unseen.

27.Fode Drame: Except such a one as He pleases from a messenger then He indeed will cause a guard to go ahead of him and from behind him.

28.Fode Drame: So that He may ascertain that they indeed have delivered the messages of their Lord and that He has encompassed in knowledge all that is with them and has thoroughly taken a count of everything.

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Fode Drame: O you the one wrapped.

2.Fode Drame: Stand [for the prayer] through the night except for a little;

3.Fode Drame: half of it or make it a little less than that.

4.Fode Drame: Or make it more than that and recite the Quran with a careful recitation.

5.Fode Drame: We indeed are soon going to deliver unto you a heavy word.

6.Fode Drame: Truly the growing hours of the night are greater in impact and most upright in speech.

7.Fode Drame: Truly in the day there is for you a lengthy course of adoration.

8.Fode Drame: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with a whole devotion;

9.Fode Drame: Lord of the East and of the West. There is no deity except He, therefore take Him as a trustee.

10.Fode Drame: And bear with patience all that they say and forsake them with a nicely forsaking.

11.Fode Drame: And leave Me alone and the beliers who are possessors of the blessing and give them a little respite.

12.Fode Drame: Truly with Us are fetters and a burning fire.

13.Fode Drame: And food which chokes [the eater] and a painful punishment.

14.Fode Drame: The day when the earth and the mountains will quake and the mountains become sand dunes which flow.

15.Fode Drame: Truly We have sent unto you a messenger as a witness over you as We sent a messenger unto the pharaoh.
