16.Fode Drame: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger so We seized him with a terrible seizing.

17.Fode Drame: And how then if you disbelieve will you safeguard yourself against a day that will make children turn grey?

18.Fode Drame: The heaven will rent asunder thereat and truly His promise must come to pass.

19.Fode Drame: Truly this is a reminder so whoever pleases let him take a path to his Lord.

20.Fode Drame: Truly your Lord knows that you indeed stand [in prayer] for a little less than two thirds of the night and half of it and one third of it and so does a party of those who are with you. And Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you will not be able to keep count of it so He turned to you in repentance therefore recite that which is easy from the Quran. He knows that there will be among you sick ones and others travelling in the earth seeking from the bounty of Allah and others fighting in the way of Allah so recite whatever is easy thereof. So establish the prayer and offer the sanctifying dues and loan to Allah an excellent loan. And whatever good you send forth for your own souls, you will find it in Allah’s presence. That is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness from Allah. Truly Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Fode Drame: O you the one wrapped in cloak.

2.Fode Drame: Rise up and warn.

3.Fode Drame: And your Lord! Do proclaim His greatness.

4.Fode Drame: And your garment, keep it clean.

5.Fode Drame: And the abominations, do forsake.

6.Fode Drame: And do not boast about your gifts in order to seek aggrandizement for yourself.

7.Fode Drame: And for your Lord, be patient.

8.Fode Drame: But when the trumpet will sound.

9.Fode Drame: Then that day indeed is a most difficult day.

10.Fode Drame: For disbelievers it is not easy at all.

11.Fode Drame: Leave me alone with such one whom I have created all alone.

12.Fode Drame: And I provided him with extensive wealth.

13.Fode Drame: And with sons all in his presence.

14.Fode Drame: And I have paved his way [in life] with a nicely paving.

15.Fode Drame: But yet he greedily desires that I increase.

16.Fode Drame: Not at all! He truly goes wayward to Our signs.

17.Fode Drame: Soon I will compel him to endure a mounting ordeal.

18.Fode Drame: Truly he reflected and he calculated.

19.Fode Drame: And accursed be he how he calculated.

20.Fode Drame: And then again accursed be he how he calculated.

21.Fode Drame: Then he peered.

22.Fode Drame: Then he frowned and he scowled.

23.Fode Drame: Then he turned back and he grew arrogant.

24.Fode Drame: Then he said, “This is nothing but magic inherited from the past.

25.Fode Drame: It is nothing but word of mortal humans. ”

26.Fode Drame: And soon I will make him burn into a fire that cuts to pieces.

27.Fode Drame: And what do you know about what Saqar [a fire that cuts to pieces] is?

28.Fode Drame: It does not allow anything to remain nor anything to be left.

29.Fode Drame: It chars the skin of man.

30.Fode Drame: In charge of it are nineteen.

31.Fode Drame: We have not made the guardians of the fire except angels and We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve so that those who are given the book may arrive at certitude and those who have faith may increase in faith and so that those who are given the book would not doubt and so would the believers and so that those who have sickness in their heart and the disbelievers may say, “What did Allah intend by this as a similitude?” Thus Allah causes to go astray whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases and none knows with certainty the hosts of your Lord except He and it is but a reminder for the human.

32.Fode Drame: Not at all! By the moon.

33.Fode Drame: And by the night when it had departed.

34.Fode Drame: And by the morn when it has shone forth.

35.Fode Drame: This indeed truly is one of the great signs.

36.Fode Drame: A warning for the humans.

37.Fode Drame: For whomsoever among you who wishes to go forward or backward.

38.Fode Drame: Every soul is impounded by that which it has earned.

39.Fode Drame: Except the people of the right hand;

40.Fode Drame: in gardens asking one another

41.Fode Drame: about the evildoers,

42.Fode Drame: “What made you enter into Saqar [a fire that cuts into pieces]?”

43.Fode Drame: They said, “We were not among those who were dutiful in their prayers

44.Fode Drame: and we were not of those who fed the needy ones

45.Fode Drame: and we used to wade with the waders

46.Fode Drame: and we used to belie the day of the recompense

47.Fode Drame: until the certitude [death] came upon us.”

48.Fode Drame: Then intercession of the interceders will not benefit them.

49.Fode Drame: So what was the matter with them that they used to turn away from the remembrance.

50.Fode Drame: As though they were routed wild donkeys.

51.Fode Drame: In flight from a lion.

52.Fode Drame: Nay! Each person among them wants to be given a book which is set in detail.

53.Fode Drame: Not at all! Nay they fear not the hereafter.

54.Fode Drame: Not at all! It indeed is a reminder.

55.Fode Drame: So let him who pleases keep it in remembrance.

56.Fode Drame: But they will not keep it in remembrance except if Allah pleases. He is the Owner of the reverence and He is the Master of the forgiveness.

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

1.Fode Drame: Indeed I swear by the day of the resurrection.

2.Fode Drame: And Indeed I swear by the blaming soul.

3.Fode Drame: Does the human being think that We will never put together his bones?

4.Fode Drame: Yes indeed, We are able to make his fingers in perfect symmetry.

5.Fode Drame: Nay! The human being wants to foresee what is ahead of him.

6.Fode Drame: He asks, “When will be the day of the resurrection.”

7.Fode Drame: But when the sight gets snatched away.

8.Fode Drame: And the moon is eclipsed.

9.Fode Drame: And the sun and the moon are made into one.

10.Fode Drame: The human being will say that day, “Where is the place for escape?”

11.Fode Drame: Not at all! There is no place for refuge.

12.Fode Drame: The final resting place that day is with your Lord.

13.Fode Drame: The human being will be informed that day about all that he had sent forth and all that he had sent back.

14.Fode Drame: Nay! The human being is quite a witness over his own soul.

15.Fode Drame: Even though he may put forward his excuses.

16.Fode Drame: Do not move your tongue with it in order to hasten with it.

17.Fode Drame: Indeed its gathering and recitation is upon Us.

18.Fode Drame: So when We have recited it, then follow its recitation.

19.Fode Drame: Then after it indeed it will be upon Us to explicate it.

20.Fode Drame: Not at all! Nay. You love the present [life].

21.Fode Drame: But you abandon the hereafter.

22.Fode Drame: Some faces on that day will be bright.
